column1: 11;7f90d71cc69893f4c91e8a55f2c4da52d88cd7c1;0;Fed Up;2016-11-09T17:28:00.000+02:00;SAY GOODBYE! These 23 Hollywood Celebs Threatened To Leave The U.S....Let's Hold Them To It! » 100percentfedUp.com;"
Who? Comedian.
Where would she move? Spain. “I did buy a house in another country just in case
column2: so all of these people that threaten to leave the country and then don’t
column3: I will leave the country
column4: ” she said on Live with Kelly and Michael.

column1: (Weirdly
column2: she called Trump charming in the same interview.)

column1: 3. Neve Campbell
Who? House of Cards actress.
Where would she move? Canada.
“His honesty is terrifying
column2: ” she told Huffington Post UK.

column1: 4. Barry Diller
Who? Founder of IAC Interactive.
Where would he move? Unspecified.
“If Donald Trump doesn’t fall
column2: I’ll either move out of the country or join the resistance
column3: ” he told Bloomberg.

column1: 5. Lena Dunham
Who? Creator of Girls.
Where would she move? Vancouver.
“I know a lot of people have been threatening to do this
column2: but I really will
column3: ” she said at the Matrix Awards.

column1: 6. Keegan-Michael Key
Who? Star of Key & Peele.
Where would he move? Canada.
“It’s easy. It’s like 10 minutes from Detroit and that’s where I’m from
column2: ” he told TMZ.

column1: 7. Chloë Sevigny
Who? Actress and guest star in Portlandia.
Where would she move? Nova Scotia.
She answered simply
column2: “Nova Scotia” to a question of where she would move if Trump were elected.

column1: 8. Al Sharpton
Who? Activist.
Where would he move? Out of here.
“If Donald Trump is the nominee
column2: I’m open to support anyone
column3: while I’m also reserving my ticket out of here if he wins
column4: ” he said at a press conference.

column1: 9. Natasha Lyonne
Who? Actress in Orange Is the New Black.
Where would she move? A mental hospital.
“[I’ll move] to a mental hospital for a while because you’re like ‘why is this happening?’” she said.
10. Eddie Griffin
Who? Comedian.
Where would he move? Africa.
“He’s good at making money
column2: but he’s ignorant…If Trump wins
column3: I’m moving to Africa
column4: ” he told DJ Vlad.

column1: 11. Spike Lee
Who? Director of Malcolm X.
Where would he move? …Brooklyn.
If Trump wins
column2: he’ll be “moving back to the republic of Brooklyn
column3: New York
column4: ” he reported to Vanity Fair.

column1: 12. Amber Rose
Who? Model.
Where would she move? Unspecified.
“I can’t even think about it! I’m moving
column2: I’m out! I can’t. And I am taking my son with me!” she told US Weekly.

column1: 13. Samuel L. Jackson
Who? Actor.
Where would he move? South Africa.
“He’s just running for popularity. C’mon
column2: just let it go
column3: ” he said on The View.

column1: 14. Cher
Where would she move? Jupiter
“IF HE WERE TO BE ELECTED
column2: IM MOVING TO JUPITER >:|” she tweeted.

column1: 15. George Lopez
Who? Comedian and star of George Lopez.
Where would he move? Mexico.
“If he wins
column2: he won’t have to worry about immigration
column3: we’ll all go back
column4: ” he told TMZ.

column1: 16. Barbra Streisand
Who? Singer.
Where would she move? Australia or Canada.
“He has no facts. I don’t know
column2: I can’t believe it. I’m either coming to your country [Australia]
column3: if you’ll let me in
column4: or Canada
column5: ” she told Australian journalist Michael Usher.

column1: 17. Raven-Symoné
Who? Actress and host of The View.
Where would she move? Canada.
“My confession for this election is if any Republican gets nominated
column2: I’m going to move to Canada with my entire family. I already have my ticket
column3: ” she said on The View.

column1: Note: Her leaving was contingent on any Republican candidate winning the election–not just Trump.
18. Whoopi Goldberg
Who? Actress and host of The View.
Where would she move? Unspecified.
“I don’t want it to be America. Maybe it’s time for me to move
column2: you know
column3: ” she said.

column1: 19. Omari Hardwick
Who? Actor in Power.
Where would he move? Italy.
“I’ll move from Denver to Italy… If Donald Trump wins the presidency
column2: I’m out
column3: ” he told The Wrap.

column1: 20. Miley Cyrus
Who? Pop star.
Where would she move? Unspecified.
“My heart is broken into a 1 pieces…I am moving if this is my president! I don’t say things I don’t mean!” she wrote in an Instagram post.
21. Ruth Bader Ginsburg
Who? Supreme Court Justice.
Where would she move? New Zealand.
“I can’t imagine what the country would be with Donald Trump as our president… Now it’s time for us to move to New Zealand
column2: ” she told The New York Times.

column1: 22. Amy Schumer
Who? Comedian and actress.
Where would she move? Spain.
“I will need to learn to speak Spanish because I will move to Spain or somewhere… It’s beyond my comprehension if Trump won. It’s too crazy
column2: ” she told BBC Newsnight.

53;a36405a8d7d32c2192b9a9b482dcf0ebc83c62eb;0;Mike Rivero;2016-11-23T00:49:00.000+02:00;FLASHBACK - Hillary Clinton’s ‘KKK’ Smear Against Trump was Democrat Strategy;"November 21
column2: 2016 By 21wire Leave a Comment

column1: William McGurn Wall Street Journal

Let’s get this straight. Calling Hillary Clinton a “bigot” has reporters asking every Republican in sight if Donald Trump has gone too far. But the Clinton campaign releases a video saying Mr. Trump is the candidate of the Ku Klux Klan
column2: and it’s all okey-dokey?

column1: Then again
column2: Mr. Trump has already been likened to Hitler
column3: Mussolini and Stalin. Small wonder there’s a collective ho-hum when Democratic vice presidential nominee Tim Kaine says Mr. Trump is peddling “KKK values.”

column1: This is what Democrats do. It didn’t start with Mr. Trump
column2: either. For years Democrats have portrayed the GOP as one giant hate group.

column1: Each presidential election
column2: the drill goes like this:

column1: After Republicans nominate someone
column2: he immediately finds himself having to prove he’s not a hater – of African-Americans
column3: of women
column4: of gays
column5: etc.

column1: This year Democrats added a twist. Mr. Trump
column2: they claim
column3: represents a break with all those decent and lovable Republicans such as Mitt Romney
column4: John McCain and George W. Bush . Of course
column5: this isn’t what they were saying back when these men were running for president.

column2: for example
column3: an NAACP ad recreated the gruesome murder of James Byrd to imply that then-Gov. Bush was sympathetic to lynching black men. Over footage of a chain being dragged by a pickup truck
column4: Mr. Byrd’s daughter says
column5: “So when Gov. George W. Bush refused to support hate-crimes legislation
column6: it was like my father was killed all over again.”

column1: • When John McCain ran in 2008
column2: Barack Obama warned that Republicans would scare people by saying
column3: “You know
column4: he doesn’t look like all those other presidents on those dollar bills.” The McCain campaign fired back
column5: accusing Mr. Obama of playing the race card from the “bottom of the deck.” Funny thing: All those reporters always hearing “dog whistles” from Republicans somehow didn’t hear this one.

column2: when Mitt Romney went to the NAACP and told them face-to-face about his opposition to ObamaCare
column3: the stories were all about how he was really just trolling for the racist vote. Vice President Joe Biden put it more explicitly
column4: telling a largely African-American audience that if Mr. Romney were to win
column5: he’d “put ya’ll back in chains.”

column1: The only difference today is that Republicans now have a nominee giving as good as he gets…";english;2016-11-23T01:36:58.899+02:00;21stcenturywire.com;US;;FLASHBACK - Hillary Clinton’s ‘KKK’ Smear Against Trump was Democrat Strategy;0.0;http://i2.wp.com/21stcenturywire.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/1-Clinton-KKK-Democratic-Party.jpg?fit=610%2C415;0;1;0;0;0;conspiracy

Really?” The elephant in the room: HOW LONG HAS THE FBI KNOWN that new Hillary emails... ;english;2016-10-29T22:20:10.208+03:00;activistpost.com;US;37161.0;FBI Reopens Hillary Email Probe: Why Did It Take So Long?;0.0;;0;1;0;0;0;conspiracy
287;59af19dddc087cd7c169e73b3269ba6a34997ea9;0;Activist Post;2016-10-31T17:05:11.328+02:00;The Globalization Of Media: A Failing Strike Force;"By Jon Rappoport
I begin this piece with three quotes from my work-in-progress
column2: The Underground:

column1: “There is a media metaphysics. Its basic principle states that nothing exists until it becomes information. Now we have a new twist: information only becomes real when it reaches a mind already attuned to it. In other words
column2: the tree falling in the forest makes a sound only if a user/consumer who wants a tree to fall receives video and audio of the event…”

column1: “Information can be dressed up a thousand different ways. But it tends to have an ‘elastic’ quality. By that I mean you eventually get to see the person who dressed it up. That’s a problem for chronic liars who inhabit the press. They expose themselves
column2: even though they don’t want to. It takes a surprisingly small push to expose the whole operation. This is happening now
column3: right in front of our eyes.”

column1: “The basis of big media is theater. News is theater. Its directors and producers think they’re doing a first-rate job. But they’re sadly mistaken. Gaps and obfuscations are growing larger. The outright non-sequiturs and gibberish are becoming more apparent. The audience is wising up to the farce. Who are these fools who direct the news? They’re simply people who want to sell their souls and have found an elite buyer. But that transaction doesn’t contain any guarantees about shelf life. Mainstream news is decaying
column2: and the expiration date is approaching. Like civilizations
column3: the petty princes of information rise and fall…”

column1: Globalized media. It’s nice plan. Let’s examine it.
The new technocratic media is based on profiling users. There is no impactful news unless each member of the audience is surveilled and analyzed on the basis of what he already likes and wants.
Shocking? It’s to be expected. How else would technocrats parlay the untold hours they’ve spent sizing up their consumers/users?
Several years ago
column2: I wrote: “Tech blather has already begun
column3: since Jeff Bezos
column4: CEO of Amazon
column5: bought the Washington Post at a fire sale. Jeff Genius will invent new ways to transmit the news to ‘people on the go’ and make the Post a smashing success. Mobile devices. Multiple platforms. Digital taking over from print. Ads customized to fit readers’ interests (profiling). News stories customized to fit readers’ interests (more profiling).”

column1: In other words
column2: non-news. If you thought media were irrelevant and deceptive before
column3: you haven’t seen anything. The “new news” will create millions of virtual bubbles in which profiled users can float contentedly
column4: under the cozy cottage roofs of their favorite little separate paradigms.

column1: The tech giant Apple has waded into this territory with an app that will deliver news to users. Yahoo: “Apple News
column2: part of the upcoming iOS 9 operating system
column3: aims to be the primary news source for users of the iPhone and iPad… Apple says its news app ‘follows over a million topics and pulls relevant stories based on your specific interests’… Joshua Benton of the Nieman Journalism Lab said the app will be important because ‘through the awesome power of default
column4: Apple distribution puts it in an entirely other league. This [news] app will be on hundreds of millions of devices within 24 hours of its debut’.”

column1: Translation: Profiling their users down to their toenails
column2: Apple will present them with virtual bubbles of news they want to see and read.

column1: Not just one overall presentation for all; no
column2: different “news outlets” for Apple’s audiences.

column1: This introduces a whole new layer of mind control.
“You’re an Obama fan? Here are stories confirming your belief in the Prophet.”
“You want neo-con on the rocks with a conservative Republican twist? Here’s some war footage that’ll warm your heart.”
“Do you believe ‘government gridlock’ is our biggest concern? Congress can’t get anything done? We’ve got headlines for that from here to the moon.”
“Tuned into celeb gossip? Here’s your world in three minutes.”
The idea: convince users
column2: one day at a time
column3: that what they already believe is important IS the news of the day.

column1: It’s Decentralized Centralization. One media giant carving its global audience up into little pieces and delivering them a whole host of different algorithmically appropriate lies and fluff and no-context psyops.
And for “fringe users?” “You’re doubtful about GMOs? Well
column2: look at what Whole Foods is planning for their healthier produce section. Cheer up.” Nothing about Maui voters declaring a temporary ban on devastatingly toxic Monsanto/Dow experiments or the dangers of Roundup. “You’re anti-vaccine? Sorry
column3: you don’t count. You’re not a recognized demographic. But here’s a piece about a little unvaccinated boy who was involved in car crash on the I5.”

column1: Does this sound like science fiction? It isn’t. It’s the mainstream look of the near-future. Search engines are already “personalizing” your inquiries. US ABC national news is climbing in the ratings because it’s giving viewers “lighter stories
column2: ” and spending less time on thorny issues like the Middle East.

column1: The mainstream news business is desperately looking for audience; and treating every “user” as a profiled social-construct-bundle of superficial preferences is their answer.
“Mr. X
column2: we’ve studied the little virtual bubble you live in
column3: and now we can sell you your own special brand of truth.”

column1: “Hello
column2: audience. We’re going to pitch you on becoming full-fledged obsessed consumers
column3: as if there is no other worthy goal in life—and then we’re going to profile you from top to bottom
column4: to find out exactly what kind of obsessed consumer you are
column5: so we can hit you and trigger you with information that uniquely stimulates your adrenal glands…”

column1: The one-two punch.
Any actual event occurring in the world will be pre-digested by robot media editors and profilers
column2: and then split up into variously programmed bits of information for different audiences.

column1: Who cares what really happened? In the new world
column2: there is no ‘what really happened’. That’s a gross misnomer. A faulty idea. A metaphysical error. No
column3: there is only a multi-forked media tongue that simultaneously spits out a dozen or a hundred variations of the same event…because different viewers want and expect different realities.

column2: Orwell’s Big Brother was issuing a single voice into the homes of the population. That was old-school. That was primitive technology. That was achieving unity by hammering unity into people’s skulls. This
column3: now
column4: is the frontier of unity through diversity.

column1: “We want to make all of you into androids
column2: through basic PR and propaganda and a pathetic excuse for education. However
column3: we recognize you’ll become different varieties of androids
column4: and we’ll serve that outcome with technological sophistication. Trust us. We care about what you prefer.”

column1: User A: “Wow
column2: did you see the coverage of the border war in Chula Vista?”

column1: User B: “War? They had a fantastic exhibit of drones down there. At least a hundred different types. And then I watched an old WW2 movie about aerial combat.”
User C: “Chula Vista? They had a great food show. This woman made a lemon pie. I could practically taste it.”
User D: “That wasn’t a border war. It was a drill. And then afterwards
column2: these cops gave a demonstration of all their gear. Vests
column3: shields
column4: communication devices
column5: flash-bangs
column6: auto rifles with silencers
column7: batons. I watch drills all over the country. Love them.”

column1: User E: “Chula Vista? The only thing I saw on the news was ‘sunny and mild’ this week. I watch all the weather channels. I love them.”
BUT when a Big One comes along
column2: like the 2016 national election in the US
column3: the separate tunes come together and ring as one. Then the overriding need to extend Globalism’s goals (in the person of Hillary Clinton) blot out every other priority. Then the major media twist whatever they need to twist. Then it’s the same bubble for everyone.

column1: One problem
column2: though. Major media have been lanced thousands of times by alt news sites
column3: and by WikiLeaks and Project Veritas. This attack has exposed the truth and the Clinton crimes.

column1: And alt news reflects the growing interest of the public in what’s actually happening on many fronts.
The technocratic plan for the news is failing.
It was a nice plan
column2: but…

column1: It’s turning out to be a dud.

Alt media are forcing public awareness of one giant scandal after another: Hillary/Obama support for ISIS; pro-vaccine liars; the collapse of Obamacare; the GMO hustle; pesticide damage…on and on and on.
The result? Major media are being backed into a corner
column2: where they must defend lies and build monolithic lies for EVERYONE all the time. The idea of creating separate news for each profiled user is collapsing.

column1: Major media are playing defense against the rest of the world.
It’s quite a party.
And it has no expiration date.
A final note: Trump
column2: WikiLeaks
column3: Project Veritas
column4: Drudge
column5: and many alt news sites created a perfect storm in 2016
column6: raining down on major media. It was and is unprecedented. The mainstream press has been exposed down to its roots
column7: as never before. The lying
column8: the collusion
column9: the arrogant sense of entitlement
column10: the desperation
column11: the corruption—it’s all there to see
column12: for anyone who has eyes and a few working brain cells. Expect more to come
column13: regardless of the outcome of the election. The train has really left the station…

column1: 303;3f9475b17cff16ea2aee6247c3addbc002585f4b;0;Activist Post;2016-11-02T04:38:47.251+02:00;Someone Just Donated $2.5 Million to Bail Out Everyone Arrested at Standing Rock;"By Nick Bernabe
Following the recent mass arrests of 141 people at the Dakota Access Pipeline construction site located near Standing Rock
column2: North Dakota
column3: an anonymous donor just donated $2.5 million to bail out everyone who was arrested at the protests.

column1: The news came after Tamara Francis-Fourkiller
column2: a tribal leader from the Caddo Nation tribe in Caddo County
column3: Oklahoma
column4: was arrested at Standing Rock. Francis-Fourkiller was released after spending two days in jail
column5: but her family says she was just an innocent observer in the clashes between militarized law enforcement and Native American activists
column6: or “water protectors.”

column1: [ UPDATE 11/1 4:35 pm EST: A statement from Red Owl Legal Collective/National Lawyers Guild that is advising Standing Rock has issued a statement saying the $2.5 million has not been received yet. We are waiting on confirmation from the Caddo Nation tribe.]
According to local news affiliate News On 6 :

Family members of Caddo Nation chairwoman Tamara Francis-Fourkiller said an anonymous donor paid $2.5 million late Saturday afternoon to release everyone arrested on Thursday at the Dakota Access Pipeline site. They said
column2: however
column3: that Francis-Fourkiller should not have been arrested in the first place.

column1: Though the donor who sent the $2.5 million remains anonymous
column2: it appears the person is connected to the Caddo Nation tribe in some way .";english;2016-11-02T04:38:47.251+02:00;activistpost.com;US;37161.0;Someone Just Donated $2.5 Million to Bail Out Everyone Arrested at Standing Rock;0.0;http://www.activistpost.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/dapl-arrests.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;conspiracy

336;cd54e63fd137f22219c6c4beba24de524fc6d56c;0;Activist Post;2016-11-06T17:57:39.233+02:00;Leaked Memo: Clinton Foundation Broke The Law;"By Jon Rappoport
Breaking: leaked 2008 memo from attorney Kumiki Gibson to Clinton Foundation chairman Bruce Lindsay. Gibson had been hired to do an independent assessment of the Foundation’s practices.
Below are key quotes from Gibson’s findings. Keep in mind that the Clinton Foundation’s very existence depends on it being legally certified as a non-profit entity
column2: in compliance with laws governing non-profits. Break those laws and its non-profit status would be revoked
column3: and the whole operation would go down the drain.

column1: Gibson: “Important responsibilities regarding corporate filings are delegated to the [Foundation] CFO
column2: who appears to delegate them to an outside organization
column3: with very little oversight by the legal department. As a result
column4: the Foundation is not in compliance with the filings rules
column5: including in New York
column6: which requires the Foundation to be certified to do business in the State.” [Apparently
column7: the Clinton Foundation was not legally registered as a non-profit in New York.]

column1: Gibson: “No matter what the leadership decides about the larger
column2: over-arching question
column3: it must act immediately to bring the Foundation into compliance with the law and standards that govern not-for-profits
column4: and must create strong legal and HR offices so to prevent any lapses in the future.”

column1: Gibson: “The Foundation does not have a record retention policy[!]
column2: and the procedures currently utilized in Harlem [headquarters] may violate the law.”

column1: Zero Hedge writes: “Furthermore
column2: and more troubling
column3: the [Gibson] review pointed to a high-ranking but unnamed foundation executive who was ‘being paid by [President Clinton]
column4: the government and the foundation’ who ‘allowed the foundation to host what may have been (or may have been viewed as) a political event
column5: apparently without official pre-approval from the foundation’s legal department and without regard
column6: before the fact
column7: to the impact of that decision on the foundation’s tax exempt status.’”

column1: This memo was written in 2008. It would have taken then
column2: and it would now take
column3: about a month of investigation by New York State and US Dept. of Justice officials to nail down the particulars and sink the Clinton Foundation.

column1: That didn’t happen then. Will it happen now? Not if the Dept. of Justice has anything to say about it. The Clintons are protected.
But evidence of the Foundation corruption is spreading like wildfire. Some fires are impossible to contain.

column1: 359;cdd25a3803eb434911f1df9222ed083f66eaa1d2;0;;2016-10-27T14:53:00.000+03:00;BUSTED: Trump Supporters Get Caught Creating Fake Badges To Intimidate Voters At Polling Places | Addicting Info | The Knowledge You Crave;"on October 27
Conservatives claim that voter ID is necessary to catch illegal voters
column2: but it turns out they’re the only ones creating fake IDs to use on Election Day.

column1: Trump supporters are taking Trump’s call to monitor polling places so seriously that they are creating fake ID badges in order to infiltrate polling locations across the country and intimidate voters by interrogating them
column2: confusing them
column3: and filming them — all of which are illegal.

column1: But
column2: Trump’s deplorables are doing this in droves with the help of a right-wing group known as “Vote Protectors.”

column1: The group
column2: which is affiliated with top Trump ally Roger Stone
column3: is giving people the ability to intimidate voters on Election Day. They are literally teaching them to create their own fake badge
column4: which is designed to give them access to voters both inside and outside the polling places where citizens cast their votes.

column1: According to the Huffington Post
Stone’s group created an official-looking ID badge for its volunteers to wear
column2: and its volunteers planned to videotape voters and conduct fake “exit polls
column3: ” efforts that election experts say risks intimidating and confusing voters. Or at least that’s what the group was planning to do before The Huffington Post asked Stone about it on Tuesday. The controversial Trump ally
column4: long known for his bare-knuckled political tactics
column5: said that key proposals on his group’s websites were there without his knowledge
column6: and assured HuffPost that he would operate within the confines of election law.

column1: In fact
column2: after HuffPo confronted Stone with evidence that these kinds of tactics were being pursued by the website
column3: he acknowledged that Vote Protectors had a “bad idea” and “ordered them taken down.”

column1: Campaign Legal Center deputy director Danielle Lang called the tactics a clear voter intimidation scheme.
“It’s inherently intimidating and an invasion of privacy
column2: ” she told HuffPo in reference to the videotaping. “When that’s being live streamed to the internet
column3: it amplifies the potentially intimidating aspect of it
column4: and violates a sense of security and privacy people have a right to enjoy at the polls. Objectively
column5: intimidating voters is unlawful
column6: no matter where you do it.”

column1: Indeed
column2: but that’s exactly what Donald Trump has been calling upon his supporters to do because he has repeatedly claimed that the election is rigged against him.

column1: As it turns out
column2: he’s right about the election being rigged
column3: only it’s conservatives who are trying to rig it in favor of Trump.

column1: Earlier this week
column2: a Wisconsin city clerk in Green Bay got caught trying to intentionally prevent college students from voting by arguing in an email to the Wisconsin Ethics Commission that an extra polling place should not be opened near the University of Wisconsin-Green Bay because she has merely heard that students lean Democrat.

column1: “I was reading the statutes and read: No site may be designated that affords an advantage to any political party
column2: ” Republican appointed clerk Kris Teske wrote.

column1: “UWGB is a polling location for students and residents on Election Day but I feel by asking for this to be the site for early voting is encouraging the students to vote more than benefiting the city as a whole. I have heard it said that students lean more toward the democrats and he is a democrat. I have spoken with our Chief of Staff and others at City Hall and they agree that budget wise this isn’t going to happen. I would like to know your thoughts on this. Do I have an argument about it being more of a benefit to the democrats.”
So not only are Trump supporters trying to rig the election with voter intimidation tactics using hypocritical methods
column2: they are using voter suppression tactics as well.

column1: And that is likely going to cause a lot of Election Day chaos. Voters should be prepared to stand up for their right to vote no matter what Trump’s deplorables try to do to keep them from exercising it.

column1: 364;1fd7c9a718708972572b7246e6f445e0ad835049;0;;2016-11-04T23:25:00.000+02:00;Former Classmate: Trump Smacked His Son So Hard It Knocked ‘Him To The Floor’ | Addicting Info | The Knowledge You Crave;"on November 4
We’ve all seen pictures of the Trumps in their home surrounded by tacky gold decor
column2: complete with their young son Barron in a suit with toys in front of him while he stares at the camera off to the side of his parents. It’s a life most of us can never imagine while we’re paying our monthly bills. So what’s it like growing up with Donald Trump as a father? According to Scott Melker
column3: a former classmate of Donald Trump Jr.’s
column4: at the University of Pennsylvania
column5: being the former reality show star’s son wasn’t what one might imagine. Or
column6: given Trump’s temperament
column7: it might be exactly what you’d imagine.

column1: On Facebook
column2: Mekler told of the animosity Trump’s son had for this father.

column1: “I was hanging out in a freshman dorm with some friends
column2: next door to Donald Jr.’s room. I walked out of the room to find Donald Trump at his son’s door
column3: there to pick him up for a baseball game
column4: ” he recalls. “There were quite a few students standing around watching
column5: trying to catch a glimpse of the famed real estate magnate. Don Jr. opened the door
column6: wearing a Yankee jersey.”

column1: Then Mekler told of the moment Trump slapped his son in the face in front of others.
“Without saying a word
column2: his father slapped him across the face
column3: knocking him to the floor in front of all of his classmates. He simply said “put on a suit and meet me outside
column4: ” and closed the door
column5: ” Melker wrote.

column1: “Donald Jr. was a drunk in college. Every memory I have of him is of him stumbling around campus falling over or passing out in public
column2: with his arm in a sling from injuring himself while drinking
column3: ” he continued. “He absolutely despised his father
column4: and hated the attention that his last name afforded him. His nickname was “Diaper Don
column5: ” because of his tendency to fall asleep drunk in other people’s beds and urinate.” “I always felt terrible for him
column6: ” he continued.

column1: Mekler said part of his reason for voting for Hillary Clinton is because “in light of what I saw that day
column2: it is clear to me that Donald Trump lacks the temperament and basic social decency to run our country.”

column1: To be clear
column2: we are not demonizing Trump’s son for having an alleged drinking problem during his college days. Whether Melker’s story is accurate or not
column3: we’re not sure
column4: but given Trump’s awful temper
column5: it’s difficult to discount it.

column1: 373;e5f023c08a1aa9ff62d008a74278afb5159cc786;0;;2016-11-14T01:54:00.054+02:00;"Trump Supporters Didn’t Vote Because Of The Economy; It Was Racism
column2: And Here’s PROOF";"on November 13

column1: Post election
column2: the media and Donald Trump voters everywhere have been rewriting recent history. They are making the claim that Trump wasn’t elected because of racism; he was elected because of the economy. The problem with that argument
column3: though
column4: is that it’s simply not true. Trump voters are racist and there’s proof.

column1: The American National Elections Study (ANES) began the study in January. Initially
column2: they asked “How likely is it that many whites are unable to find a job because employers are hiring minorities instead.” Now
column3: of course
column4: anyone who spends more than five minutes listening to those in minority communities know the answer to that. It’s VERY unlikely that whites aren’t getting jobs because minorities are
column5: but that’s not what Trump voters think. The vast majority said that it’s “extremely likely” that minorities are taking jobs from white people. Graph courtesy of ANES and Salon .

column1: Then
column2: they asked the same Trump voters about a non-racial issue
column3: trade. Despite the fact that trade was one of Trump’s signature issues
column4: their opinions on trade were mixed.

column1: Post election
column2: this is what the study found:

column1: The question about white jobs is powerfully linked to support for Trump over Clinton. Eighty-four percent of whites who believe it is “extremely likely” that whites can’t find a job because employers are hiring people of color instead support Trump
column2: compared with 23 percent of those who think it is “not at all” likely. Among white Democrats
column3: 58 percent who believe people of color are taking jobs support Trump over Clinton
column4: compared with less than 1 percent of those who believe it is not at all likely. Eighty-one percent of white women who think it is “extremely likely” people of color are taking jobs supported Trump
column5: compared with 26 percent who don’t think that.

column1: More than that
column2: 78 percent of white Trump supporters say black people are “violent.” 84 percent think that of Muslims.

column1: Unfortunately
column2: Democrats might not be able to just ride out this wave of racism
column3: hoping that eventually
column4: the aging bigots will die off. It turns out their children are just as bad. Sean McElwee
column5: the man who was responsible for publishing the study
column6: suggested this:

column1: Democrats must create a narrative that weaves economic
column2: racial and gender justice together. A multiracial coalition is the path to sustained political power and reductions in economic
column3: racial and gender inequality. As I’ve shown with political scientist Jason McDaniel
column4: racism often diminishes support for progressive policies. The solution is not to abandon either the white working class or the diverse and rising American electorate that still stands poised to transform the nation.

column1: Great idea
column2: if we had a media that reported facts instead of letting bigots’ claims go unchallenged.

column1: 374;b850f0cc65e665dee17bc9d3054872e1ca5a32d7;0;;2016-11-14T00:43:00.000+02:00;Megyn Kelly Makes BOMBSHELL Admission About Trump And The Media;"on November 13
Before the leaked tape of Donald Trump describing his propensity to grab women “by the pussy” to Billy Bush
column2: it seemed that the media was ignoring Donald Trump’s glaring faults as a presidential candidate. During the primaries
column3: for example
column4: he received far more positive media coverage than any of his competitors. It turns out there might be a reason for that – Trump was bribing the media – at least that’s the accusation being made by Megyn Kelly of Fox News.

column1: In her memoire “Settle for More
column2: ” which will be released this week
column3: Kelly said that Trump likely received the infamous question
column4: in which she asked about the fact that he has called women “fat pigs
column5: dogs
column6: slobs and disgusting animals.” That question set Trump off on one of his Twitter tirades. These are only a portion:

column1: The worst and most controversial of which was this:
As the election progressed
column2: it became more and more apparent that Trump expected that no matter how egregious his behavior
column3: he expected
column4: no
column5: demanded that the media kiss his orange ass. If they didn’t
column6: he would cut off access
column7: but before that
column8: he tried bribery.

column1: While Kelly couldn’t speak for other members of the media
column2: she alleges that Trump attempted to buy positive coverage by offering free stays at his hotels
column3: with full perks. While the attempt clearly didn’t work on Kelly
column4: she says that with some
column5: their loyalty came cheap
column6: or perhaps not so cheap.

column1: “This is actually one of the untold stories of the 2016 campaign: I was not the only journalist to whom Trump offered gifts clearly meant to shape coverage
column2: ” Kelly said. He also attempted to woo them with praise
column3: she said
column4: adding
column5: “This is smart
column6: because the media is full of people whose egos need stroking.”

column1: “Trump tried to work the refs
column2: and some of the refs responded
column3: ” she said.

column1: 382;3b136392b55de72123d5b03a3d07e575119e944d;0;Shirley Barnett;2016-11-02T22:41:00.000+02:00;Comment on Philippines Voids Building Permit Of Trump Tower In Makati City by Shirley Barnett;"adobochron 7 Comments A rendering of the Trump Tower in Makati City
column2: Philippines

column1: MAKATI CITY
column2: Philippines ( The Adobo Chronicles) – When completed by the end of 2016
column3: the Trump Tower in the Philippines will be among the country’s tallest buildings . But the Trump name may disappear from this upscale residential building.

column1: Launched in 2012
column2: Trump Tower is a joint venture between Century Properties and the Trump Organization. It will be managed by Century Properties Management Inc. To rise at 250 meters above ground
column3: the 56-story building is designed by award-winning international architectural firm Broadway Malyan.

column1: “It’s really just an iconic
column2: modern building
column3: very tall
column4: very chic
column5: something that really symbolizes everything that a Trump project means
column6: ” said Eric Trump
column7: son of Donald
column8: and executive vice president of development and acquisition.

column1: It is located at the corner of Kalayaan Avenue and Salamanca Street in Makati City.
But today
column2: Philippine President Rodrigo Roa Duterte issued an executive order canceling the building permit of the Trump Tower.

column1: Duterte called Donald Trump and his organization “persona non grata” for the Republican presidential candidate’s recent comments about the Philippines.
It will be recalled that in one of his campaign speeches
column2: Trump lumped the Philippines with other countries with terrorism links
column3: calling for the banning Filipinos from immigrating to the United States. Duterte even challenged Trump to a fist fight.

column1: “If we
column2: Filipinos
column3: are not welcome in the United States
column4: why would we welcome Trump in the Philippines
column5: ” Duterte said.

column1: Asked by The Adobo Chronicles what the Philippine government plans to do with the Trump Tower
column2: Duterte replied
column3: “I will make it a rehabilitation center for the more than half a million Filipino drug users who surrendered as part of my war on drugs.”

Two Bill Clinton cronies used their private consulting firm to steer millions in business to the former president while raising funds for the Clinton Foundation — and even called the arrangement “Bill Clinton Inc.”
Doug Band
column2: a top Clinton aide
column3: detailed the complex financial arrangement between his company
column4: Teneo
column5: and the foundation in a memo contained in hacked e-mails released Wednesday by WikiLeaks.

column1: “Teneo partners have raised in excess of $8 million for the foundation

column3: ” the memo reads.

column1: “Teneo partners also have generated over $3 million in paid speeches for President Clinton
column2: $1.25 million of which has been paid to him thus far.”

column1: The consulting company was formed by Band and former State Department envoy Declan Kelly. The memo about its activities shows the incestuous relationship between the foundation and the private business interests of the former president.
In one arrangement
column2: Kelly introduced Bob McCann
column3: the head of UBS Wealth Management
column4: to Clinton at an event in 2009.

column1: After the meeting
column2: McCann donated hundreds of thousands to the foundation while inviting Clinton to give several paid speeches.

column1: Another arrangement involved the Laureate Foundation
column2: which donated more than $1 million to the Clinton Global Initiative.

column1: Laureate was a “personal advisory services business
column2: ” the memo said
column3: paying Clinton “$3.5 million annually to provide advice and serve as their honorary chairman.”

column1: The cozy relationship with the Clintons put the Baltimore-based Laureate at high-profile events with international players who could help it expand its reach around the globe.
The Band memo also includes a section about “For-Profit Activity of President Clinton (i.e.
column2: Bill Clinton Inc.).”

column1: Some of the speeches “secured” by Teneo include two $450
column2: 000 addresses delivered to UBS in 2011 and 2012
column3: as well as a commitment for three additional paid speeches
column4: if he chose to give them.

column1: Another secured event was a $1 million fee for Clinton to speak at two one-hour sessions during an event in Hong Kong. The fee included $400
column2: 000 for a private plane.

column1: “Since 2001
column2: President Clinton’s business arrangements have yielded more than $30 million for him personally
column3: with $66 million to be paid out over the next nine years should he choose to continue with the current engagements
column4: ” the memo reads.

column1: The relationship between Band and the donors was criticized harshly by daughter Chelsea Clinton in another e-mail.
Chelsea specifically called out Band and Teneo for “hustling’” business opportunities out of the foundation.
“I continue to want — and to try — to disintermediate myself from this muddle
column2: edify the corporate audit and existential process we are in — while also being a responsible board member
column3: daughter and person
column4: ” Chelsea wrote in the 2011 e-mail.

column1: The relationship between foundation donors and Hillary Clinton’s State Department was raised through e-mails obtained by Citizens United in which top Hillary aide Huma Abedin appeared to vet donors’ access to the Clintons based on their links to the CGI.

column2: Abedin writes to Band

An election rigging these days means something totally different than what he's talking about. Now it's stupid stuff like what I did in New Hampshire.""

column1: 991;f659387bf602f4c233906983a0e836d383604a71;0;;2016-10-29T13:15:27.931+03:00;North Korea Threatens ‘Sacred’ Nuclear War Against Israel if this country continue supporting ISIS;"Email
North Korea’s Foreign Ministry slammed the “shamelessness of Israel” on Friday
column2: calling the Jewish State a “rogue group” that “poses a nuclear threat” and commits “terrorist attack[s]” against neighboring countries. On Friday the Korean Central News Agency released a statement attributed to North Korea’s Foreign Ministry that responded to comments Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made last week that were critical of the Hermit Kingdom. “This is an unpardonable insult and provocation to the dignity and social system in the DPRK and the choice made by its people
column3: ” the statement said of Netanyahu’s comments
column4: referring to North Korea by its official name
column5: the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea. The statement then took issue with Israel’s foreign policy in the Middle East
column6: stating: “Israel not only represents dictatorial forces for aggression that trample down the legitimate right of the Palestinian people and indiscriminately kill them but also is a rogue group that poses a nuclear threat and makes terrorist attack[s] on its neighboring countries with lots of nuclear weapons.” The statement was responding to comments Netanyahu made during a press conference with Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe last week
column7: in which the Israeli leader repeatedly drew parallels between Iran and North Korea. “And
column8: Prime Minister [Abe]
column9: we have something else in common
column10: ” Netanyahu began. “We are two peace loving democracies that face formidable threats from nearby rogue states.” “Both Iran and North Korea are governed by ruthless and extreme dictatorships
column11: states that seek to bully and intimidate their neighbors
column12: and in our case
column13: to actually eradicate us from the face of the earth.” Noting that “Iran and North Korea have aggressive military nuclear programs
column14: ” Netanyahu repeated his plea to not allow Iran to use diplomacy to advance its nuclear program as he alleges North Korea did with the 1994 Agreed Framework. “Iran cannot be allowed to travel the road taken by North Korea.” It’s not the first time that North Korea has slammed Israel or even Netanyahu publicly. After Netanyahu criticized Pyongyang during a trip to Japan last year
column15: the North Korean Foreign Ministry released a similar statement
column16: which called Israel a ""cancer to peace in the Middle East.” It also accused Netanyahu of trying to use North Korea “to divert international criticism of Israel caused by its settlement activity and breakdown in the Middle East peace talks."" Similarly
column17: in last week’s statement
column18: North Korea’s Foreign Ministry said
column19: “Everybody knows about the shamelessness of Israel telling lies and making fabrications and pointing accusing fingers to others to justify its criminal acts and evade the censure and condemnation by the international community.” Besides trading public insults
column20: Israel has long been concerned about North Korea’s support for Arab states that are hostile to Israel
column21: as well as Iran. In fact
column22: during the 1973 Yom Kippur War North Korea actually deployed a squadron of MiG-21s to Egypt
column23: which engaged in a firefight with Israeli F-4s. Neither side sustained any damage. More recently
column24: North Korea has been accused of proliferating ballistic missiles and nuclear technology to Syria and Iran. In 2007
column25: Israel destroyed Syria's Al Kibar Nuclear Reactor that was reportedly built by North Korean engineers.";english;2016-10-29T13:15:27.931+03:00;awdnews.com;DE;;North Korea Threatens ‘Sacred’ Nuclear War Against Israel if this country continue supporting ISIS;0.0;http://awdnews.com/images/1477735488g14692661285.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;conspiracy

Bring a boombox to play “Bohemian Rhapsody” if you want to step up your game a notch. Party on! 5. May The Force Be With You
Now

column1: 1547;73a9376191d1ee2871e9a20955a0075fb093769f;0;;2016-11-01T18:37:37.398+02:00;Life: Got The Flu? Here’s 6 Demands You Can Extract From Your Local Retirement Community With That Leverage;"Email You’re hacking up a lung and highly contagious
column2: which gives you serious power over any retirement community. They’ll agree to almost anything you demand.

column1: 1. Unlimited free toast from the breakfast buffet: They’ve got plenty of toast in the dining hall
column2: so the retirement community will surrender as much toast as you want if you agree not to come near their barely functional immune systems until your flu clears. White
column3: wheat
column4: pumpernickel—it’s all yours for the taking. However
column5: toast is just the beginning of what you can wring out of these defenseless seniors.

column1: 2. Permission to tear all the nice pictures out of their magazines: You’re a walking plague ship of a human
column2: and that puts the feeble and poorly constituted at your every whim. Feel free to peruse through the magazines in the senior lounge and keep any pictures you like. You can rip up Golf Digest to shreds for the glossy ads about wrist watches. They can’t stop you.

column1: 3. Lipitor: You’re not sure what this drug does
column2: maybe some kind of blood thing
column3: but if you want to try Lipitor
column4: this is your chance. Threaten to walk through their halls coughing on every doorknob you see unless you get a sack of Lipitor
column5: pronto. You’ve got them over a barrel.

column1: 4. Access to a senile patient who’s been told you’re FDR: This is your opportunity to have an 89-year-old man fawn over you and gratefully thank you for leading America through WWII. The retirement home might hesitate to lend a resident to you
column2: but they’ll cave once you remind them that you’ve got plenty of virus-laden phlegm to spread around. At the end of the day
column3: sacrificing one elder for the good of the others is a gamble a retirement community will take every time.

column1: 5. Renaming the retirement community after you : Tell them there better be a bronze plaque with your name bolted next to the front door
column2: or you’re going to lurch through their rec center hugging every retiree you encounter like the goddamn horseman of pestilence. Show them you mean business by taking their Purell dispenser from the front lobby and throwing it into the street.

column1: 6. Have them cure your flu: All good things must come to an end
column2: including your flu-empowered reign of terror. When you’re ready to recover from your debilitating illness
column3: ask them to send over a nurse with some antiviral drugs and chicken soup. Just make sure the retirement community agrees to all these concessions in writing
column4: because once you’re healthy
column5: you’ve got nothing over them anymore.";english;2016-11-01T18:37:37.398+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: Got The Flu? Here’s 6 Demands You Can Extract From Your Local Retirement Community With That Leverage;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3435/8/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;158;0;158;satire

column1: 1566;74bba13f175a85219dfb431a0adf3fb6dc107553;0;;2016-11-04T22:47:00.000+02:00;News: Missed Opportunity: President Obama Just Found Out That He Was Allowed To Sleep In The White House After Years Of Living In A Hotel Near The Reagan Airport;"Email
The president has to be kicking himself over this one.
As his term in office comes to a close
column2: it seems as if Barack Obama may have missed out on a pretty spectacular opportunity. Earlier today
column3: the president was told that he had been allowed to sleep in the White House this whole time
column4: after he spent nearly two full terms living in a hotel by Reagan National Airport.

column1: Sorry
column2: Mr. President
column3: but it’s true. You really blew your chance on this one.

column1: Having booked an extended stay at the airport Hilton upon his inauguration back in 2009
column2: Barack and his family have resided in an atrium-view room with two double beds and complimentary wi-fi for the past eight years. But earlier this week when a senior advisor asked the president why he had chosen to live by the airport instead of the White House
column3: you could tell that Obama hadn’t realized the choice was his to make until that very moment.

column1: Yes
column2: Obama’s accomplished a lot over the years
column3: but he’s got to be wondering how much more progress he might have made living at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue. He would have had a lot more time to work on signature policies like the Affordable Care Act if he hadn’t wasted so much of his mornings commuting from the airport to the Oval Office on the D.C. Metro. There’s no doubt the countless Hilton Rewards Points Obama has accrued is a nice perk
column4: but that doesn’t soften the blow of leaving the neoclassic mansion built exclusively to house the commander in chief and his family empty for two full terms.

column1: This is something Obama is going to regret for a long time to come.
“Nobody ever explicitly told me that I could live there until now
column2: ” said a clearly disappointed Obama
column3: as he waited patiently for a set of fresh towels. “While Sasha and Malia love being on the same floor as the pool here
column4: I now wish we had stayed at the lavish
column6: 000-square-foot private residence in the White House for the past eight years. One time in 2011
column7: I slept underneath my desk after a late night
column8: and I was worried someone was going to find me there in the morning and yell at me. Now I’m being told we apparently have a personal chef and dozens of butlers. This sucks.”

column1: Sorry
column2: Barry
column3: but this one’s kind of on you. Our advice to whoever the next president is? Don’t miss your chance like he did.";english;2016-11-05T01:09:27.988+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;News: Missed Opportunity: President Obama Just Found Out That He Was Allowed To Sleep In The White House After Years Of Living In A Hotel Near The Reagan Airport;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3440/2/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: 1568;85d2c6023a71877175f7bcbdcf3f67b4aff0892d;0;;2016-11-07T19:15:12.624+02:00;Life: 6 Things That Happen In Every Jane Austen Story Ever;"6 Things That Happen In Every Jane Austen Story Ever Posted today Email Jane
column2: we love ya
column3: but maybe mix it up a little!

column1: 1. Someone named Bullfinch comes back from vacation: If
column2: in the middle of a tense dinner party between members of rival agrarian families
column3: a man suddenly bursts through the wall wearing a Hawaiian shirt and carrying luggage
column4: and someone in the back of the room shouts
column5: “Hot damn! Bullfinch is back from vacation!” then you can be sure that you’re reading a Jane Austen novel.

column1: 2. One chapter briefly digresses from the main storyline to describe a clever
column2: bonnet-wearing mule: Literary scholars attribute Austen’s obsession with bonnet-wearing mules to the fact that whenever a publisher would pay Austen for her work
column3: such an animal would immediately knock her down and eat all her money. Savvy readers know just to skip these chapters!

column1: 3. Yorkshire County lifts up and moves itself a few inches further into the North Sea to try and crush skinny-dippers: Some say that
column2: had Austen written another two novels
column3: all the land of Yorkshire would’ve finally flattened the naked swimmers it’d always lusted to suffocate.

column1: 4. Characters spend the entirety of a picnic trying to remember the word “picnic”: SISTER 1: I do believe the proper nomenclature is “dirt supper.”SISTER 2: Nonsense! Mother insists it is called a “scoundrel’s meal.”SISTER 3: Now
column2: now
column3: let us not be uncomely. I happen to know
column4: as a matter of fact
column5: that it is called a “porknock.” Every. Damn. Book!

column1: 5. Abraham Lincoln always shows up at the main character’s home and asks to use the toilet: Did they even have toilets back then?!? Whether it’s Northanger Abbey or Mansfield Park
column2: Sense And Sensibility or Persuasion
column3: there’s always that part where Honest Abe is standing at the front door
column4: holding his top hat over his crotch region and politely asking if he can “make disgrace” in the family commode.

column1: 6. The local butcher tries to insert himself into any love triangle that will have him: This Austen staple was first seen in Pride And Prejudice
column2: where Brigsby the Butcher sheepishly presents Fitzwilliam Darcy
column3: Elizabeth Bennet
column4: and Anne de Bourgh with a sack full of raw ribeye and quietly begs them to break his heart too. If you’ve read any other Austen novel
column5: you know the scorned butcher is as essential to her writing as the setting of Victorian England.";english;2016-11-07T19:15:12.624+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: 6 Things That Happen In Every Jane Austen Story Ever;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3442/8/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;679;0;679;satire

column1: 1572;9d8c8e41e3c0a7b4757096250d04ea37a98aa52f;0;;2016-11-07T21:09:53.035+02:00;Life: Now It’s Mustard’s Time To Shine;Now It’s Mustard’s Time To Shine Posted today It’s finally here. A single spotlight on the stage. The crowd falls quiet. It’s mustard’s moment. “Life Hacks For Better Office Efficiency”? Not here. Not today. At long last
column2: mustard
column3: the tang with the texture
column4: has the floor. Big Yellow is off the bench and making everyone proud. Roll out the red carpet! The Yellow Prince of Spice is here. No
column5: no
column6: no! This has no business being here. No right! Mustard has earned its place today. This man has the right idea. If there’s any bright side to mustard being sidelined for so long
column7: it’s that its absence has made this return all the sweeter. The penultimate mustard. The time to close the curtains on our celebration now draws near. It was a long time coming. We will not soon forget this.;english;2016-11-07T21:09:53.035+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: Now It’s Mustard’s Time To Shine;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3445/2/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column2: Aretha Franklin
column3: And Willie Nelson Have To Say;Email Ever wonder what’s on the mind of today’s most notable people? Well
column4: don’t miss our unbelievable roundup of the best and most talked about quotes of the day: “ If I’m going to your birthday party
column5: you sure as hell better have some cake
column6: free booze
column7: and at least some piece of evidence indicating that you’ve had a birthday within six months. ” —Paul Krugman On rigor “ When I was 15
column8: my father told me I had a choice to make. He outstretched his arms. In one hand he held a microphone
column9: representing a career in music
column10: and in the other
column11: a single sock
column12: which I assume represented a career in something sock-related. Anyway
column13: I chose the microphone
column14: and I’ve regretted it ever since. ” —Aretha Franklin On her career “ All I need is my guitar
column15: my friends

column1: 1584;f18f74e5c56191584e514cfd97309dedcf4f4001;0;;2016-11-10T18:58:22.259+02:00;Life: Inspiring: This Young Girl Still Gets To Dream Of Being The First Female President;"Email
If this story doesn’t put a smile on your face
column2: literally nothing will.

column1: Kimberly Kovax
column2: an 11-year-old girl from Allentown
column3: PA has been interested in politics and government from a very young age
column4: and she followed the historic campaign of Hillary Clinton closely. But
column5: when Hillary lost on Tuesday
column6: that meant something incredible for Kimberly: She still gets to dream of being the first female president.

column1: Wow! This must be a truly special moment for Kimberly.
The moment Hillary Clinton made her concession speech Wednesday morning
column2: Kimberly’s opportunity to become the first woman elected to the Oval Office opened right back up. Though it may not be for 40
column4: maybe even 60 years
column5: this key milestone in feminism is all Kimberly’s to aspire toward.

column1: Some may say that another woman will be elected the first female president in the three decades before Kimberly’s even eligible to run
column2: but if the 2016 election is any indication
column3: it looks like she is still very much in the running to break the gender barrier in the Oval Office. Who knows? Kimberly could even be the first female president to re-legalize abortion if Roe v. Wade is overturned at some point in the next four years!

column1: It must feel truly incredible for girls in America to see that this huge accomplishment is still on the table
column2: theirs for the eventual taking. The fact that America’s ugliest
column3: most intolerant tendencies prevailed over Clinton means millions of girls can still envisage themselves as the one to make that landmark feminist achievement
column4: and it doesn’t get more powerful than that.

column1: Yup
column2: we’re uplifted as hell right now—you go
column3: Kimberly! When the time comes
column4: you can certainly count on our vote.";english;2016-11-10T18:58:22.259+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: Inspiring: This Young Girl Still Gets To Dream Of Being The First Female President;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3458/6/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: 1586;189f2c61e3d34dc6d1f9593a6eea91ad2b73602f;0;;2016-11-10T09:55:00.000+02:00;Blog: You Shouldn’t Have Made Fun Of My Exclamation Point;"Email
Well
column2: here we are
column3: gang.

column1: This morning America woke up and found we’d elected as president an overgrown bully
column2: a huckster without a drop of decency in his pizza-dough body. “How the heck did we get here?” I’ll bet you wondered. “What the heck happened?” Well
column3: there’s a lot we don’t know yet about this election
column4: but I’ll tell you this: Maybe you shouldn’t have made fun of my exclamation point.

column1: Yeah
column2: remember the exclamation point? The big ’n’ red mark plopped next to my serifed-up name like a trout on the counter? We put that logo out
column3: and you people laughed. Oh
column4: how you laughed. “Hey
column5: looks like ol’ Wonder Bread Jeb’s trying to squeeze some enthusiasm out of his limp little campaign!” You think I didn’t hear you? You think I didn’t see what you wrote? Of course I did. The taunts
column6: the memes
column7: the novelty Twitter handles
column8: typed with a sneer. I saw all of it
column9: and it hurt me. It hurt Jeb.

column1: You turned me and my exclamation mark into a big dippy joke
column2: and look what it got you. Dread. Defeat. Humiliation. Feel that despair in your gut today
column3: and now imagine if you had “JEB!” in your life right now
column4: splashed across every TV and touchscreen. Hey
column5: there’s some punctuation that’d put pep in your step! But nope
column6: the guy who sticks his neck out to make electoral politics just a keystroke more exciting gets ribbed
column7: roasted
column8: raked over the coals
column9: and hung out to dry.

column1: Look
column2: I wasn’t a perfect candidate. I know that. But that doesn’t mean you had to steer this country straight into a xenophobic hellhole.

column1: That exclamation point was plain fun. It stood out from the pack. It even looked nice on a T-shirt or a coozy. You made a huge mistake the moment you collectively decided to rip my exclamation point to shreds.
I was up all night coming up with it
column2: you know. That “!” was a John Ellis Bush original. I’d already tried out a question mark (too uncertain)
column3: an ellipsis (too ambiguous)
column4: even two exclamation points (too forceful)
column5: so when I hit on the idea of an exclamation point I really thought I had something special. I was so excited to share my excitement with you. Turns out I might as well have slapped my thick
column6: pink matte dick into my hand and waggled it all over Facebook Live like a dang date palm frond
column7: for all the love you gave me.

column1: Look
column2: I wasn’t a perfect candidate. I know that. But that doesn’t mean you had to steer this country straight into a xenophobic hellhole. All you had to do was be nice about that exclamation point for a few months. But you couldn’t leave it alone
column3: could you? You just could not resist having a good
column4: old laugh! Well
column5: take a look around and tell me what you see. A divided nation headed for the falls with a dipshit at the helm
column6: belting out one last drunken shanty before it all goes to chunks and splinters. You bullies deserve it all.

column1: Goodbye
column2: America. I would have been delightful.";english;2016-11-10T18:58:28.564+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Blog: You Shouldn’t Have Made Fun Of My Exclamation Point;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3458/1/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: 1588;635c542c29a858db38c3b2cf0be8a0537d42dff1;0;;2016-11-10T06:11:00.000+02:00;Life: Lucky Break: This Teen Boy Just Got Another 4 Years To Plan His Viral Coming-Out Video;"Email
This kid just seriously hit the jackpot.
Fifteen-year-old Taylor Hutton has known that he’s gay for as long as he can remember
column2: and over the past few months he’s been working up the courage to finally tell his friends and family the truth. Taylor even planned to film some of those moments and post them on YouTube
column3: in hopes that they might help other kids going through a similar experience. But just when this teen was ready to stop hiding who he really is
column4: something incredible happened: Donald Trump and Mike Pence were elected into the White House
column5: and Taylor just got another four years to plan his viral coming-out video!

column1: Um
column2: luckiest teen ever?

column1: Up until now
column2: Taylor figured he’d just prop his iPhone up to record the moment he came out to his parents
column3: but after watching the presidential election results come in last night
column4: Taylor knew that he needed to scrap that plan immediately. This lucky teen now has until at least 2020 before he can safely come out of the closet
column5: and that’s more than enough time to come up with the sort of next-level viral video idea that could seriously break the internet!

column1: Instead of releasing some half-baked
column2: hastily edited video on his YouTube channel this spring
column3: Taylor will now get to spend at least the next four years of a Trump/Pence administration dreaming up the most heartwarming and totally shareable coming-out video imaginable. And depending on how the next election goes
column4: this kid just might get the chance to keep brainstorming camera angles and staging options in his head until he’s well into his mid-20s or older.

column1: So awesome! With cameras only getting better and better
column2: it’s possible that four years from now we’ll even get to witness Taylor finally arrive at some sort of peace with himself in stunning
column3: crystal-clear 8K resolution.

column1: Best of luck to you over the next four years
column2: Taylor! We can’t wait for you to release that coming-out video as soon as doing so doesn’t put you under immediate danger from your own government. With all that extra time to plan it out
column3: it’s going to be so great!";english;2016-11-10T18:58:33.311+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: Lucky Break: This Teen Boy Just Got Another 4 Years To Plan His Viral Coming-Out Video;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3457/8/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: 1589;62fb7d18015e5f7f3e7d17866abbdce13c1b19e2;0;;2016-11-11T03:38:45.147+02:00;Blog: If Donald Trump Pardons Me
column2: I Would Be Honored To Serve As Secretary Of Agriculture;"Email

column1: One year ago
column2: I was arrested for both statutory rape and possessing child pornography
column3: and I deeply regret my disgusting crimes. Since that fateful day
column4: I’ve been serving a 16-year jail sentence
column5: using every second of that time to reflect on
column6: and repent for
column7: what I have done. I’ve truly learned a lot about myself as a person
column8: and if our president-elect
column9: Donald Trump
column10: were to recognize my transformation and to pardon me
column11: I would be honored to serve as his Secretary of Agriculture.

column1: In the event Donald J. Trump pardons and then appoints me to his future Cabinet
column2: I
column3: Jared Fogle
column4: current federal inmate and former Subway spokesperson
column5: could think of no greater privilege than to serve our commander in chief
column6: and our country
column7: as the head of our Department of Agriculture.

column1: It is the Secretary of Agriculture’s sworn duty to provide assistance to our nation’s farmers
column2: as well as to protect farmland and enforce food safety
column3: and if I am let out of jail
column4: I believe I am ready for the task. To have Donald Trump both forgive my child-sex crimes and recognize how useful my deep knowledge of lettuce
column5: tomatoes
column6: onions
column7: peppers
column8: hot Italian peppers
column9: olives
column10: and other sub toppings could be to his administration would make my heart swell with pride.

column1: To serve our farmers at the federal level would be greater than any Subway sandwich I ever ate
column2: greater than any Subway commercial I ever made
column3: and greater than any large pair of pants I ever wore.

column1: As someone who has sold hundreds of millions of Subway sandwiches to the American people since the year 2000
column2: I know the burden of working for the public
column3: and I would not let our new president
column4: nor the American people
column5: down. It would be an immense privilege to serve for a full four years
column6: and pending Donald Trump negating my seven federal counts of production of child pornography
column7: I would start that process immediately.

column1: I lost over 245 pounds and ate thousands of Subway sandwiches before I was arrested for paying for sex with a minor
column2: and I do hope that President-elect Trump considers that fact when making his decision whether or not to pardon and appoint me secretary of agriculture. To serve our farmers at the federal level would be greater than any Subway sandwich I ever ate
column3: greater than any Subway commercial I ever made
column4: and greater than any large pair of pants I ever wore.

column1: So
column2: hopefully
column3: the next time I address you
column4: it will be not from my prison cell in Englewood Federal Correctional Institution but from the National Mall
column5: in Washington
column6: D.C. Believe me
column7: the next four years would be incredible not just for me
column8: but for you
column9: should our president-elect look deep into his heart and give the department the spokesperson it deserves!";english;2016-11-11T03:38:45.147+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Blog: If Donald Trump Pardons Me

column1: 1591;3f9cfd6d4e119f5ae9cb1e7bedc56252943893b5;0;;2016-11-11T17:42:00.000+02:00;9 Breathtaking Photos Of Nature With A Generous H... | ClickHole;Email The majesty of nature is awe-inspiring
column2: and don’t worry
column3: we’ve got plenty of those monkeys with the giant red asses. 1. We’re not going to leave you hanging
column4: wondering when the swollen red asses are going to show up. Here’s one monkey ass to start this list of beautiful nature photos off right. 2. Elsewhere in nature
column5: the blue whale is the largest animal in Earth’s history
column6: even bigger than the dinosaurs! And if you think we blew our entire red-assed money wad on that first one
column7: then you are seriously mistaken. 3. The Alaskan wood frog has the amazing ability to freeze in winter and thaw itself out when the weather gets warm again. It sounds like something out of science fiction
column8: and while it isn’t a hulking red monkey ass
column9: it’s still an impressive example of the power of evolution. 4. No way we’d skimp on monkeys with bulbous red buttocks. That’s not how we treat our readers. When we promise inflamed red monkey asses
column10: we deliver in spades. Feast your eyes on these remarkable specimens. 5. More monkeys with beacon-like red asses are coming up
column11: but in the meantime here is the hummingbird moth. At first glance
column12: you’d mistake it for a bird
column13: but it’s actually an insect that happens to look like a hummingbird
column14: which is pretty cool if you think about it. 6. Once again
column15: it’s time to behold red monkey ass
column16: and this time there’s a whole gaggle of monkeys with blindingly bright asses. But this isn’t the end of the red assfest
column17: no siree. This we promise. 7. Chimpanzees are our closest cousins in nature
column18: with an almost human-like intelligence. They sadly were not blessed with a bright-red ass but are smart enough to use simple tools like sticks to catch termites. You can’t help but wonder about humanity’s place in nature when you see a creature so similar to us. 8. We’ve got a real showstopper of a red ass on deck
column19: but first let’s do our due diligence and check out the Galápagos tortoise. It can live over 170 years. Incredible. 9. Here we go! This monkey has a truly huge red ass
column20: much bigger and redder than any ass we’ve seen before. We are fortunate to share a planet with a bloated red miracle as beautiful as this monkey’s breathtaking ass. Red monkey asses are nature at its finest
column21: and we hope you’ve had your fill of them. ;english;2016-11-12T00:21:15.243+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;9 Breathtaking Photos Of Nature With A Generous H... | ClickHole;0.6409999999999999;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3459/9/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;517;0;517;satire

column1: 1593;aebe3dbcc2c36eb61be56a4ed1d0d4c0c734b4f5;0;;2016-11-12T02:14:05.550+02:00;Life: 6 Things That No One Tells You About Living Alone;"6 Things That No One Tells You About Living Alone Posted today Email Time to move out and grow up.
1. You can tie your shoes with the door open: Your whole life
column2: you’ve been used to closing and maybe even locking the door when you tie your shoes. No longer! You can do it with the door open
column3: and don’t need to put on a fan to cover the shameful sound.

column1: 2. The newspaper doesn’t heat itself up: If you want some hot newspaper
column2: you’re going to have to pop it in the microwave yourself. There’s no other way around it.

column1: 3. If you used to live with Manny Pacquiao
column2: there are probably fewer punching bags around now: Get ready to have a bunch more floor space if you no longer live with boxer Manny Pacquiao
column3: never mind not having to worry about a punching bag knocking you over after a solid strike from the world-class champ. Our tip? Set up a small little punching bag if you ever start to miss living with the legendary Filipino fighter-politician.

column1: 4. It’s a lot harder to get people to split your rent with you if they don’t live with you: This part of living alone is a pretty big bummer.
5. The toilet paper goes bad: You can’t finish a whole 12-pack of toilet paper before it expires. When you live alone
column2: you have to buy the four-packs or even the single rolls.

column1: 6. No matter how loud you yell “Socks off!” no one is going to take them off for you: Ugh
column2: seriously? Maybe living with roommates wasn’t so bad.";english;2016-11-12T02:14:05.550+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: 6 Things That No One Tells You About Living Alone;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3463/2/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;553;0;553;satire

column1: 1598;52f2c91212cb4ad584d23d777d6ac3922b241265;0;;2016-11-14T21:18:45.922+02:00;News: Shaking Up Washington: Donald Trump Just Appointed A Cloaked Man As Secretary Of The Hook;"Email
Time to say goodbye to politics as usual.
In another stunning game changer that has further upended the political establishment
column2: President-elect Donald Trump this morning announced the nomination of a mysterious cloaked man to serve as his secretary of the Hook.

column1: Yep. Trump promised change
column2: and right away he’s appointing a nameless robed man to lead the Department of the Hook. How’s that for a shock to the system?

column1: The silent man
column2: whose face is completely shrouded within a thick
column3: hooded cloak
column4: is rumored to have topped the shortlist of candidates for secretary of the Hook after emerging alone from a dense forest at night and immediately causing all greenery within the Washington beltway to wilt.

column1: Trump has already lauded his nominee as “a wonderful man with an absolutely tremendous cloak” whom he trusts do an “unbelievable job” discharging the duties of the position
column2: which include abiding by the Hook
column3: interpreting the Covenant of the Hook
column4: and holding aloft the candle whose flame subtracts light from its surroundings.

column1: “The man in the cloak is going to be a fantastic secretary of the Hook. Just fantastic
column2: ” said Trump
column3: who added that the secretary will be second in the presidential line of succession. “No one is better qualified to enforce the covenant than this man. His cloak is dark
column4: he was born before Christ
column5: I don’t know his name
column6: he has the Hook now
column7: and he’s ready to fight for us!”

column1: And don’t look now
column2: but the presumptive secretary of the Hook is already making waves. At dawn this morning
column3: he led the Zealots of the Hook in a procession through the streets of Washington
column4: toward the open entrance to the Onyx Pyramid
column5: an edifice by the Lincoln Memorial that residents could not remember ever having existed but that the cloaked man assured Americans in a terse press release “has always been and shall forever be.”

column1: One thing’s for sure: This appointment signals a whole new political era in the nation’s capital. We can’t wait to see how this bold move turns out!";english;2016-11-14T21:18:45.922+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;News: Shaking Up Washington: Donald Trump Just Appointed A Cloaked Man As Secretary Of The Hook;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3464/0/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: 1609;fbbcc17d7b999e8ce1a179864da712b2de5ea491;0;;2016-11-16T22:46:57.325+02:00;Life: Chaos: This Coffee Shop Is Also An Art Gallery;"Citizens of the four corners of the world
column2: take heed
column3: and behold what horror descends upon us. An unholy paradox has revealed itself. Within its walls
column4: utter chaos reigns: This coffee shop is also an art gallery.

column1: Insanity. There can be no godly reason for such an abomination.
Lo
column2: for here the oceans shall fall out of sight and paintings shall be with coffee and coffee shall be with pastries. The coming and going of a restroom key affixed to a wooden ladle marks the only indication that time passes as the mind sits frozen
column3: unable to comprehend.

column1: How can it be so? What vile architect of insanity can have devised this place?
A Lumineers album plays in its entirety while patrons settle in to a collective nonchalance that suggests either total defeat or a complicity in this wickedness. They offer nothing
column2: seated at their wooden tables
column3: typing on MacBooks and drinking coffees as paintings leer from behind them. Elsewhere
column4: a father turns to son
column5: offering him a coffee as they admire a painting of Nighthawks reimagined with Coen brothers characters.

column1: Truly
column2: this is bedlam.

column1: Above the lattes
column2: art looms. A lone merchant stands behind a concrete slab where two tip jars enjoin visitors to choose between Sex Pistols or The Descendents
column3: but for what are we tipping?

column1: Hot
column2: caffeinated broth sloshes above a chalkboard that favors a soup of the day and Wi-Fi password. A small sticker that says “$350” marks an oil depiction of a sunset
column3: but on another wall
column4: a sunrise on canvas bears no marking at all. Could the latter be mere decoration? And if everything has a price in this mayhem
column5: could it be that the paintings in the bathroom are also for sale?

column1: All sense has fled this place. The mind knows when it has confronted something that simply cannot be.
To comprehend such a chaotic nightmare is futile. The boundary between Earth and the netherworld is not separated by gates after all
column2: but a door. And on that door
column3: a sign that says “Open daily from 6 a.m. to midnight
column4: ” bidding all enter and willingly fall to madness.";english;2016-11-16T22:46:57.325+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: Chaos: This Coffee Shop Is Also An Art Gallery;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3467/3/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;962;0;962;satire
