column1: 2209;30c1112b3299a340290e84998ff3da8d18875402;0;;2016-10-28T10:23:00.000+03:00;Ben Shapiro Destroys John Oliver On Abortion And Trump | Daily Wire;"Ben Shapiro Destroys John Oliver On Abortion And Trump By: Hank Berrien October 27
On Thursday
column2: on his daily podcast
column3: Daily Wire Editor-in-Chief Ben Shapiro decimated HBO host and supposed comedian John Oliver for his comments regarding Donald Trump's comments on abortion during the third presidential debate.

column1: Shapiro began
column2: ""HBO’s John Oliver belongs to a class of British people who think that they are smarter than everyone else by dint of their accent. They think that because they share an accent with Rex Harrison from My Fair Lady this makes them geniuses.""

column1: He continued:

So John Oliver does a political show on American politics; he doesn’t know much about American politics; he doesn’t know much about politics generally; but he’s been feted by the media because he’s a comedian who’s wildly to the left. So just like President Obama is going to be interviewed by Samantha Bee
column2: who is legitimately the least funny person in human history
column3: (she and Trevor Noah actually have a cage match next week to determine who’s the least funny person in human history. Both of them I believe
column4: beat Stalin for that title a while back
column5: so now were going to unify the championships)
column6: so Obama’s going to be on with Samantha Bee
column7: where presumably they will jabber about how much they love each other and why abortion’s wonderful.

column1: John Oliver was ripping on Donald Trump the other day at some awards ceremony
column2: and because he’s British
column3: that means we’re supposed to pay attention to him
column4: even though we fought a revolution so we wouldn’t have to pay attention to the Brits. Here’s John Oliver talking about abortion:

column1: The screen then showed Oliver pontificating:

In terms of the communication about reproductive rights and the conversation that is so important; we really did potentially hit an idea in the modern era during that third debate because his discussions of late-term abortions showed no real understanding of how abortions work
column2: no clear understanding of the basic biology of women’s bodies
column3: and a very poor sense of grammar as well. So I guess we got
column4: in a sense
column5: what we were asking for. If you ask Donald Trump to draw a Fallopian tube
column6: I cannot imagine what you would get back other than a child’s drawing of a cobra.

column1: Shapiro fired back:
Okay. I would hesitate to ask John Oliver to draw a Fallopian tube or to describe any of the biology here
column2: because he obviously doesn’t know. Now look
column3: I criticized Trump for being ignorant about how he described abortion because he wasn’t graphic enough. But let me
column4: for those who missed it
column5: explain what exactly happens in a late-term abortion
column6: which is what he was talking about
column7: okay? What happens in a late-term abortion
column8: what happens in a late-term abortion
column9: is something completely awful; this is according to americanpregnancy.org.
column10: okay? Not a right-wing pro-life website: americanpregnancy.org: ""The fetus is rotated; forceps are used to grasp and pull the legs
column11: shoulders and arms through the birth canal. A small incision is made at the base of the skull to allow a suction catheter inside. The catheter removes the cerebral material
column12: ” that would be the brains
column13: “until the skull collapses. The fetus is then completely removed.”

column1: Shapiro continued to explain the barbaric procedure:
Okay
column2: that’s one procedure that’s used; that’s “dilation and extraction.” In late-term abortions it usually one of these two; “dilation and evacuation” or “dilation and extraction.” “Dilation and evacuation”: The baby may be given a lethal injection to kill it; sometimes they don’t use such injections; then the doctor uses a curette or a forceps to carve up the child’s body in the womb
column3: and remove it piece by piece.

column1: Then he proceeded to carve up Oliver:
So I guess that Donald Trump could have been more graphic; I don’t know that John Oliver would have enjoyed that
column2: but he could have been more graphic
column3: I suppose. But this is what they do
column4: laugh it up
column5: “Oh
column6: he can’t draw a Fallopian tube.""

column1: Okay
column2: John: draw an abortion. Really. Draw it; let’s see it. I want to see you get down there with a piece of paper and I want you to draw me what you think an abortion looks like. It’s not waving a magic wand
column3: and it’s not getting rid of a cluster of cells that mean nothing. I want you to sit there and draw what it looks like when a baby is cut into pieces and removed from the womb. I would like to see that. ""Okay
column4: John: draw an abortion. Really. Draw it; let’s see it. I want to see you get down there with a piece of paper and I want you to draw me what you think an abortion looks like."" Ben Shapiro

column1: Shapiro concluded:
But of course he’ll never do that
column2: other than
column3: ""It might look like a cobra; it might look like a cobra; maybe it’ll look like a princess
column4: waving her fairy magic wand and a unicorn emerges from the vagina.” The fact that he thinks his accent covers for his basic ignorance of biology and his euphemistic willingness to ignore what amounts to child-killing is absolutely ridiculous and despicable.

2229;88399c0d6930ce770527bd66cebef92306cf9d97;0;;2016-11-02T22:56:00.000+02:00;Desperate Obama RIPS Comey: 'We Don't Operate On Innuendo' | Daily Wire;"Desperate Obama RIPS Comey: 'We Don't Operate On Innuendo' By: November 2
Barack Obama must be pretty worried.
Earlier this week
column2: White House press secretary Josh Earnest told the media that FBI director James Comey’s decision to reopen an investigation into Hillary Clinton didn’t spring from bias or politics. He explained :

column1: Director Comey is a man of integrity and principle and well regarded by officials in both parties and served as a senior position in the Bush administration and got bipartisan support when his nomination to be director of the FBI was considered by the United States Senate... they speak to his good character and the president's assessment of his integrity and his character has not changed. For example
column2: the president doesn't believe that Director Comey is trying to influence the outcome of the election. And the president doesn't believe he's secretly supporting a candidate or political party. He's in a tough spot. He's the one who will be in the position to defend his actions in the face of significant criticism from a variety of legal experts including officials who served in senior justice position for presidents led by both parties.

column1: Now
column2: with the polls closing to within the margin of error
column3: President Obama has had second thoughts. He told NowThisNews :

column1: I do think that there is a norm that when there are investigations we don’t operate on innuendo and we don’t operate on incomplete information and we don’t operate on leaks. We operate based on concrete decisions that are made. When this was investigated thoroughly last time the conclusion of the FBI
column2: the conclusion of the Justice Department
column3: the conclusion of repeated congressional investigations was she had made some mistakes but that there wasn't anything there that was prosecutable.

column1: It’s worthwhile pointing out the hypocrisy here – Obama’s entire administration has been built on innuendo. His Department of Justice has destroyed police departments around the country with unsubstantiated innuendo about systemic racism. His IRS used innuendo to destroy conservative 501(c)3s. His entire 2012 campaign was rooted in innuendo about Mitt Romney’s supposed secret evils.
But more than anything
column2: the Obama flip here shows serious desperation. What changed? The polls. On Monday
column3: it looked like the FBI scandal would detract from Hillary’s polling numbers
column4: but wouldn’t kill her. Now it looks like she might go down in flames. This shows how faithless Obama is – Comey was wonderful just up until the point he threatened Hillary’s chances
column5: at which point he became a slanderer trafficking in innuendo.

column1: If Comey has any stones
column2: he should resign in protest at Obama’s accusations. He’s already been thrown under the bus by his commander-in-chief for not playing dead for him long enough to move Hillary into the White House. He’s got no future in his position no matter what he does. It would be a final redeeming move of honor to tell Obama and his cronies to stuff it now. Tags ";english;2016-11-03T00:41:40.628+02:00;dailywire.com;US;15846.0;Desperate Obama RIPS Comey: 'We Don't Operate On Innuendo' | Daily Wire;0.002;http://www.dailywire.com/sites/default/files/styles/169large/public/uploads/2016/11/gettyimages-577706392.jpg?itok=MVN3FTED;0;0;0;0;0;bias

column1: 2230;0714c15c4775905d6bda85c7d0e84a223afb2139;0;;2016-11-03T07:53:06.545+02:00;NYT: FBI Failed To Connect Trump To Putin;"NYT: FBI Failed To Connect Trump To Putin By: Robert Kraychik November 2
column2: 2016 The New York Times reported on Monday that the FBI has failed to establish “any conclusive or direct link between Mr. Trump and the Russian government.” Speaking with unnamed FBI sources
column3: the left-wing “paper of record” reported that the FBI pursued an investigation into stateside Russian attempts to affect the presidential election. “Agents scrutinized advisors close to Donald J. Trump"" in order to search for financial connections between Donald Trump’s political circle and “Russian financial figures
column4: reported The New York Times . A report from Slate ’s Franklin Foer sought to advance the narrative of collusion between Trump and Putin pushed by Hillary Clinton
column5: Democrats
column6: and affiliated political allies. It was then forwarded by left-wing Democrat media personalities and affiliates. Trump Tower had a special server to communicate with Russia's Alfa Bank
column7: reports the eternal badass @FranklinFoer . https://t.co/yIX6rZXbxJ — Julia Ioffe (@juliaioffe) October 31
column9: why? Why Trump's stubborn almost devotion to Putin? Why the Russia friendly policies? Why the Mantafort links? Why the secret server? — Scott Gilmore (@Scott_Gilmore) October 31
column10: 2016 Putin's Puppet didn't cover his tracks: Trump server directly communicating with Russia. Voters deserve answers now. https://t.co/VXQNIoQXB6 — Chad Griffin (@ChadHGriffin) November 1
column11: 2016 Despite the narrative of Putin preferring to see Trump elected president
column12: the FBI investigation apparently arrived at a different conclusion. The New York Times reported that unnamed FBI investigators said they “have become increasingly confident
column13: based on the evidence they have uncovered
column14: that Russia’s direct goal is not to support the election of Mr. Trump
column15: as many Democrats have asserted
column16: but rather to disrupt the integrity of the political system and undermine America’s standing in the world more broadly.” No mention was made of the Kremlin-run English-language propaganda outlet RT
column17: which regularly pushes what can broadly be described as mostly left-wing anti-American and pro-Russian agitation. Also ignored were actual financial connections between Russian-related interests and the Clintons or their inner circle. For months
column18: Democrat politicians and operatives have colluded with their news media allies to push a narrative of Russia’s President Vladimir Putin directing the Russian state apparatus to provide political support to Donald Trump.

2231;4f8fc8c1328ca8987dff82cc7a92e465d0975976;0;;2016-11-01T22:23:00.000+02:00;Clemson University Student's Welcome: 'Ben Shapiro Is A Pig' | Daily Wire;"Clemson University Student's Welcome: 'Ben Shapiro Is A Pig' By: Hank Berrien November 1

Apparently word has been passed to leftists that Daily Wire Editor-In Chief Ben Shapiro will be speaking at Clemson University tonight. ""Ben Shapiro Is A Pig"" was chalked in a Clemson classroom this morning. Looks like the SJWs are very excited to hear @benshapiro tonight! pic.twitter.com/hkd3YgIwMn — Caleb Ecarma (@calebecarma) November 1
There has been no explanation as to who decorated the chalkboard
column2: nor whether the culprit wanted to issue a more eloquent denunciation of Shapiro but was hindered by the limits of his/her vocabulary
column3: thus being restricted to words of three letters or less.

column1: Shapiro’s usual denunciation of political correctness is likely the reason for the gratuitous insult; in October 2015
column2: Clemson was plagued by PC when a few students protested Clemson Dining’s ""Maximum Mexican"" night
column3: tweeting their displeasure with such a ""#CUlturallyInsensitive"" event. Clemson senior Austin Pendergist told Campus Reform the post-event uproar was “ridiculous … This is something that Clemson Dining has done for years without any sort of backlash. People love the cultural nights in the dining halls. What's next? Are they going to take away all potato based food as to not offend students from Irish decent? Remove the stir fry station so Asian-American students don't feel as if they are being misrepresented? When does it end?”

column1: But the administration wound up apologizing for the event; Dr. Doug Hallenbeck
column2: Clemson University’s Senior Associate Vice President of Student Affairs
column3: said the event displayed a “flattened cultural view of Mexican culture … It is the mission of University Housing & Dining to create supportive and challenging environments that enrich and nourish lives. We failed to live out our mission yesterday
column4: and we sincerely apologize
column5: ” adding that the university “will continue to work closely with [its] food service provider to create dining programs that align with Clemson University’s core values.”

column1: The administration also apologized on the Clemson Dining Services Facebook and Twitter pages.
Pendergist said the event had only featured “a couple balloons
column2: sombreros
column3: and some tacos
column4: ” adding
column5: “For as long as I've been here
column6: and probably for much longer
column7: Clemson dining has put on certain culinary theme nights
column8: where they decorate the dining halls and serve whatever kind of food. They have Italian night
column9: Mexican night
column10: seafood night
column11: midnight breakfast
column12: all kinds of events.”

2236;916818db05c37698eff155b9aad4fee7533844a9;0;;2016-11-04T17:30:53.347+02:00;7 Things You Need To Know About Trump And Sex Slave Island;7 Things You Need To Know About Trump And Sex Slave Island By: Amanda Prestigiacomo May 9
Presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump has thrown everything but the kitchen sink at Hillary Clinton when it comes to her husband's escapades. ""The kitchen sink
column2: in this case
column3: is Jeffery Epstein's “Sex Slave Island” and President Bill Clinton’s ties to it .

column1: Why wouldn’t Trump use this ammo? The answer is simple: Trump himself has ties to Epstein
column2: the billionaire Democratic donor and convicted pedophile known for having under-age sex slaves on his private plane and what the media calls ""Sex Slave Island.""

column1: Here are seven connections between Trump and Epstein's sex slave endeavors that you need to know about:
1. Trump himself has said that Epstein is “a lot of fun to be with
column2: ” adding that he admired the sex offender's affinity for beautiful women “on the younger side.”

column1: I've known Jeff for fifteen years. Terrific guy
column2: '' Trump once said about the convicted sex offender. ""He's a lot of fun to be with. It is even said that he likes beautiful women as much as I do
column3: and many of them are on the younger side. No doubt about it -- Jeffrey enjoys his social life.""

column1: 2. Trump was named in Epstein’s “little black book.”
Epstein’s “ little black book ” was stolen by a former employee in 2004. The book
column2: nicknamed ""The Holy Grail"" by the employee
column3: revealed the name of Donald Trump and listed “14 phone numbers including emergency numbers
column4: car numbers
column5: and numbers to Trump's security guard and houseman.”

column1: 3. Trump has allegedly flown on Epstein’s private plane — a hot spot for under-age sex orgies.
“Mark Epstein
column2: Jeffrey's brother
column3: testified in 2009 that Trump flew on Jeffrey's private jet at least once
column4: ” reports VICE News . “Meanwhile
column5: message pads [see below] from Epstein's Palm Beach mansion that were seized by investigators and obtained by VICE News indicate that Trump called Epstein twice in November of 2004.”

column1: Epstein’s private Boeing 727
column2: according to one of his alleged victims
column3: Virginia Roberts
column4: was nicknamed the “Lolita Express.” Roberts recalled “unsavoury” sex orgies on the private plane when she was just 15 years of age with Epstein and his friends.

column1: 4. Both Trump and Epstein are named as sex abusers in a case with an under-aged girl.
Radar Online reports that a woman in California
column2: “identified” as Katie Johnson
column3: filed a $100 million lawsuit against Trump on April 26
column4: accusing the real estate mogul of raping her when she was just 13 years old.

column1: Johnson “claims Trump raped her when she was 13-years-old and forced her to engage in sex acts by threatening to harm her and her family
column2: ” notes The Independent UK . “She claims the alleged abuse took place over a four-month period at underage sex parties held in New York City in 1994.” Epstein was also named for alleged sexual misconduct and threats.

column1: Trump’s team adamantly denies the accusation
column2: suspecting the claim is possibly a hoax since there is allegedly “no evidence” the plaintiff “actually exists.”

column1: 5. Epstein admitted to knowing Trump under oath
column2: and curiously pled the fifth to Trump attending sex parties with underage girls.

column1: Back in 2010
column2: Epstein admitted to “socializing” with Trump
column3: but when a lawyer representing an under-aged victim of Epstein’s asked if he has “ever socialized with Donald Trump in the presence of females under the age of 18
column4: ” Epstein curiously pled the Fifth. Per Vice News : Q: Have you ever had a personal relationship with Donald Trump? A. What do you mean by ""personal relationship
column5: sir? Q. Have you socialized with him? A. Yes
column6: sir. Q. Yes? A. Yes
column7: sir. Q. Have you ever socialized with Donald Trump in the presence of females under the age of 18? A: Though I'd like to answer that question
column8: at least today I'm going to have to assert my Fifth
column9: Sixth
column10: and 14th Amendment rights
column11: sir.

column1: 6. At least one of Epstein’s underage sex victims was recruited from Trump’s Mar-a-Lago — which he frequented often.
Virginia Roberts
column2: an alleged victim of Epstein’s
column3: ""was recruited to perform a massage for Epstein while working as a $9-per-hour locker room attendant at Mar-A-Lago.”

column1: Roberts claims that “Epstein turned her into a ‘sex slave’ and pimped her out to various friends
column2: including England's Prince Andrew. Over the years
column3: the passengers on Epstein's jet
column4: she said
column5: included ‘a whole bunch of other girls
column6: sometimes famous people
column7: sometimes some politicians.'""

column1: 7. Trump was subpoenaed in 2009 for his connection to Epstein’s under-age sex slave rings. Trump has denied ever being served.

column2: Trump was subpoenaed in a case against Epstein concerning victim Virginia Roberts. Trump's attorney Alan Garten said that the subpoena ""never happened.""

column1: There is no debate over what happened
column2: said one of Roberts' attorneys. ""I served Mr. Trump with a subpoena for deposition in 2009. He talked to me voluntarily
column3: and consequently we withdrew the subpoena in light of his voluntarily providing information…. I can't imagine there being any dispute of any of this.""

column1: Additionally
column2: Garten told VICE News in January that Mr. Trump has ""no relationship"" with Epstein other than the Democratic donor frequenting Trump's Mar-A-Lago. ""A lot of people hung out there
column3: including Jeffrey Epstein
column4: said Garten. ""That is the only connection.""

column1: According to the evidence
column2: however
column3: the connections with Epstein appear to go a lot deeper than that. column1: 2250;1285921de728b4fd19228ddeb1fa78d6db4ca429;0;;2016-11-10T00:11:07.991+02:00;The Media Lost All of Its Political Power Last Night -- Thank You
column2: Donald Trump! | Daily Wire;"The Media Lost All of Its Political Power Last Night -- Thank You
column3: Donald Trump! By: John Nolte November 9

column1: The morally dark Obama-era is over and utterly and totally repudiated. The Clintons have finally and forever been staked in their mercenary black hearts. Our smug
column2: supremacist overlords in the Elite Establishment of both Parties
column3: these rotting
column4: rent-seeking parasites
column5: are now vanquished. But nothing is grander
column6: nothing is more glorious
column7: nothing is more satisfying
column8: nothing is sweeter
column9: nothing is more validating
column10: nothing is better for America than the death of the mainstream media's political power.

column1: The elite national political media is done as a force
column2: moral or otherwise
column3: in this country. Done. Buried. Exposed. Over. Out. And using a slow-acting poison called hubris
column4: it was death by suicide. So smug. So sure of themselves. So sanctimonious. So snark-filled. So utterly incapable of anything close to self-reflection.

column1: The self-induced poison took effect over a number of years and through five steps.
Here they are.
1. Pimping for ObamaCare
The national political media didn’t just cheerlead for ObamaCare
column2: they LIED to us. Willfully and with malicious intent
column3: they all lied to us. The outlawing of almost every existing insurance plan was right there in the bill
column4: right there in black and white. But the media didn't care. They wanted to give their Precious Obama a win and in order to do that
column5: they jumped on board the ""You Can Keep Your Insurance"" propaganda express. Worse
column6: those of us who did tell the truth were branded as liars and racists
column7: not only by the pundits but by those godforsaken fact-checkers.

column1: Then Utopia met reality.
Then the lies were exposed.
And the result is that up to and including last night
column2: at both the local and national level
column3: ObamaCare has decimated the Democrat Party. But nowhere near as bad as it has decimated the middle class.

column1: The media's role in this is unforgivable and destroyed whatever remained of their moral authority. From here on
column2: they could only get more sweaty
column3: desperate
column4: and dangerous.

column1: 2. Casting off Every Journalistic Ethic to Destroy Trump
Openly
column2: proudly
column3: and belligerently
column4: in order to hijack a presidential election
column5: we were treated to the Pompous Announcement that Trump was such a threat to humanity
column6: it was now time for journalists throughout the land to cast off every standard that makes journalism journalism
column7: starting with objectivity.

column1: Even former good guys like CNN's Jake Tapper morphed into an unrecognizable LyingSnarkVirtueSignalingMachines -- another rotting cog in the Narrative Wheel
column2: a mindless member of a self-deluded
column3: government-worshiping cult that wouldn’t piss on Middle America if we were on fire.

column1: Professional sobriety was cast off because this one was in the bag
column2: baby! And who could miss the historic opportunity to self-righteously point-and-laugh at the hideous rubes as they were finally and forever being buried alive under a Brave New World.

column1: 3. Grind Donald Trump To Dust
While there is no question Trump deserved a few of the kitchen sinks hurled his way
column2: never in my 50 years have I seen such a coordinated
column3: desperate
column4: dishonest
column5: and poisonous campaign to disqualify a human being through the dark art of stripping him and his supporters of all their humanity.

column1: 4. Embracing Confirmation Bias
The longer the general election rolled on
column2: the smaller the bubble of self-delusion became.

column1: Inconvenient polls were sneered at and Voxsplained away.
Exit polls could only means ONE thing
column2: even though it was pretty clear they might mean another.

column1: My personal favorite was the late editorials where
column2: based on no counted votes whatsoever
column3: we were trolled with the news that it was Hillary
column4: not Trump
column5: who would emerge victorious with the ""hidden vote!"" Oh
column6: the delicious irony of that. Oh
column7: how lovely it would be to rub that in the rubes' faces on Election Night.

column1: By the time the votes were actually being counted
column2: I was about 60% sure Hillary would win. The New York Times
column3: however
column4: was 92% sure. ABCNBCCBSAPBSNPRCNNWashingtonPostPolitico were 100% sure.

column1: But even I understood that state and local polls were more erratic than ever
column2: that Hillary did seem legitimately freaked about the upper Midwest
column3: that the best pollster in the country had Trump up +2
column4: that Trump never lost his fervent base
column5: that the right track/wrong track numbers had been upside down for a decade
column6: that there was still a larger-than-usual number of undecideds
column7: that this thing that was Real might not be enough to win
column8: but it was still Real.

column1: No
column2: no
column3: we were told
column4: it's all smoke and mirrors
column5: all gold-leafed Trump Steaks. Look at Obama's approval ratings! Look at the Hispanic vote! Look at this squirrel and that squirrel and the other squirrel over there. Sit down
column6: son
column7: don’t you understand that I'm a data machine? It's science
column8: rube. Don't you Vox
column9: racist?

column1: And then the worst thing imaginable happened….
5. The Media Lost the Election
The hate
column2: the lies
column3: the removal of the mask of objectivity
column4: the pushing of every single chip into the middle of the table -- that can actually work … IF YOU WIN.

column1: But the media didn’t win.
In the most spectacular fashion
column2: with their pants down and their bare ass hanging out for the world to see
column3: they lost.

column1: And with that loss went EVERYTHING.
And now the media is exposed in front of the whole world as a Swaggering Potemkin Bully that no longer has the power to sway public opinion
column2: even when they throw absolutely everything they have at one man
column3: and do so with much of the Republican Party on their side.

column1: Not only has the media forever been exposed as brazenly dishonest and laughably out of touch
column2: worse than all that
column3: they are exposed as WEAK
column4: a force no one need ever fear or kowtow to again.

column1: Without that sheen of fear
column2: without that threat of intimidation
column3: like a vanquished bully
column4: so goes all their power.

column1: F*** you
column2: mainstream media.

column1: The delicious irony of all this is that the last desperate gasp of the political media did actually prove their precious Barack Obama correct about one thing…
The moral arc of history does indeed bend towards justice.

column1: 2257;c65333af24a25c602acdeafb07ee6e35654f3e12;0;;2016-11-11T19:00:00.000+02:00;Poll: Sexism Was NOT A Factor In Hillary's Loss | Daily Wire;"Poll: Sexism Was NOT A Factor In Hillary's Loss By: Aaron Bandler November 11
Some leftists still reeling from Hillary Clinton's stunning defeat on Tuesday are blaming her defeat on supposed sexism against a woman president. However
column2: a new poll suggests that sexism did not play a role at all in Clinton's loss.

column1: The poll
column2: conducted by Conquest Communications Group and published on Just Facts
column3: featured a question specifically geared toward gauging potential sexism: ""If you were faced with a choice between a male and a female presidential candidate
column4: who would you vote for?""

column1: Here were the results (emphasis added):
Overall
column2: 69% of voters said “It does not matter
column3: ” 15% preferred a female
column4: 12% preferred a male
column5: 3% were unsure
column6: and 1% refused to answer.

column1: Male voters and Trump voters were more likely than any other groups to say “It does not matter
column2: ” at 73% and 72% respectively. The other groups were not far behind and within the margins of error
column3: with rates of: 67% for Clinton voters. 66% for undecided voters. 64% for females.

column1: Naturally
column2: supporters of Trump were more likely to support a male president than a female president–25 percent to 2 percent
column3: respectively–and Clinton supporters were more likely to support female president than a male president
column4: 27 percent to 5 percent
column5: respectively.

column1: The survey was conducted from October 11-23
column2: so it was taken a couple of weeks before the election. But it's hard to imagine a majority of voters all of a sudden turned into a bunch of sexists.

column1: There is a little bias towards a male president among Trump voters and a little bias towards a female president among Clinton voters
column2: but the results of the survey suggest that overall
column3: the genitalia of a candidate is not a significant factor involved in most voters when it comes to choosing the next president of the United States.

column1: Democrats will have to find a different strategy for identity politics since the gender card doesn't work. Speaking of identity politics
column2: it looks like the race card seems to be in trouble as well . Tags ";english;2016-11-11T22:41:02.501+02:00;dailywire.com;US;15846.0;Poll: Sexism Was NOT A Factor In Hillary's Loss | Daily Wire;0.069;http://www.dailywire.com/sites/default/files/styles/169large/public/uploads/2016/11/hillary_clinton_gi.jpg?itok=-H2b6AeG;0;0;0;0;0;bias

column1: 2260;6219bb9b5170c1e6cb8c52fb93ffc64ddc945c3a;0;;2016-11-12T06:59:00.000+02:00;7 Reasons Trump Won | Daily Wire;"Aaron Bandler November 11
President-elect Donald Trump. That is still a term that is surreal to a lot of people
column2: as he was not expected to win on Tuesday. What were the driving factors that propelled Trump to the presidency? How was he able to pull off such a stunning upset?

column1: Here are seven reasons why Trump won.
1. Hillary Clinton was unable to get the minority vote to turn out for her. Last night
column2: Dems were calling the race a ""Whitelash"" -- wrong. Mitt won 59% of white vote
column3: Trump won 58%. Minority voters didn't turn out. — David French (@DavidAFrench) November 9

column1: In fact
column2: Trump was able to get a larger share of the minority vote than Mitt Romney did in 2012
column3: as the Daily Wire has explained :

column1: Unsurprisingly
column2: Trump lost to Clinton in the Latino and black votes by margins of 88 percent to 8 percent and 65 percent and 29 percent
column3: respectively. Surprisingly
column4: this was better than Romney fared among the aforementioned demographics in 2012
column5: as he lost both groups by margins of 93 percent to 7 percent and 71 percent to 27 percent
column6: respectively

column1: Michael Barone has noted that ""turnout fell in heavily black Philadelphia
column2: Cleveland
column3: Detroit
column4: and Milwaukee. Millennial generation turnout was tepid
column5: and Trump carried white Millennials by 5 points.""

column1: The enthusiasm was just not there for Clinton.
2. Trump was able to pull in former Obama voters. According to the Washington Post
column2: Trump was able to win over one-third of the 700 counties that went for Obama twice. Clinton was only able to win six of the 2
column3: 200 counties that didn't go for Obama. Trump was better at obtaining crossover voters than Clinton was.

column1: So who are these former Obama voters who voted for Trump in 2016
column2: and what caused them to switch?

column1: 3. These former Obama voters felt that Trump cared about them
column2: and the Democrat Party did not. John Daniel Davidson explains in The Federalist that Clinton and the Democrat Party took the blue-collar
column3: working class whites in the Rust Belt for granted–exemplified by Clinton's pledge ""to put a lot of coal miners and coal companies out of business""–and it was to their detriment. The Rust Belt has been in economic decline for years
column4: but it has suffered greatly from the Obama administration's regulations towards coal.

column1: While the Democrats wrote off the Rust Belt
column2: Trump actually acknowledged their struggles
column3: and that was all it took.

column1: Trump was the first national political figure in generations who saw them
column2: acknowledged that they have been left behind
column3: that their cities and towns are in a state of persistent decline
column4: and promised to help out somehow
column5: writes Davidson. ""When you’re used to being dismissed as bitter folks who cling to guns and religion
column6: as President Obama did in 2008
column7: or denounced as 'deplorables' and 'irredeemable
column8: ' as Hillary Clinton did during this election
column9: respect goes a long way—even if there are no easy solutions
column10: from Washington or anywhere else
column11: to the problems that plague your town.""

column1: 4. The FBI re-opening its investigation into Hillary's emails helped Trump. Per RedState
column2: author Ed Klein said on the Steve Malzberg Show that Clinton was sobbing ""inconsolably"" on election night and was blaming FBI director James Comey re-opening the investigation as well as Obama for not stopping the investigation as to why she lost.

column1: There's no question that the re-opening of the investigation did considerably help Trump
column2: as the polls severely tightened after the announcement. Poll numbers showed that the vast majority of Americans felt that Hillary was acting in an immoral manner. The spotlight was off of Trump's vulgar comments towards women and his sexual assault accusers
column3: and instead the focus was on Clinton's private email server. But Clinton is leaving out one major person who is responsible for her loss...

column1: 5. Hillary was a terrible candidate. If Clinton had been elected president
column2: she would have been the first elected president to have been the subject of numerous FBI investigations. She broke the law by using her private email server to conduct official State Department business and there was a lot of quid pro quo that occurred at the Clinton Foundation . Clinton is robotic and devoid of charisma with a record in politics that is short of accomplishments but rich in failure
column3: sleaze
column4: and corruption. Basically
column5: Clinton is ""an Obama Democrat without Obama's charm
column6: according to Jonah Goldberg .

column1: She may have been the only Democratic candidate that could lose to Trump
column2: and the Democrats wanted to coronate her from the beginning. They have no one to blame but themselves for President Trump.

column1: 6. The public no longer has any faith in the media–and that includes late-night comics. Will Rahn wrote at CBS News that the ""unbearable smugness"" of the Clinton-biased media was off-putting to a lot of voters
column2: as they sneered at Trump supporters as stupid backward hicks while doing everything they could to prop up Clinton. Trump's vitriol toward the press ended up benefiting him politically. Poll numbers reflect this
column3: as trust in the media has declined over the years. Rahn explains:

column1: Journalists increasingly don’t even believe in the possibility of reasoned disagreement
column2: and as such ascribe cynical motives to those who think about things a different way. We see this in the ongoing veneration of “facts
column3: ” the ones peddled by explainer websites and data journalists who believe themselves to be curiously post-ideological.

column1: That the explainers and data journalists so frequently get things hilariously wrong never invites the soul-searching you’d think it would. Instead
column2: it all just somehow leads us to more smugness
column3: more meanness
column4: more certainty from the reporters and pundits. Faced with defeat
column5: we retreat further into our bubble
column6: assumptions left unchecked. No
column7: it’s the voters who are wrong.

column1: As a direct result
column2: we get it wrong with greater frequency. Out on the road
column3: we forget to ask the right questions. We can’t even imagine the right question. We go into assignments too certain that what we find will serve to justify our biases. The public’s estimation of the press declines even further -- fewer than one-in-three Americans trust the press
column4: per Gallup -- which starts the cycle anew.

column1: The same applies to late-night comics. Mollie Hemingway writes in The Federalist that Jon Stewart is partly responsible for the election of Trump because of how he single-handedly destroyed CNN's Crossfire
column2: resulting in ""a new age of hyper-political
column3: hyper-liberal late-night comedy."" Stewart's The Daily Show spawned Stephen Colbert
column4: John Oliver
column5: Trevor Noah and several other lefty comics that perverted comedy into smarmy left-wing political lectures talking down to conservatives.

column1: Jon Stewart is known for brutally deriding a show that featured people of differing views civilly discussing issues of the day
column2: writes Hemingway. ""He got that show killed and significantly strengthened the world where cultural elites engaged in groupthink mockery of those with whom they disagree. The results include a further erosion of civility
column3: a decrease in Americans’ ability to understand each other and their concerns
column4: and
column5: of all things
column6: President-elect Donald Trump.""

column1: Which all culminates into the main reason why Trump was elected...
7. Americans are tired of being trashed by leftist elites. Ben Shapiro explains :
Trump won because many Americans were sick of being told that they were the racists as Barack Obama and his Department of Justice stoked race riots in major cities around the country.
Trump won because many Americans were sick of watching other Americans being destroyed for their supposed intolerance – for their religious beliefs
column2: for their unwillingness to label women men and men women
column3: for their support for traditional marriage or conservative political candidates.

column1: Trump won because many Americans were tired of the media’s constant harping on America’s flaws – we were supposedly sexist
column2: racist
column3: and homophobic. Americans said that they did not believe the media
column4: and they were right to do so.

column1: In other words
column2: the left has been tearing down America as a country infested with intolerant
column3: prejudicial bigots who are incapable of thinking for themselves and needed to rely on them on how to live their lives. The people finally had had enough
column4: so they elected the man whom they felt best stuck it to the leftist elites. Tags ";english;2016-11-12T15:50:51.530+02:00;dailywire.com;US;15846.0;7 Reasons Trump Won | Daily Wire;0.302;http://www.dailywire.com/sites/default/files/styles/169large/public/uploads/2016/10/gettyimages-612898956.jpg?itok=MrlMj0bX;0;0;0;0;0;bias

column1: 2265;4214801e869e144b4b18bce1d2926aeedb57d89f;0;;2016-11-14T05:07:00.000+02:00;Trump Begins to Walk Back Illegal Immigration Promises | Daily Wire;"Frank Camp November 13
During an interview with Lesley Stahl for 60 Minutes
column2: which will air in its entirety Sunday night
column3: Donald Trump began to walk back his campaign promise regarding the deportation of illegal immigrants:

column1: We are getting them out of our country
column2: the president elect said about the several million illegal immigrants with serious criminal records. ""After the border is secure and after everything gets normalized
column3: we're going to make a determination on the people you're talking about who are terrific people
column4: they're terrific people who we're going to make a determination on
column5: but before we make a determination
column6: we want to secure our border.""

column1: Gasp.
Donald Trump rose to political fame on the back of his strong stance on illegal immigration. Throughout the primary process
column2: he promised a "" deportation force
column3: telling MSNBC's Mika Brzezinski in November 2015:

column1: You're going to have a deportation force
column2: and you're going to do it humanely. Don't forget
column3: Mika
column4: that you have millions of people that are waiting in line to come into this country and they're waiting to come in legally. And I always say the wall
column5: we're going to build the wall. It's going to be a real deal. It's going to be a real wall.""

column1: In August
column2: Trump delivered a major immigration speech in Phoenix
column3: Arizona
column4: in which he softened his stance a bit
column5: focusing on illegal immigrants who have committed serious crimes:

column1: Within ICE
column2: I am going to create a new special deportation task force focused on identifying and quickly removing the most dangerous criminal illegal immigrants in America who have evaded justice.""

column1: He then added that ""anyone who has entered the United States illegally is subject to deportation. That is what it means to have laws and to have a country. Otherwise we don’t have a country.""
During the final presidential debate between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton
column2: Trump reiterated his position against amnesty:

column1: Well
column2: first of all
column3: [Clinton] wants to give amnesty
column4: which is a disaster and very unfair to all of the people that are waiting on line for many
column5: many years. We need strong borders.""

column1: For Trump diehards
column2: these statements were enough. Their guy was going to deport 11 million illegal immigrants
column3: and no one would tell them otherwise. However
column4: as anyone with access to Google should know
column5: the president elect has long supported amnesty in some fashion.

column1: In July 2015
column2: Donald Trump told CNN's Dana Bash:

column1: I would get people out and then have an expedited way of getting them back into the country so they can be legal…A lot of these people are helping us…and sometimes it’s jobs a citizen of the United States doesn’t want to do. I want to move ’em out
column2: and we’re going to move ’em back in and let them be legal.""

column1: What Trump was talking about is known as ""touchback amnesty."" Such a plan would indeed involve the deportation of illegal immigrants
column2: but allow them an expedited means of returning to the United States in order to obtain legal status. In other words
column3: they touch base in their home country
column4: then come right back.

column1: In November 2015
column2: Eric Trump repeated his father's plan during an interview with Fox News' Megyn Kelly:

column1: The point isn’t just deporting them
column2: it’s deporting them and letting them back in legally. He’s been so clear about that and I know the liberal media wants to misconstrue it
column3: but its deporting them and letting them back legally.""

column1: Going back further
column2: Trump's support for amnesty is even more stark. Speaking on Fox & Friends in 2012
column3: he said:

column1: For people that have been here for years that have been hard-workers
column2: have good jobs
column3: they’re supporting their family–it’s very
column4: very tough to just say ‘By the way
column5: 22 years
column6: you have to leave. Get out’…I’m one of the world’s very conservative people
column7: but I have to tell you on a human basis
column8: how do you throw somebody out that’s lived in this country for twenty years?""

column1: During the 2012 presidential election cycle
column2: Trump even called Mitt Romney's idea of self-deportation "" maniacal
column3: and remarked that Republican Party policy toward illegal immigrants was "" mean-spirited .""

column1: Donald Trump is a man who will say whatever he needs to in order to win. Now that he has won
column2: he's already backtracking on multiple campaign promises
column3: from the repeal of the Affordable Care Act (ACA) to the deportation of illegal immigrants. With Donald Trump elected to the presidency
column2: one of the policies that will likely come under fire is sanctuary cities
column3: cities with policies that make them safe havens for illegal aliens. The issue became front-and-center during the early portion of the Republican primary when Trump decried the murder of Kate Steinle by an illegal alien in San Francisco
column4: a sanctuary city.

column1: In response to the election of Trump
column2: leftist city leaders are digging in
column3: officials in Los Angeles
column4: Chicago and Boston signaling that they will not cooperate with the federal government's deportation efforts. Here are five things you need to know about sanctuary cities.

column1: 1. Sanctuary cities are a blatant violation of federal law. Some on the left have tried to claim that they're perfectly legal
column2: but this is clearly false. As James Walsh
column3: former associate general counsel of Immigration and Naturalization Services
column4: explains
column5: 8 USC section 1324 ""deals with those persons who knowingly conceal
column6: harbor
column7: or shield undocumented aliens and could apply to officials in sanctuary cities and states.""

column1: The fact that leftists are digging their heels in on sanctuary cities means they're supporting a form of nullification
column2: an irony not missed by Victor Davis Hanson :

column1: Much of the rural West opposes the Endangered Species Act. Can Wyoming declare that federally protected rats and bugs are not protected inside its state borders
column2: when such pests obstruct construction of dams or highways? Many conservatives oppose federal restrictions on gun sales. Could Oklahoma City declare hand-gun purchases within its city-limits free of federal firearms statutes? Perhaps Little Rock could ignore a Supreme Court ruling and announce that gay marriage is not legal within its jurisdiction. On what rationale would liberals in California object to such nullifications -- that neither state nor city had the right to ignore a federal law or to obstruct the law enforcement duties of federal officials?

column1: Trump and the GOP can fight against sanctuary cities by cutting off federal funding and sending in federal agents to mandate the cities to follow the law.
2. Sanctuary cities undermine law enforcement. Not only do they refuse to cooperate with federal agents in deporting illegals
column2: sanctuary cities make it more difficult for police officers to do their job. Some police officers in the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) expressed their frustration with the city's sanctuary city policy to Heather Mac Donald in 2004:

column1: “We can’t even talk about it
column2: ” says a frustrated LAPD captain. “People are afraid of a backlash from Hispanics.” Another LAPD commander in a predominantly Hispanic
column3: gang-infested district sighs: “I would get a firestorm of criticism if I talked about [enforcing the immigration law against illegals].”

column1: In that 2004 piece
column2: Mac Donald documents how members of the LAPD were able to recognize known gang members
column3: but couldn't do anything to apprehend them until they had committed a crime – despite the fact that they were illegals who repeatedly snuck back into the country. This is the case with other sanctuary cities as well.

column1: 3. Sanctuary cities are ""akin to roulette."" ""The odds suggest that most illegal aliens detained by officials are not career felons and thus supposedly need not be turned over to ICE for deportation

column3: 000 released criminals will go on to commit further crimes in the manner of Juan Lopez-Sanchez
column4: officials then shrug that the public outcry will be episodic and quickly die down
column5: or will at least not pose political problems as great as would come from deporting aliens.""

column1: But the odds don't suggest this. Hanson notes that according to Mac Donald
column2: ""Two-thirds of all outstanding felony warrants in the city of Los Angeles involved illegal aliens -- as well as 95% of outstanding murder warrants.""

column1: Additionally

column4: 265 illegals from deportation
column5: 62 percent of which ""had significant prior criminal histories"" and 2
column6: 320 of them were subsequently rearrested for new crimes

column2: writes Horowitz. ""This is just a nine-month snapshot of the devastation from sanctuary policies. As of last year
column3: 69% of them were still at large. So much for not being a flight risk.""

column1: According to Vaughn
column2: from January 2014 to September 30
column4: sanctuary cities rebuked over 17
column5: 000 detainers
column6: 68 percent of which involved ""individuals with a prior criminal history.""

column1: Based on these statistics
column2: it would seem that the odds are against the cities' residents who could be harmed by criminal aliens
column3: which makes it no surprise that...

column1: 4. Crime has surged in sanctuary cities. The Daily Wire 's Hank Berrien reported on the following from Louisiana attorney general Jeff Landry:

column2: that sanctuary city policies ""allow illegals to commit crimes

2476;ae97e6f2cc585f633a7b400af853b315891183db;0;;2016-10-28T09:30:00.000+03:00;Pomegranate Pistachio Pancakes - David Avocado Wolfe - DavidWolfe.com;"Pomegranate Pistachio Pancakes
A gluten-free pancake stack that can pass off as dessert? Yes please!
These pomegranate pistachio pancakes contain no added sugar or grains – all you need is a banana and two eggs for a sweet and perfectly moist pancake.
While you can top them with whatever you like
column2: this pomegranate and pistachio version is great for fall. They add a pop of color
column3: crunch
column4: and flavor – perfect for Sunday brunch or whenever you’re in the mood for a stack.

column1: Pomegranate Pistachio Pancakes
1/4 tsp. almond or vanilla extract (optional) 1/8 tsp. baking powder (optional
column2: for fluffier pancakes) 2 large eggs 1 Tbsp. unrefined coconut oil (or other oil) ½ cup pomegranate arils 2 Tbsp. chopped pistachios

column1: Instructions: Peel the banana and break it into 4 parts in a bowl. Use a fork to mash it thoroughly into a pudding like consistency. Add the extract and baking powder if using. In another bowl
column2: whisk the eggs together. Then
column3: pour the eggs into the banana bowl
column4: and mix well until thoroughly combined. It will be a very liquid-like consistency. Heat a skillet or griddle over medium heat. Add a few teaspoons of coconut oil. Use about 2 tablespoons of batter per pancake. Cook for about 1 minute. Sprinkle with a few pomegranate seeds before flipping and cooking an additional minute on the other side. Transfer the cooked pancakes to a plate
column5: and stack them high. Top with additional pomegranate
column6: pistachios
column7: and maple syrup.

column1: Get the printable recipe here .

column1: 3686;e203480a45c34af760164a9fefaae498ac3f0395;0;Daniel Greenfield;2016-10-27T09:20:32.054+03:00;They Knew: The End of the Clinton Lies Begins;"They Knew: The End of the Clinton Lies Begins There’s only one lie left. October 27
column2: 2016 Daniel Greenfield

column1: Daniel Greenfield
column2: a Shillman Journalism Fellow at the Freedom Center
column3: is a New York writer focusing on radical Islam.

column1: During Hillary Clinton’s first presidential campaign
column2: Neera Tanden was described as “the wonk behind Hillary.” A close associate of the Clintons
column3: Tanden helped shape policy for both Bill and Hillary. Then she switched to playing that role for Obama.

column1: While Hillary’s email scandal broke
column2: Tanden was in charge of the Center for American Progress
column3: a radical left-wing group that had been described as ""Obama's Idea Factory."" And she was chatting with John Podesta
column4: the top Clintonite who had founded CAP. Podesta had co-chaired the Obama-Biden Transition Project. Neera Tanden would co-chair the Hillary-Kaine Transition Project under Podesta who headed up Hillary’s presidential campaign. Podesta had helped shape the last eight years of national politics through Obama and Tanden looked forward to shaping the next eight under Hillary.

column1: And what did they think of Hillary? Did they believe their defenses of her wrongdoing?
Podesta and Tanden ridiculed her associates for the cover-up. “Why didn’t they get this stuff out like 18 months ago? So crazy
column2: ” she wondered. “Unbelievable
column3: ” Podesta wrote. “They wanted to get away with it.”

column1: Since the early days of the email scandal
column2: we’ve been treated to the sordid rituals of feigned innocence. The issue was a non-issue
column3: Clinton surrogates were quick to assure us. And even if it was
column4: no one did anything wrong. The flies on the wall knew better though and now we can all be the flies on the wall.

column1: Away from the cameras and the briefings
column2: the Clintonites held their bosses in contempt. Neera Tanden
column3: a supposed close associate of Hillary
column4: blasted her instincts as “suboptimal” and described her as suffering from a character problem. And there was never any doubt as to what was going on.

column1: Tanden ridiculed Cheryl Mills for the mess. Mills fired off an email to Podesta warning that Obama’s denial wouldn’t hold up. “We need to clean this up -- he has emails from her -- they do not say state.gov
column2: ” she warned.

column1: Obama had offered his usual denial claiming to have only learned about the scandal from the media. The revelation that Hillary had emailed Obama from her illegal address would show that he had lied. But meanwhile his people struggled to reinvent his lie by claiming that while he knew about her illegal address
column2: he didn’t know that it was illegal. This put his lie in line with Hillary’s lie.

column1: There was only one problem.
When in doubt
column2: the Clintons take refuge in the final lie that you may be able to prove that they did wrong
column3: but not that they meant to do wrong. That was Hillary’s final email defense to the FBI. Spliced with claims of memory loss due to a concussion was that old Sergeant Schultz favorite
column4: “I know nothing.”

column1: But that defense completely falls apart once you prove that they did know. That is what the leaked emails have begun doing. They are establishing that the Sergeant Schultz defense is utterly hollow.
Cheryl Mills knew. John Podesta knew. Barack Obama knew. And Hillary Clinton knew.
When Obama told a lie that could easily be disproven while trying to distance himself from Hillary
column2: Mills quickly fired off a warning that he had better get his story straight. And his people did. That makes Obama complicit before and after the fact. He knew what Hillary was doing when she was doing it. And his people participated in the effort to cover it up afterward
column3: not just to protect her
column4: but to protect him.

column1: Hillary Clinton was not a rogue actor. She was part of an administration that had waged a war on transparency. Even media allies had dubbed it as the least transparent administration in history.
Lies
column2: censorship and targeting whistleblowers were the norm for Obama Inc. A New York Times reporter dubbed it
column3: “The greatest enemy of press freedom in a generation.” The Washington Post noted that the
column4: “Obama administration routinely makes a mockery of its long-ago pledge to establish itself as the most transparent administration in U.S. history.” The AP pointed out that it
column5: “more often than ever censored government files or outright denied access to them.”

column1: Bizarre administration email dodges included EPA boss Lisa Jackson using Richard Windsor as her alias. Jackson/Windsor left the EPA and took a seat on the board of the Clinton Foundation.
Tanden and Podesta didn’t take issue with Hillary Clinton breaking the law
column2: but with her clumsy political instincts
column3: her inability to fake sincere apologies and spin scandals as smoothly as Obama. Hillary’s biggest flaw in their eyes was her clumsiness at covering up acts that were routine in in Obamaworld. They didn’t despise her because she broke the law
column4: but because she was bad at it.

column1: That made her a threat to their political futures.

Hillary’s clumsy instincts led her to the point of having to admit what she did while denying having intended to do it. Motive is simultaneously the strongest and weakest defense. You can prove what someone else did
column2: but it is hard to prove what someone else meant to do.

column1: Unless you have their emails.

This is Hillary’s firewall. It’s what every painful trickle of the scandal was meant to drag out and delay. Every partial revelation is buying time while bringing us closer to the final breach in the motive wall.
What the Podesta emails tell us is that they knew. Those around Hillary knew. And those around them knew that the inner circle knew. They knew and they hated Hillary for being a bad liar. And now
column2: as the inside drama of Clintonworld spills across the internet
column3: the red queen moves closer to being in check.

column1: By making it all about motive
column2: Hillary Clinton turned personal communications
column3: particularly emails
column4: into the key instrument of culpability. That is why Podesta’s emails are such a hot commodity. It’s why her emails are becoming an even bigger prize.

column1: Neera Tanden was right. Hillary Clinton’s political instincts are suboptimal. She is the member of the Obama graduating class voted least likely to be able to lie convincingly on national television. And she has a perverse knack for dragging everyone around her into her scandals while exposing their own.

We know that her people knew that she lied. We know that Obama lied. All that’s left is her final lie.";english;2016-10-27T09:20:32.054+03:00;frontpagemag.com;US;34811.0;They Knew: The End of the Clinton Lies Begins;0.0;http://www.frontpagemag.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_full/public/uploads/2016/10/1024px-defense.gov_photo_essay_091203-n-0696m-239.jpg?itok=FsCSUk1t;0;1;0;0;0;hate

3688;ee33576e122585e8b89dd8213a9b43df761c942f;0;Robert Spencer;2016-10-27T09:20:32.939+03:00;Realism About the Jihad Threat in Oklahoma;"Realism About the Jihad Threat in Oklahoma Oklahoma State Rep. John Bennett ventures where few dare to tread. October 27
column2: 2016 Robert Spencer

column1: In an age of near-universal denial and willful ignorance at the highest levels about the ideological roots
column2: nature and magnitude of the jihad threat
column3: it is as unusual as it is refreshing to find lawmakers at any level who are willing to approach the problem honestly. State Representative John Bennett of Oklahoma
column4: a Marine and combat veteran of Iraq and Afghanistan
column5: is one of an all-too-rare breed.

column1: On Tuesday
column2: Bennett held an “Interim Study” on “the current threat posed by radical Islam and the effect that Shariah Law
column3: the Muslim Brotherhood and jihadist indoctrination have in the radicalization process in Oklahoma and America.” In his request to hold this study
column4: he explained: “This will be a study of the current threat posed by radical Islam and the effect that Shariah Law
column5: the Muslim Brotherhood and jihadist indoctrination have in the radicalization process in Oklahoma and America.”

column1: This kind of study should have been held not just in the Oklahoma House of Representatives
column2: but in the U.S. House
column3: and Senate as well. That such an idea is inconceivable is an indication of the fix we’re in. And the situation is only marginally better in Oklahoma: nowadays the misinformation and disinformation about what we’re up against is so universal that anywhere the truth is told about this threat
column4: there is significant pushback from the allies and enablers of jihad and Islamic supremacism.

column1: And so it was in Tulsa on Tuesday. The interim study featured testimony by former FBI agent John Guandolo and Chris Gaubatz
column2: whose exploits as an undercover agent infiltrating the Hamas-linked Council on American-Islamic Relations (CAIR) are chronicled in the eye-opening book Muslim Mafia .

column1: Gaubatz and Guandolo presented evidence
column2: including land records
column3: showing that the Islamic Society of Greater Oklahoma City (ISGOC) is owned by the Muslim Brotherhood group the North American Islamic Trust (NAIT)
column4: that both CAIR
column5: which has an active chapter in Oklahoma City
column6: and ISGOC are Muslim Brotherhood organizations
column7: and that CAIR has extensive ties to the jihad terror group Hamas
column8: which styles itself the Muslim Brotherhood for Palestine. They pointed out that since Imad Enchassi
column9: the imam of ISGOC
column10: is a Palestinian and has all these ties to the Muslim Brotherhood
column11: he likely also has links to Hamas.

column1: Guandolo and Gaubatz did not base their case on innuendo and hearsay. They laid out FBI evidence
column2: Muslim Brotherhood documents
column3: and more
column4: demonstrating that the claims they were making were based on solid evidence.

column1: Predictably
column2: however
column3: the mainstream media
column4: which we now know beyond any shadow of a doubt is simply and solely a propaganda arm for the Left and the Democratic Party
column5: focused entirely on the presence of Adam Soltani of CAIR-OK and Enchassi. The Tulsa World ran a piece with the hysterical headline “State representative brands CAIR-OK
column6: its director and a local imam as terrorists.” It quoted Soltani raging against Bennett: “Rep. Bennett is shamefully wasting taxpayer money to promote his own biased agenda. This hearing was a new low for Rep. Bennett
column7: as his guests presented a biased narrative that achieves nothing more than demonizing and marginalizing the Oklahoma Muslim community.”

column1: The World magisterially told its readers that “CAIR is a Muslim civil liberties and advocacy group working to enhance the understanding of Islam.” It didn’t see fit to mention that CAIR is an unindicted co-conspirator in a Hamas terror funding case — so named by the Justice Department. There was not a word in the World report about how CAIR officials have repeatedly refused to denounce Hamas and Hizballah as terrorist groups. Several former CAIR officials have been convicted of various crimes related to jihad terror . CAIR’s cofounder and longtime Board chairman (Omar Ahmad)
column2: as well as its chief spokesman (Ibrahim Hooper)
column3: have made Islamic supremacist statements . (Ahmad denies this
column4: but the original reporter stands by her story .) A California chapter distributed a poster telling Muslims not to talk to the FBI
column5: and a Florida chapter distributed pamphlets with the same message . CAIR has opposed virtually every anti-terror measure that has been proposed or implemented and has been declared a terror organization by the United Arab Emirates.

column1: But the Tulsa World and other mainstream media outlets that covered Bennett’s study did not see fit to inform their readers of any of that; instead
column2: predictably enough
column3: they portrayed the hearing as a baseless exercise in race-baiting and fearmongering conducted by a politician up for reelection.

column1: John Bennett
column2: and the people of Oklahoma
column3: deserve better. There are legitimate questions about CAIR and ISGOC; Bennett dared to raise them Tuesday; for that
column4: he is being subjected to a media lynching that is cynically designed to obscure the genuine concerns he raised – yet ever since a member of ISGOC beheaded a coworker in 2014
column5: these concerns are more urgent than ever.

column1: The media enablers of jihad must be decisively repudiated. Please email the Speaker of the Oklahoma House
column2: Jeff W. Hickman
column3: politely and courteously expressing your support for John Bennett and requesting that his hearing be just the first of a series. His email is [email protected] and his phone number is (405) 557-7339.

column1: John Bennett has yet again stuck his neck out for freedom. In these hard times
column2: those who are willing to do that have to hang together.";english;2016-10-27T09:20:32.939+03:00;frontpagemag.com;US;34811.0;Realism About the Jihad Threat in Oklahoma;0.0;http://www.frontpagemag.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_full/public/uploads/2016/10/msc-house-bills-sidelined-bbf-1-web.jpg?itok=KzadV_TO;0;1;0;0;0;hate
