column1: 3751;99bf5df6c68d411b4e533d7549064b92a1cff8b3;0;Bruce Thornton;2016-11-02T06:45:42.060+02:00;Will James Comey Change the Outcome of the Election?;"Will James Comey Change the Outcome of the Election? Is this the game-changing October surprise that many hope for -- and others dread? November 2
Bruce Thornton is a Shillman Journalism Fellow at the David Horowitz Freedom Center.

FBI Director James Comey’s reopening of the investigation into Clinton’s emails has roiled once more the presidential election. Donald Trump has called the decision “courageous” and “bigger than Watergate.” Clinton
column2: the DOJ
column3: Democrat Senators
column4: and their media flying monkeys are all having conniption fits over their quondam champion’s defection
column5: calling the announcement “appalling
column6: ” “absurd
column7: ” “strange
column8: ” “deeply troubling
column9: ” an “attack
column10: ” and “unprecedented.” The bigger question is whether it will move enough voters over to Trump’s side and put him in the White House.

column1: There’s no doubt that Comey’s announcement eleven days before the election is mystifying. Not because it is “unprecedented” as the Democrats keep squealing. They had no such qualms when the weekend before the 1992 election
column2: special prosecutor Lawrence Walsh indicted a poll-surging George H.W. Bush for his alleged involvement in the Iran-Contra scandal. No
column3: the mystery is Comey’s motives. Is Comey like Conrad’s Lord Jim
column4: now sacrificing his FBI career––sure to be over if the notoriously vengeful Clinton is elected–– to atone for having besmirched his office
column5: reputation
column6: and the principle of equality before the law in service to careerist self-interest? Or was he facing a mutiny and leaks from disgruntled FBI investigators? To quote one of our candidates
column7: “At this point
column8: what difference does it make?”

column1: The real question is whether it will make a difference to the voters. Right now we don’t know if the content of the 650
column2: 000 emails from the conjugal laptop used by serial sexter Anthony Weiner
column3: estranged husband of Clinton vizier Huma Abedin
column4: will reveal something damning like
column5: say
column6: classified materials. But we already know that Clinton passed classified information over an unsecured server
column7: which didn’t bother Comey back in July. So what could be in these new emails that rises above Comey’s sophistic “extreme carelessness
column8: ” and reaches the statute’s “gross negligence”? Or has Comey found new evidence of Hillary’s “intent
column9: ” his other exculpatory sophistry that had little to do with the law? There had to be something that made Comey subject himself to the scorched-earth wrath of the Democrats.

column1: Whatever is found on the Abedin laptop
column2: one wonders if will even matter to a sufficient number of voters. They have shrugged off so many scandals
column3: lies
column4: and failures that should have sunk a candidacy
column5: that it’s hard to calculate what level of incompetence
column6: unpleasantness
column7: dishonesty
column8: sleaze
column9: and crime is disqualifying anymore. Here are the greatest hits from Hillary’s catalogue: Whitewater Missing billing records from her tenure at the Rose Law Firm Renting out the Lincoln Bedroom to donors Travelgate Illegal possession of FBI files Conducting illegal secret meetings of the Task Force on National Health Care Reform Cackling over keeping a pedophile rapist out of jail Hounding the victims of her husband’s sexual assaults and philandering Stealing $200
column10: 000 worth of china
column11: furniture
column12: and artwork from the White House Claiming she landed under “sniper fire” in Bosnia Claiming she and Bill left the White House “dead broke” Shaking down Wall Street while assuring the Orcs of capitalism that she’s got their back Charging exorbitant speaking fees for a half hour of banalities and bromides Calling 30
column13: 000 missing emails “personal” communications Lying about the Benghazi attack to the faces of the four dead Americans’ families Supporting the lie that the attacks were caused by an obscure Internet video when she knew the same night that they weren’t Perjuring herself before Congress and the FBI about the emails and her private server The disastrous overthrow of Ghaddafi in Libya The disastrous “reset” with Russia The disastrous nuclear deal with Iran The disastrous withdrawal from Iraq The corrupt Clinton Foundation and its wholly owned subsidiary
column14: the pay-to-play State Department Using feminist rhetoric while taking cash from some of the planet’s most brutally misogynistic regimes Serially flip-flopping on issues like same-sex marriage
column15: the Trans Pacific Trade deal
column16: and the Keystone pipeline Promising to “raise taxes on the middle class” and “put coal miners out of work” Her campaign staff’s dirty tricks against Trump and his supporters Her campaign staff’s incestuous relationship with the media Her staff’s illegal destruction of incriminating evidence during the email investigation Her strong support of gruesome late-term abortions And
column17: last but not least
column18: the continuing unanswered questions about her physical and cognitive health

column1: Back in the day
column2: just a few of these gaffes
column3: deceptions
column4: and failures would probably have sunk a campaign for Congress
column5: let alone the White House.

column1: And Mr. Trump’s offenses? He’s talks exactly as you’d expect a New York real estate developer
column2: casino owner
column3: reality television star
column4: and beauty pageant mogul to talk He’s condemned as a sexual assaulter for saying a decade ago what Bill Clinton and every White-House-visiting rapper
column5: movie star
column6: or rock star knows about the sexual perks of celebrity: “When you’re a star they let you do it
column7: ” as Trump bragged of his crude sexual advances He’s ignorant of policy He doesn’t understand the economics of global trade He doesn’t know what the “nuclear triad” is He’s addicted to a half dozen superlative adjectives He wants to build a wall with Mexico He takes legal advantage of tax law He’s not “suitable” for office He does not have the right “temperament” He’s used bankruptcy as a business tool He’s accused of groping over a dozen women
column8: including a polymorphously perverse porn star He’s mean and insulting He has orange hair

column1: In short
column2: Trump lacks the superficial patina of rhetorical decorum and sober demeanor that most modern presidents and candidates spray over their public personas in order to hide their private flaws and vices. Just ask Hillary’s various Secret Service details how wide the distance between public and private personalities can be.

column1: The voters will decide for themselves which candidate’s catalogue of sins is more disqualifying and dangerous. But whatever happens
column2: it’s clear that we the people have lowered the bar of acceptability for presidential candidates.

column1: This transformation happened decades before Trump and Hillary came along. After Bill Clinton was impeached for perjury related to his sordid sexual depredations in the White House
column2: his approval ratings were 73%. He left the White House with a 66% rating
column3: higher than any president since Harry Truman
column4: including Ronald Reagan. Think about it: the president who sexually exploited an intern and was impeached for perjury left office with higher approval ratings than the president who rescued the economy and tossed the Soviet Union into its own dustbin of history.

column1: That was the inflection point for our political culture. No wonder that Barack Obama’s lack of any real-world experience or achievement
column2: left-wing views
column3: self-confessed drug use
column4: friends like the anti-American racist Jeremiah Wright and unrepentant terrorist Bill Ayers
column5: and gaping holes in his biography were unimportant to 45 million voters. So why now are we shocked
column6: shocked that off-brand candidates like Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump are vying for the presidency? Decrying these candidates is closing the barn door after the horses of virtue
column7: wisdom
column8: and decorum have already long gone.

column1: So absent a smoking howitzer in the next WikiLeaks dump
column2: Comey’s restart of the investigation
column3: which in any case will take months to complete
column4: will probably not be the game-changing October surprise many hope for and others dread
column5: especially given a corrupt media’s studied indifference to anything that damages their candidate. Then again
column6: the rapid erosion of Hillary’s support is drawing analogies to Reagan’s late surge against Carter.

column1: Either way
column2: on November 8
column3: most people will vote their economic interests and their ideological passions
column4: and decide based on subjective perceptions and silly criteria like “cares for people like me.” Or they might just finally realize that Hillary’s accumulated offenses are intolerable. But what that standard of selection will deliver is anybody’s guess.";english;2016-11-02T06:45:42.060+02:00;frontpagemag.com;US;34811.0;Will James Comey Change the Outcome of the Election?;0.0;http://www.frontpagemag.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_full/public/uploads/2016/11/james-comey.jpg?itok=qsfc7Mie;0;1;0;0;0;hate

column1: 3762;bbf5b2166039d4bbb9f2748919cb32b152847df0;0;EdJenner;2016-11-03T07:22:47.467+02:00;From Higher Ed to Political Indoctrination;"Go to Article
Parents who plan on refinancing their homes in order to send their children off to college should instead consider encouraging them to specialize in a trade.
Speaking as a Ph.D. in philosophy who has spent the last 17 years teaching at the college level
column2: I’m perhaps the last person from whom advice of this sort is expected. But it is precisely because of my familiarity with academia that I beseech the college bound and their enablers—I mean their supporters—to revisit their plans.

column1: Whether one regards a post-secondary institution as a means to either a remunerative profession or a genuine education
column2: the tragic fact of the matter is that the contemporary academic world is about as politicized a cultural institution as any. More specifically
column3: it is a bastion of Political Correctness
column4: a decidedly leftist ideology that tolerates no competition.

column1: For the last 11 years
column2: Professor Duke Pesta
column3: who is currently an associate professor of English at the University of Wisconsin Oshkosh
column4: has taught literature at a range of colleges. At the outset of each semester
column5: he would quiz his students on their knowledge of American and Western history. What he found is that the “overwhelming” number of them believed that slavery—an institution
column6: mind you
column7: that is as old as humanity itself
column8: was practiced in virtually every society the planet over
column9: and that lasted only some 87 years in the United States— was an exclusively American phenomenon .

column1: “Most of my students could not tell me anything meaningful about slavery outside of America
column2: ” Pesta told The College Fix. His students “are convinced that slavery was an American problem that more or less ended with the Civil War and they are very fuzzy about slavery prior to the Colonial era.”

column1: “Their entire education about slavery
column2: ” he adds
column3: “was confined to America.”

column1: Yet it isn’t just students who display an astonishing ignorance of slavery. Over at Boston University
column2: Saida Grundy
column3: an Assistant Professor of sociology and African-American Studies
column4: tweeted that slavery is “a white people…thing.”

column1: Grundy didn’t stop there. She asks: “is white people’s new deflection from dealing with slavery that ‘all races have had slaves’ thing? is this the new ‘#AllLivesMatter’?”
Professor Grundy added other enlightening tweets:
“for the record
column2: NO race outside of Europeans had a system that made slavery a *personhood* instead of temporary condition;

column1: “there is also no race except Europeans who kidnapped and transported human beings in order to enslave them and their offspring for life;
“before Europeans invented it as such
column2: slavery was not a condition that was de facto inherited from parent to child.”

column1: In case white folks couldn’t follow the thrust of her rant
column2: Grundy offers a summation of her sophisticated position:

column1: “in other words
column2: deal with your white sh*t
column3: white people. slavery is a *YALL* thing.”

column1: In addition to assigning blame for slavery solely to white Europeans
column2: Grundy claimed that “white masculinity” is “THE problem for america’s colleges.”

column1: Over at the University of Pittsburgh
column2: students who were distributing pro-Donald Trump materials were harassed and attacked . The Trump supporters were accused of backing a “racist” candidate who espouses “hate speech.” They were greeted by chants of “f**k the white male patriarchy” and
column3: eventually
column4: physical aggression.

column1: One of the victims said that “my campus shouldn’t be a place where my friends and I are fearful for having opposing opinions.”
These students were accosted by other students. Students elsewhere
column2: however
column3: have had professors with which to contend.

column1: At the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA)
column2: a political science professor
column3: Michael Chwe
column4: wrote in a blog post for Princeton University Press that “the danger to democracy itself” is posed by “Trump supporters[.]” This “danger” is “real and must be confronted.” Chwe maintains that Trump and his supporters are “the greatest danger to democracy since World War II
column5: even perhaps since the Civil War[.]”

column1: Chwe thinks that had “we” done “a better and earlier job with confronting
column2: as opposed to accommodating
column3: white and male privilege…we might not have reached this situation [the Trump phenomenon].” “We” must set our sights on “combatting” these forms of “privilege” now
column4: though
column5: if we hope to divert “democracy away from self-destruction.”

column1: And it isn’t just faculty in the humanities and liberal arts that can’t resist injecting their politics into the classroom. A math professor at Mount Holyoke College
column2: an all-female school
column3: was recently captured on video launching into an anti-Trump/pro-Clinton tirade in class. While he never referred to either candidate by name
column4: Peter Rosnick’s choice for president was plain. This election
column5: Rosnick said
column6: is the “scariest” that he’s ever witnessed. He told his students that they should “vote for someone who thinks women are full and capable and responsible and intelligent beings who should not be the object of
column7: um
column8: should not be objectified.”

column1: Rosnick also prescribed his students to vote “for whoever you want
column2: but vote for somebody who respects the fact that this is a country built on immigrants—that this is a country that couldn’t
column3: that wouldn’t be what it is if it wasn’t for bringing immigrants into our nation and respecting them and respecting what they bring to our country.”

column1: At least one of Rosnick’s students was less than enthused over his proselytizing efforts. Speaking on condition of anonymity
column2: this student told The College Fix that she found “it highly inappropriate for a math teacher to use my class time to try to tell me who to vote for.”

column1: Indeed.
But this
column2: unfortunately
column3: is hardly an anomaly in 2016. Thus
column4: parents should think hard before divesting themselves of tens and tens of thousands of dollars so that their children can become targets of political indoctrination. column1: If you're wondering why Team Hillary panicked and unleashed hell on the FBI

column3: but it's an interesting data point .

column1: The FBI had secretly recorded conversations of a suspect in a public-corruption case talking about alleged deals the Clintons made
column2: these people said. The agents listening to the recordings couldn’t tell from the conversations if what the suspect was describing was accurate
column3: but it was
column4: they thought
column5: worth checking out.

column1: Prosecutors thought the talk was hearsay and a weak basis to warrant aggressive tactics
column2: like presenting evidence to a grand jury
column3: because the person who was secretly recorded wasn’t inside the Clinton Foundation.

column1: FBI investigators grew increasingly frustrated with resistance from the corruption prosecutors
column2: and some executives at the bureau itself
column3: to keep pursuing the case.

column1: As prosecutors rebuffed their requests to proceed more overtly
column2: those Justice Department officials became more annoyed that the investigators didn’t seem to understand or care about the instructions issued by their own bosses and prosecutors to act discreetly.

column1: In short
column2: FBI people had material for a case that the government didn't want brought because Team Obama were Hillary backers and the senior leadership in the DOJ saw their careers linked to the rise of Hillary. And so a stand down order was handed down.

column1: Following the February meeting
column2: officials at Justice Department headquarters sent a message to all the offices involved to “stand down
column3: ’’ a person familiar with the matter said.

column1: This is what happens when the DOJ has been so thoroughly corrupted from the top down.
Meanwhile there's little doubt
column2: considering what we already know

column1: 3771;45757ff9dbffbccb7d06a6a04d46497920000cc2;0;Walter Williams;2016-11-03T11:03:00.000+02:00;The Rich and Us;"Who's really to blame for the corrupting influence of money in Washington
column2: DC? November 3
column3: 2016 Walter Williams

column1: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates
column2: having a net worth of $81.8 billion
column3: and Amazon.com CEO Jeff Bezos
column4: having a net worth of $70.4 billion
column5: are the nation's two richest men. They are at the top of the Forbes 400 list of America's superrich individuals
column6: people who have net worths of billions of dollars. Many see the rich as a danger. New York Times columnist Bob Herbert wrote
column7: ""It doesn't really matter what ordinary people want. The wealthy call the tune
column8: and the politicians dance."" His colleague Paul Krugman wrote
column9: ""On paper
column10: we're a one-person-one-vote nation; in reality
column11: we're more than a bit of an oligarchy
column12: in which a handful of wealthy people dominate."" It's sentiments like these that have led me to wish there were a humane way to get rid of the rich. For without having the rich around to be whipping boys and distract our attention
column13: we might be able to concentrate on what's best for the 99.9 percent of the rest of us.

column1: Let's look at the power of the rich. With all the money that Gates
column2: Bezos and other superrich people have
column3: what can they force you or me to do? Can they condemn our houses to create space so that another individual can build an auto dealership or a casino parking lot? Can they force us to pay money into the government-run — and doomed — Obamacare program? Can they force us to bus our children to schools out of our neighborhood in the name of diversity? Can they force us to buy our sugar from a high-cost domestic producer rather than from a low-cost Caribbean producer? The answer to all of these questions is a big fat no.

column1: You say
column2: ""Williams
column3: I don't understand."" Let me be more explicit. Bill Gates cannot order you to enroll your child in another school in order to promote racial diversity. He has no power to condemn your house to make way for a casino parking lot. Unless our elected public officials grant them the power to rip us off
column4: rich people have little power to force us to do anything. A lowly municipal clerk earning $50
column5: 000 a year has far more life-and-death power over us. It is that type of person to whom we must turn for permission to build a house
column6: ply a trade
column7: open a restaurant and do myriad other activities. It's government people
column8: not rich people
column9: who have the power to coerce us and rip us off. They have the power to make our lives miserable if we disobey. This coercive power goes a long way toward explaining legalized political corruption.

column1: Take just one of thousands of examples. The Fanjuls are among the biggest sugar cane growers
column2: and they co-own the world's largest refining company
column3: American Sugar Refining
column4: which markets its product under the brand names Domino
column5: C&H
column6: Redpath
column7: Tate & Lyle and Florida Crystals. During the 2014 election cycle
column8: Florida Crystals contributed more than $860
column9: 000 to candidates and political spending groups. It spent more than $1 million lobbying Congress
column10: the U.S. departments of Agriculture and Commerce
column11: and the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative. Here's my question to you: Do you think it forked over all that money to help our elected representatives uphold and defend the U.S. Constitution? Nonsense. The Fanjuls and other sugar producers want Congress to use tariffs to keep foreign-produced sugar out of our country so they can reap the financial benefits from being able to charge Americans two to three times the world price of sugar.

column1: So here's the ultimate question: If some rich people can line the pockets of politicians to do their bidding at the expense of the rest of us
column2: who's to blame? I think it's we
column3: the people
column4: who are to blame for not using our votes to run such politicians out of town — and that's most of them. But that might be deceitful of us
column5: for we also ask politicians to enable us to live at the expense of others.";english;2016-11-03T19:37:12.037+02:00;frontpagemag.com;US;34811.0;The Rich and Us;0.0;http://www.frontpagemag.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_full/public/uploads/2016/11/uscapitolindaylight.jpg?itok=mfMihp9t;0;1;0;0;0;hate

column1: 3777;ef1be063e8754ac155f3950f554510d757063d6a;0;Lloyd Billingsley;2016-11-04T11:05:00.000+02:00;POTUS FLOTUS Pocus;"The president and Hillary Clinton share a “stubborn desire” to avoid scrutiny. November 4
column2: 2016 Lloyd Billingsley

column1: The President of the United States
column2: the most powerful man in the world
column3: is working three shifts for his designated successor
column4: former First Lady and Secretary of State Hillary Clinton. As the FBI continues its investigations and Clinton emails continue to emerge
column5: it is worth recalling the mysteries in the president’s narrative.

column1: Last year
column2: “Obama’s narrator
column3: ” as the New York Times called David Axelrod
column4: released his massive Believer : My Forty Years in Politics . The author recalls a “perfectly timed” and unexpected call that would change his life.

column1: “David
column2: it’s Barack
column3: ” said the voice on the phone. “I’m thinking about what I want to do next
column4: and was wondering if we could talk.” This call took place in 1992
column5: which explains the perfect timing.

column1: On February 8
column3: the president’s maternal grandfather Stanley Dunham passed away at 73. So “Gramps
column4: ” as the narrator called him
column5: was no longer around to offer insights on family history
column6: correct any accounts that might appear
column7: or write one of his own.

column1: In the 1995 Dreams from My Father
column2: Gramps “might” say that a Kenyan foreign student looks a lot like Nat King Cole. Actually
column3: Gramps might not. The Kenyan student Barack H. Obama bears little resemblance to Cole
column4: who passed away in 1965 but enjoyed a revival in the 1990s through daughter Natalie’s “Unforgettable” album.

column1: The narrator of Dreams from My Father invokes “a stubborn desire to protect myself from scrutiny” and he “doesn’t fault people their suspicions” if they fail to take him at “face value.” His elusive father is a “prop in someone else’s narrative” and “an image I could alter on a whim or ignore when convenient.” The narrative itself is a “myth
column2: ” a “tale
column3: ” and a “useful fiction.”

column1: Dreams from My Father has no photo section
column2: no index
column3: and key characters get only a first name. These include “Frank
column4: ” who gets 2
column5: 500 words. Back in 1995
column6: the president himself identified this person as Frank Marshall Davis
column7: the Stalinist Paul Kengor regards as the president’s mentor
column8: as he explained in The Communist: The Untold Story of Frank Marshall Davis .

column1: In Dreams from My Real Father
column2: documentarian Joel Gilbert made a case that Davis is the president’s biological father. Malik Obama
column3: son of the Kenyan Barack H. Obama
column4: sees a strong physical resemblance . That also holds true on the policy side. Professor Kengor found “remarkable similarities” between the writings of Davis and the policies of president Barack Obama.

column1: The Kenyan Barack Obama
column2: though a man of the left
column3: was not a pro-Soviet Communist. Had he been pro-Soviet
column4: he would have attended Patrice Lumumba University in Moscow. Indeed
column5: Obama warned his fellow Kenyans about Soviet meddling in Africa.

column1: The Kenyan Obama would have found strange the president’s 2009 cancelation of missile defense for European allies. An outspoken man
column2: he would not have supported the kind of high-tech harassment Sharyl Attkisson described in Stonewalled: My Fight for Truth Against the Forces of Obstruction
column3: Intimidation and Harassment in Obama’s Washington .

column1: The Kenyan Barack H. Obama had issues with strongman types such as Jomo Kenyatta
column2: who ruled Kenya from 1963 until his death in 1978. In keeping with his country
column3: and most of Africa
column4: the Kenyan Barack Obama is not on record as a supporter of homosexual causes. Frank Marshall Davis
column5: on the other hand
column6: was certainly on board. As Davis wrote in his 1992 memoir Livin’ the Blues :

column1: “During the dramatic civil rights demonstrations of the 1960s
column2: I often thought we ought to form a united front with joint sit-ins at cafes. In my mind I envisioned the result. An indignant white restaurant manager frantically phoning the police
column3: ‘Get here in a hurry! We got niggers at our counters and our washrooms are loaded with fairies and lesbians!’ Or perhaps there might have been a joint March on Washington waving banners: Blacks and Homos
column4: Arise!”

column1: That
column2: and Davis’ pornographic novel
column3: Sex Rebel: Black
column4: might explain the president’s stubborn desire to protect himself from scrutiny. It could also have something do with what the narrator calls the “less flattering aspects of my father’s character.”

column1: In Dreams from My Father
column2: the Kenyan is raised a Muslim but in The Audacity of Hope he is “a confirmed atheist
column3: thinking religion to be so much superstition
column4: like the mumbo-jumbo of witch doctors that he had witnessed in the Kenyan villages of his youth.”

column1: In Audacity
column2: the narrator explains that he went to a “predominantly Muslim school” in Indonesia. He does not indicate whether atheists
column3: Lutherans
column4: Jews
column5: or Buddhists also attended the school. Registration records were supposedly destroyed by flooding.

column1: The predominantly Muslim school also emerges in Believer
column2: but Axelrod does not indicate if students of other faiths attended. Frank
column3: Ann Dunham
column4: Stanley Dunham
column5: and even the Kenyan Barack Obama are missing from this account
column6: but it proves enlightening in other ways.

column1: In a 2008
column2: Brian Williams of MSNBC asked presidential candidates what steps they would take in the event of a simultaneous terror attack on major American cities. As Axelrod explains
column3: “Obama neglected to include that he would pursue the perpetrators.”

column1: Hillary Clinton did likewise in 2012
column2: passing off what she privately regarded as a terrorist attack on the U.S. compound in Benghazi as a spontaneous protest over a video. Like the president
column3: Clinton has always shown a stubborn desire to protect herself from scrutiny. With BleachBit
column4: hammers and lies
column5: Hillary and her handlers did their best to make more than 30
column6: 000 emails disappear.

column1: The contents remain something of a mystery
column2: just as mysteries linger about the president and his background. On the other hand
column3: by now some things are perfectly clear.

column1: The POTUS and former FLOTUS both decline to identify Islamic terrorism. Both are shrink-wrapped in statist superstition. And both lie with the greatest of ease. On these counts
column2: like the critters in Orwell’s Animal Farm
column3: one can find it “impossible to say which was which.”

column1: Back in July
column2: the party faithful were chanting “Four more years!” during the president’s speech at the Democratic National Convention.";english;2016-11-04T12:29:09.876+02:00;frontpagemag.com;US;34811.0;POTUS FLOTUS Pocus;0.0;http://www.frontpagemag.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_full/public/uploads/2016/11/oc.jpg?itok=bdEqmsW_;0;1;0;0;0;hate

column1: 3779;0e30bd84bee2bc94337eb028c45f0870e6ea74da;0;Michael Cutler;2016-11-04T11:03:00.000+02:00;Clinton's Web Of Deception;"The unraveling of Hillary's corrupt sphere of influence. November 4

column5: Tom Clancy could not have scripted this year's presidential election and intrigues.

column1: While Comey's recent remarks regarding the Clinton investigation have been extremely vague
column2: the issue to focus on is how Hillary's use of a private computer server
column3: private e-mail account and non-secure digital devices to store
column4: send and receive classified materials may have drawn others into her tangled web of deception.

column1: The current focus of the Clinton quagmire is on whether or not the laptop computer shared by Weiner and his estranged wife contains sensitive information. If that laptop had been hacked both Weiner and Abedin could have been vulnerable to blackmail. This was an issue raised by Congressman Louie Gohmert
column2: Texan Republican and former judge in a Fox News Business interview on October 31
column3: 2016 in a segment that was posted under the title
column4: “ Rep. Gohmert: Clinton is a potential victim of blackmail .”

column1: Additional individuals may also have been drawn into this web of deception through these e-mails as well. A chain is as strong as its weakest link. The weak links begin with Hillary Clinton and Huma Abedin and may now include Anthony Weiner and perhaps others. Meanwhile
column2: there is no way to yet determine how many other weak links are “out there” petrified that WikiLeaks or perhaps
column3: a hacker may yet disclose their improper dealings with the Clintons or their foundation.

column1: Could not these additional individuals be subject to blackmail as well?
Let's take a moment to understand how all of this began.
Just months earlier Hillary Clinton had been let off the hook by an FBI Director who
column2: in his official statement on July 5
column4: included this excerpt: To be clear
column5: this is not to suggest that in similar circumstances
column6: a person who engaged in this activity would face no consequences. To the contrary
column7: those individuals are often subject to security or administrative sanctions. But that is not what we are deciding now.

column1: By Comey's own words
column2: anyone else might have had their security clearance lifted permanently. This raises the issue about such an individual demonstrating fitness for duty as president and raises the question as to why Comey did not see fit to take comparable action with Ms Clinton.

column1: Comey's ultimate decision to not present the case to a Grand Jury was frustrating to those who have had security clearances and fully understand just how profound an impact these transgressions might have on national security.
However
column2: perhaps Comey's hard to comprehend decision can be traced to a meeting between Bill Clinton and Attorney General Loretta Lynch less than one week before the FBI Director conducted that press conference. On June 29
column3: 2015 ABC News-15 reported
column4: “ US Attorney General Loretta Lynch
column5: Bill Clinton meet privately in Phoenix before Benghazi report .”

column1: That article served as a predication for my article
column2: “ Loretta Lynch's Private Meeting With Bill Clinton Prior to Release of Benghazi Report : Why would the Attorney General
column3: who sets the tone for law enforcement
column4: do this?”

column1: As Attorney General
column2: Lynch is FBI Director Comey's boss.

column1: At the time of this meeting the Justice Department was not only investigating Hillary's illegal use of a private e-mail server
column2: non-secure personal digital devices but was also
column3: conducting an investigation into the Clinton Foundation.

column1: In fact
column2: on October 30
column3: 2016 Breitbart reported
column4: “ Clinton Foundation FBI Investigation Confirmed By Former Assistant FBI Director .” Therefore Bill Clinton
column5: was likely the target of an ongoing criminal investigation yet he had a totally inappropriate private meeting with the Attorney General to supposedly discuss golfing and grandchildren.

column1: However
column2: just days after that meeting
column3: news organizations reported that Hillary was contemplating keeping Lynch on as Attorney General if she won the election.

column1: On July 4
column2: 2016 Newsmax reported
column3: “ NY Times: Clinton Weighs Keeping Lynch as Attorney General if She Wins .” Hillary's statement that she might keep Lynch on as Attorney General could have provided the incentive for Lynch to “Go along to get along.”

column1: Indeed
column2: Lynch did precisely that during her confirmation hearing as I described in my commentary
column3: “ Loretta Lynch: Same as the Old Boss : The Attorney General nominee's disturbing views on U.S. immigration law.”

column1: My article included an excerpt from a Yahoo/AP news report
column2: ""Attorney General nominee defends Obama immigration changes."" Here is the exchange in which Lynch discussed the administration's immigration's policies: Lynch said she had no involvement in drafting the measures but called them ""a reasonable way to marshal limited resources to deal with the problem"" of illegal immigration. She said the Homeland Security Department was focusing on removals of ""the most dangerous of the undocumented immigrants among us."" Pressed by Sen. Jeff Sessions of Alabama
column3: a leading immigration hard-liner
column4: she said citizenship was not a right for people in the country illegally but rather a privilege that must be earned. However
column5: when Sessions asked whether individuals in the country legally or those who are here unlawfully have more of a right to a job
column6: Lynch replied
column7: ""The right and the obligation to work is one that's shared by everyone in this country regardless of how they came here."" Sessions quickly issued a news release to highlight that response. Under later questioning by Democratic Sen. Chuck Schumer of New York
column8: Lynch clarified it
column9: stating there is no right to work for an immigrant who has no lawful status.

column1: This was disturbing and telling
column2: clearly Ms Lynch's views on immigration and likely
column3: therefore on other issues are malleable and subject to revision if modifying her position is consistent with her personal goals.

column1: As Attorney General Lynch directs the operations of the entire Justice Department and all those who work for that department. Ms. Lynch must understand true democracy can only exist when justice is blind and totally objective.
However
column2: Lynch and the others who have fallen under Hillary Clinton's corrupt sphere of influence are trapped in Hillary's web of deception

column1: 4905;84d951b5f7d2d82ba485abe6d2caf4572d96307b;0;Fiona Miller;2016-10-26T21:37:32.363+03:00;Getting 10 Minutes of Sunlight Per Day Can Stop Depression;"Getting 10 Minutes of Sunlight Per Day Can Stop Depression Vitamin D is one of the most important vitamins your body needs Image Credits: Michael Pollak/Flickr .
Vitamin D is one of the most important vitamins you can give your body.
This vitamin can affect nearly 2
column2: 000 genes in your body
column3: and the best part of it is that you don’t even need a supplement to get your full recommended amount of vitamin D – you only need to get out in the sun for a few minutes a day.

column1: Vitamin D is beneficial for staving off depression. Without the required amount of vitamin D in your diet (or the necessary amount of time spent in the sun)
column2: you can experience and excessively low mood and other signs of depression.

column1: And one of the most well-known and important benefits of vitamin D is the effect it has an calcium absorption and building healthy bones.
This is especially important for children
column2: as the vitamin helps with bone growth as well as developing strong teeth. Those who do not have enough vitamin D may find themselves at risk for fractures or soft bones.

column1: Thus
column2: vitamin D is not only important for children
column3: but also women who can be susceptible to brittle bones as they age.

column1: The vitamin may also play a crucial role in helping your body ward off disease. Studies suggest that getting in enough vitamin D can help ward off multiple sclerosis
column2: heart disease and help your body steer clear of the dreaded flu.

column1: If you don’t get enough vitamin D
column2: you may find yourself feeling tired or experiencing general aches and pains. If the deficiency is severe enough
column3: you may also find yourself developing stress fractures.

column1: So how do you get enough vitamin D in your diet?
You can always purchase supplements
column2: most of which contain enough
column3: or in some cases
column4: more than enough of your daily recommended allowance.

column1: It is also naturally found in salmon
column2: sardines
column3: egg yolk and shrimp. Milk
column4: cereal
column5: yogurt and orange juice are often fortified with vitamin D to ensure that you get the recommended amount.

column1: For those who live in a sunny climate
column2: spending 10 minutes outside per day can actually give you the required amount of vitamin D. Although it is not advisable to spend too long outside without protection from the sun in the form of sun block or extra layers of clothing
column3: it is recommended that you do get outside for at least a small part of the day to soak up those rays.

column1: You can
column2: however
column3: get all of the benefits of vitamin D in your diet or by taking supplements during the winter months when the sun takes a rest
column4: or if you happen to live in a colder climate. NEWSLETTER SIGN UP Get the latest breaking news & specials from Alex Jones and the Infowars Crew. column1: 4926;e624d5bd3ac519d7989862462f174a59fb15e963;0;Paul Joseph Watson;2016-10-27T16:07:37.440+03:00;Clinton Campaign Circulated Paul Ryan Relative as Possible Supreme Court Pick;"Clinton Campaign Circulated Paul Ryan Relative as Possible Supreme Court Pick Another reason as to why Ryan tried to sabotage Trump's campaign? Paul Joseph Watson - October 27
column2: 2016 Comments Hillary Clinton’s campaign circulated the name of one of Paul Ryan’s relatives as a potential Supreme Court pick
column3: suggesting a conflict of interest that could feed in to the Republican Speaker of the House’s dislike for Donald Trump. An email released in part 19 of the Wikileaks Podesta dump features an article sent by Hillary advisor Sara Solow to Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta and Hillary’s foreign policy advisor Jake Sullivan on February 29
column4: 2016. The piece draws attention to Ketanji Brown Jackson
column5: a judge on the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia. “She was confirmed by without any Republican opposition in the Senate not once
column6: but *twice*. She was confirmed to her current position in 2013 by unanimous consent – that is
column7: without any stated opposition. She was also previously confirmed unanimously to a seat on the U.S. Sentencing Commission (where she became vice chair)
column8: ” reads the email. “Her family is impressive. She is married to a surgeon and has two young daughters. Her father is a retired lawyer and her mother a retired school principal. Her brother was a police officer (in the unit that was the basis for the television show *The Wire*) and is now a law student
column9: and she is related by marriage to Congressman (and Speaker of the House) Paul Ryan.” Earlier this month
column10: Ryan said that he would no longer defend or campaign for Donald Trump. A poll released this week found that nearly two thirds of Republicans trust Donald Trump more than Ryan to lead the GOP. Many Trump supporters speculated that Ryan was involved in the leaking of the infamous Billy Bush tape
column11: in which Trump made lewd comments about women
column12: as part of a plot to sabotage the Republican nominee’s campaign. Could the fact that one of his relatives is being touted as a likely Clinton Supreme Court pick be another reason as to why Ryan – who has been accused by many of being in bed with the Washington establishment – has abandoned his support for Donald Trump?

column2: 2016 Comments A new email released as part of the Wikileaks Podesta dump features Clinton ally Brent Budowsky accusing Hillary operative David Brock of having a plan that relied upon black voters being “stupid”. The email
column3: sent to Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta and another Clinton ally CEO Roy Spence
column4: centers around a discussion of a Bernie Sanders campaign ad which featured “many black faces”. Back in January
column5: Clinton operative David Brock caused consternation within the campaign when he publicly claimed that Bernie Sanders didn’t care about black people. Budowsky is not impressed with Brock’s outburst
column6: writing in the email
column7: “Brock makes the cardinal mistake of those who bring politics into disrepute with voters. He tells a lie that people will know is a lie
column8: and insults the intelligence of black voters with a kind of elitist racism that Bill and Hillary Clinton should not be seen with.” “I guess Brock’s plan is that black voters are stupid and will not watch the ad and believe his lie
column9: ” writes Budowsky. “I cannot think of anything more desperate
column10: more stupid and more self-destructive than David Brock lying about the Bernie ad and playing a seamy brand of the politics of race using the tactic of deceit on her behalf
column11: ” adds the The Hill and Huffington Post columnist
column12: before offering to write a campaign ad for HIllary to counter the Bernie Sanders ad. The email once again underscores the Clinton camp’s paranoia about not being able to authentically connect with African-American voters in a way that Bernie Sanders could. Some black voters have been reluctant to support Clinton as a result of her support for a 1994 crime bill that resulted in the mass incarceration of young black Americans
column13: whom Hilary referred to at the time as “super predators”.

column1: Infowars has exclusively learned that the email account of Colorado Democratic Senator Andy Kerr has been hacked.
The emails
column2: shown to Infowars by the website DCLeaks
column3: include hundreds of discussions from March 2015 to July 2016 – with one email concerning 2015 marijuana legislation oddly claiming to be from December of 2000.

column1: Taken from Kerr’s Gmail account
column2: the emails
column3: which are currently password protected
column4: mostly surround requests and comments by Kerr’s constituents on a wide range of political topics.

column1: Speaking with Infowars
column2: David Pourshoushtari
column3: communications director for the Colorado State Senate Democrats
column4: said Kerr was unaware of the hack but that the senator declined to provide an official statement until the situation could be assessed.

column1: While the exact reasoning behind the hack is currently unknown
column2: Kerr may have been targeted as part of the same hacking campaign that compromised the emails of other political figures including Clinton campaign Chairman John Podesta.

column1: It is also unclear whether Kerr
column2: like Podesta
column3: fell victim to a phishing attack that would have resulted in the senator putting his email password into a fake Google login page.

column1: Earlier this month the former Chief of Protocol of the United States
column2: Capricia Marshall
column3: who was one of Clinton’s insiders at the State Department
column4: similarly had her emails appear on DCLeaks.

column1: The website also made headlines in August after publishing hundreds of documents connected to billionaire donor George Soros.
According to the U.S. government and many in the cybersecurity community
column2: Russian state hackers are responsible for the recent spate of election season hacks. DCLeaks has similarly been accused of being a publishing front for the Russian government. column2: 2016 Comments

column1: Youtube has decided to reverse its ban on a channel registered by a man who claims to be Bill Clinton’s long-lost son.
“Your YouTube account was suspended due to repeated or severe violations of our Terms and our Community Guidelines
column2: and as such cannot be restored
column3: ” the company wrote earlier this week to Danney Williams after he filed an appeal to restore his channel.

column1: For decades
column2: Williams has been on a mission to reunite with the person he believes to be his biological father
column3: the 42nd President of the United States
column4: William Jefferson Clinton.

column1: The most popular video on the channel
column2: a nine-minute mini-documentary posted two weeks ago produced by filmmaker Joel Gilbert
column3: features the 30-year-old Williams recounting memories from his childhood which prompted the search for his father.

column1: Arguing the channel had “absolutely zero violations of any kind
column2: ” Gilbert places blame for the suspension squarely at Google and the Clinton campaign’s feet.

column1: “It’s obvious to me that the fix is in!” Gilbert wrote in a statement. “The only possible explanation is that the Clinton campaign requested YouTube/Google to silence Danny
column2: ‘to run him off the plantation’ as Danny said Hillary Clinton did to him and his aunt when he was a small child and they were chased off the grounds of the Arkansas Governor’s mansion in 1990.”

column1: Youtube later restored Williams’ channel early Thursday morning claiming a review confirmed it was not in violation of its Terms of Service.
Last week
column2: Danney went to Las Vegas – the site of the third US presidential debate – where he held a press conference alongside his lawyers announcing his intention to seek a DNA sample from Bill Clinton in order to settle the paternity dispute.

column1: Danney and his lawyers claim a previous DNA test carried out by the tabloid Star Magazine failed to obtain a blood sample from Clinton
column2: an assertion confirmed by one of Star’s former editors to World Net Daily .

column1: “I don’t remember ever seeing any laboratory test that was done on Clinton’s DNA
column2: ” former Star Magazine editor Phil Bunton stated to WND.

column1: The UK economy grew by 0.5% in the three months after the Brexit vote
column2: the Office for National Statistics (ONS) has said.

column1: The figure for July to September was down from the 0.7% growth recorded in the second quarter of 2016 – the months before Britain voted to leave the European Union.
But it is more robust than many economists had expected – and stronger than the 0.2% forecast last month by the Bank of England (BoE).

The higher-than-expected GDP figure was driven by the services sector – which accounts for more than 78% of the UK economy – which grew by 0.2% in the three months to September.";english;2016-10-28T01:12:00.532+03:00;infowars.com;US;2774.0;UK Economy Grows 0.5% in Three Months after Brexit Vote;0.0;http://hw.infowars.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/brexit-1.jpg;0;1;38;0;38;conspiracy

The world that we live in is nothing like the world that our parents lived in. Back in the pre-globalization era
column2: of roughly 1940-1990

column1: Back in this “golden era

column3: such as the Roth 401k or a conventional pension
column4: employers could expect to be getting a reliable deposit bi-monthly in order to help them sustain their standard of living all throughout their retirement years.

column1: It also used to be that a college degree was something to aspire to; something that guaranteed you a well-paying job
column2: that would allow you to support a family of four with just a single college graduate’s income. This is obviously no longer the case.

column1: Now

column2: at 46 percent
column3: leads Trump at 45 percent by just one point Breitbart - October 28
column4: 2016 Comments

column1: NEW YORK CITY
column2: New York — Donald J. Trump
column3: the Republican nominee for president
column4: has closed the gap with his Democratic opponent Hillary Rodham Clinton with just a couple weeks left in the election
column5: the latest national Breitbart News Network/Gravis Marketing poll shows.

column1: Clinton
column2: at 46 percent
column3: leads Trump at 45 percent by just one point—inside the survey’s 2.3 percent margin of error. Libertarian Gary Johnson gets just 3 percent and the Green Party’s Dr. Jill Stein just 1 percent
column4: while 4 percent are unsure. The survey was conducted from Oct. 25 to Oct. 26
column5: sampling 1
column6: 824 registered voters across the United States. The poll was conducted using a combination of interactive voice response polling and an internet panel of cell phone users.

column1: “Something has happened since the third debate
column2: ” Doug Kaplan
column3: the managing partner of Gravis Marketing
column4: said of the poll. “Conventional wisdom was after Trump said he wouldn’t promise to accept the results of the election and made the ‘nasty woman’ comment
column5: many thought Hillary would gain—but Trump seems to be closing the gap. In every election in the last 30 years
column6: this happens where the person behind closes the gap. Hillary still has a clear electoral advantage and many paths to victory. However
column7: Trump is not out of it but Hillary is still the favorite.”

column1: “This is a big story because it shows Trump really closing
column2: importantly
column3: as the other close polls are showing
column4: ” Democratic pollster Pat Caddell
column5: who worked for President Jimmy Carter and is working with Breitbart News and Gravis Marketing on these polls
column6: added. “He is closing with his favorability and unfavorability as well.

column1: Caddell said he thinks Obamacare’s failures
column2: where premiums are skyrocketing
column3: is one of many reasons why Trump is surging. “Among other things

column1: Hillary Clinton and the Democrats have begun stealing the election using every underhanded tactic because it’s the only way she can win

column1: “She’s going to lose and she knows it

column1: Nichols explained that the establishment is already doing what it can to prevent an open and transparent election.
“The DNC filed a lawsuit to try to force the removal of poll watchers at the polls
column2: ” he said. “Why would they do that if they know there’s no cheating going on? Why would they fight the voter ID if they don’t plan to have massive voter fraud?”

column1: The mainstream media and the Clinton campaign are also doing everything they can up until Election Day to make everybody believe that the election is already over in Hillary’s favor
column2: Nichols said.

column1: “Folks
column2: do not believe it
column3: ” he said. “The polling is a part of this game plan to destroy your confidence in your ability to win.”

column1: “I believe Donald Trump is winning
column2: ” Nichols added. “You’re winning. You’ve just got to stay the course.”

column1: Nichols warned that voters must take extra steps to ensure their vote isn’t being altered.
“You’ve got to make people at the precinct prove that your vote was recorded properly
column2: ” he said. “If they can’t show you proof
column3: then demand a paper ballot.”

column1: 4990;da27ca2a6f58c2f439bbcd60302cf1e22d296cb7;0;Adan Salazar;2016-10-28T22:17:05.766+03:00;Breaking: FBI Reopens Investigation into Clinton Emails;"Breaking: FBI Reopens Investigation into Clinton Emails FBI looking into ""new developments"" after previously recommending no charges against Democrat candidate Image Credits: Gage Skidmore / Flickr .
The FBI on Friday announced it is reopening their investigation into Hillary Clinton’s private email server
column2: another shocking October surprise for the Democrat candidate days from the presidential election.

column1: In a letter to committees and lawmakers relevant to the matter
column2: FBI Director James Comey cited “recent developments” for the bureau’s decision to look into new emails which may contain classified information and how they may relate to its previous investigation.

column1: “In previous congressional testimony
column2: I referred to the fact that the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) had completed its investigation of former Secretary Clinton’s personal email server. Due to recent developments
column3: I am writing to supplement my previous testimony
column4: ” Comey wrote in the letter obtained by CNBC .

column1: “In connection with an unrelated case
column2: the FBI has learned of the existence of emails that appear to be pertinent to the investigation. I am writing to inform you that the investigative team briefed me on this yesterday
column3: and I agreed that the FBI should take appropriate investigative steps designed to allow investigators to review these emails to determine whether they contain classified information
column4: as well as to assess their importance to our investigation.”

column1: “Although the FBI cannot yet assess whether or not this material may be signifcant
column2: and I cannot predict how long it will take us to complete this additional work
column3: I believe it is important to update your Committees about our efforts in light of my previous testimony
column4: ” Comey stated.

column1: Republican Congressman Jason Chaffetz
column2: who led an Oversight Committee effort to pursue perjury charges against Hillary
column3: tweeted about the FBI’s announcement. FBI Dir just informed me
column4: ""The FBI has learned of the existence of emails that appear to be pertinent to the investigation."" Case reopened

column1: — Jason Chaffetz (@jasoninthehouse) October 28
Back in July
column2: Comey announced the FBI’s investigation into Clinton’s use of a private email server during her tenure as secretary of state would not result in a recommendation to the Justice Department to pursue charges.

column1: “Although the Department of Justice makes final decisions on matters like this
column2: we are expressing to Justice our view that no charges are appropriate in this case
column3: ” the FBI director stated in a speech at the time. Trump: I have great respect that the FBI and Department of Justice have the courage to right their horrible mistake pic.twitter.com/LeDNgWvqa2

column1: — Washington Examiner (@dcexaminer) October 28
Speaking at a campaign rally in Manchester
column2: New Hampshire
column3: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump jumped on the bureau’s decision to reopen its case:

column1: “The FBI has just sent a letter to Congress informing them that they have discovered new emails pertaining to the former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton’s investigation. And they are reopening their case into her criminal and illegal conduct that threatens the security of the United States of America.”
“Hillary Clinton’s corruption is on a scale we have never seen before. We must not let her take her criminal scheme into the Oval Office.”

“I have great respect for the fact that the FBI and the Dept. of Justice are now willing to have the courage to right the horrible mistake that they made. This was a grave miscarriage of justice that the American people fully understood and it is everybody’s hope that it is about to be corrected.”
CNBC reports
column2: “Stocks turned negative after the report of the new probe
column3: ” adding that “Many analysts have said that markets were pricing in a Clinton victory in November.”  ";english;2016-10-28T22:17:05.766+03:00;infowars.com;US;2774.0;Breaking: FBI Reopens Investigation into Clinton Emails;0.0;http://hw.infowars.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Hillary-Clinton-Red.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;conspiracy

column1: Alex Jones breaks down the FBI’s Friday announcement on the reopening of the investigation into Hillary Clinton’s private email server as new evidence surfaces.
The new data was reportedly uncovered during a separate investigation into Anthony Weiner – the husband of Clinton ally Huma Abedin.
FBI Director James Comey cited “recent developments” for the bureau’s decision in a letter to committees and lawmakers today.
“In previous congressional testimony
column2: I referred to the fact that the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) had completed its investigation of former Secretary Clinton’s personal email server. Due to recent developments
column3: I am writing to supplement my previous testimony
column4: ” Comey wrote.

column1: “In connection with an unrelated case
column2: the FBI has learned of the existence of emails that appear to be pertinent to the investigation. I am writing to inform you that the investigative team briefed me on this yesterday
column3: and I agreed that the FBI should take appropriate investigative steps designed to allow investigators to review these emails to determine whether they contain classified information
column4: as well as to assess their importance to our investigation.”

column3: heart attack and asthma;"Babies of obese mothers at high risk of brain damage
column4: stroke
column5: heart attack and asthma

column1: Daniel Barker Tags: parental obesity
column2: children
column3: health risks (NaturalNews) The growing number of babies born to obese mothers throughout the world face a higher risk of developing serious health problems in adulthood
column4: according to several recent studies. Children of obese mothers are prone to brain damage
column5: heart disease
column6: stroke and asthma in adulthood
column7: warn health experts.Obese parents pass on the tendency towards obesity to their children
column8: creating a ""vicious cycle"" that warrants urgent action on the part of health officials
column9: said the researchers of the new studies.The list of health risks is surprisingly long
column10: including diseases like cancer
column11: and conditions such as ADHD and autism .From The Guardian :""Four studies published in the Lancet Diabetes and Endocrinology make clear that the risks of maternal obesity include stillbirth
column12: dangerously high blood pressure in pregnant women
column13: diabetes in the mother or child
column14: and complications during childbirth.""The scale of obesity in women of childbearing age and the consequent dangers to health were so great that urgent action was needed to ensure women were a normal weight before they conceived
column15: the authors say.""Mothers being very heavily overweight could lead to their children having autism or attention deficit hyperactivity disorder or developing cancer in later life
column16: the researchers say.""Between 2011 and 2012 in the United States
column17: nearly a third of women at peak childbearing age (20 to 39) were obese
column18: and 60 percent of American mothers were either overweight or obese at the time they conceived.In Britain
column19: where obesity rates among women are the highest in Europe
column20: 20 percent of mothers were already obese when they became pregnant. In 2013
column21: 26 percent of women in England between the ages of 35 and 44 were obese
column22: as were 18 percent of 24- to 35-year-olds. Global obesity has reached 'pandemic proportions' ""Obesity has reached pandemic proportions globally and its origins start in the womb
column24: the president of the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists.Regan pointed to the fact that more than 25 percent of men and women in the UK are obese
column25: and that the one in five pregnant women who are obese face an increased risk of ""miscarriage
column26: stillbirth and neonatal death as well as gestational diabetes
column29: more complicated labours and severe bleeding after the birth.""The researchers involved in the studies are concerned that the global obesity problem will only worsen
column30: particularly in the developing world. It is estimated that more than 20 percent of women throughout the world will be dangerously overweight by 2025.One research paper warned of long-term ""profound public health implications
column31: while another called for governments to begin treating obesity as a global public health priority.There is increasing evidence indicating that obesity during pregnancy can lead to a child being predisposed not only to developing diseases like type 2 diabetes and asthma
column32: but also neurodevelopmental disorders like cerebral palsy.The complex interaction of ""neuroendocrine
column34: immune and inflammatory"" factors in obese women are believed to affect hormonal exposure and nutrient supply to fetuses
column35: leading to possible brain damage in unborn children. Searching for solutions in a world dominated by fast food and sedentary lifestyles The experts all agree that something should be done
column36: but there are no simple solutions. Increased education and guidance may be part of the answer
column37: but a number of aspects of modern day-to-day life are increasing the tendency towards becoming obese.Among these are an ""increasingly commercialised food supply"" (i.e. junk food)
column38: reliance on cars and public transport
column40: and the tendency to sit in front of TV and computer screens for unhealthy periods of time.Ultimately
column41: it is the responsibility of parents to lose weight before giving birth to children and to set a healthy example for children as they grow and develop. But in a world of fast food and smartphones
column42: this may not prove to be so easily accomplished. Sources:";english;2016-10-27T09:09:34.041+03:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Babies of obese mothers at high risk of brain damage

column1: 6431;28ce73fcef414bcb25f4ad62960838810703b9f0;0;Isabelle Z.;2016-10-27T11:36:36.145+03:00;STD infection rates reach all-time high in the United States;"STD infection rates reach all-time high in the United States
Thursday
column2: October 27
column3: 2016 by: Isabelle Z. Tags: STDs
column4: infection rates
column5: disease pandemics (NaturalNews) The news keeps getting worse for a nation that is already known for embracing unhealthy habits
column6: as the CDC reveals that the U.S. saw more reported cases of sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) last year than in any year in the country's history.According to the CDC's annual report
column7: the nation's three most common STDs – gonorrhea
column8: chlamydia and syphilis – rose between 2014 and 2015 to reach an all-time high.The number of primary and secondary syphilis cases that were reported increased by an alarming 19 percent
column9: while gonorrhea rose by 12.8 percent and cases of chlamydia climbed by 5.9 percent. While all three of these diseases can be cured by antibiotics
column10: the CDC says that most of these infections end up going undiagnosed and therefore untreated.More than 1.5 million new cases of chlamydia were reported last year
column11: and two thirds of these were young people aged between 15 and 24. This disease can harm a woman's reproductive system
column12: and if left untreated
column13: can adversely affect her fertility.Meanwhile
column15: 216 new cases of gonorrhea were reported last year. This number might be lower than that of chlamydia
column16: but this STD is particularly concerning
column17: as it's becoming increasingly difficult to treat. This summer
column18: CDC scientists warned that the bacteria responsible for gonorrhea is developing resistance to the antibiotics that are normally used to treat it.Syphilis cases
column19: which noted the biggest rise of the three main STDs
column20: numbered 23
column22: with men who have sex with other men making up the majority of the new cases. Syphilis can have devastating effects
column24: stroke and stillbirth. There has also been a surge in newborns being born with syphilis after being infected by their mothers. Concerning lack of testing The director of the CDC's Division of STD Prevention
column26: expressed concern that Americans are simply not getting the preventive services that they need. She believes that every pregnant woman needs to be routinely tested for syphilis
column27: and bisexual and gay men who are sexually active should also get annual tests.Dr. Jonathan Mermin
column28: director of the CDC's National Center for HIV/AIDS
column31: pointed out that half of all STDs are occurring in young people under the age of 25. Part of the problem among young people could be the mistaken belief that the better HIV treatment that is now available means condoms aren't necessary.While so-called ""hook-up apps"" have been shouldering a lot of blame for facilitating casual sex
column32: experts believe that the surge in STDs is largely down to budget cuts to STD prevention and care programs at the local and state levels. More than half of such programs have been subjected to budget cuts in recent years
column33: with a number of health departments closing STD clinics altogether.Dr. Bolan pointed out that more than 40 percent of health departments have reduced their clinic hours
column34: screening and tracing of people who might have been infected with STDs. This means people could be living with STDs for a longer period
column35: during which time they could potentially transmit them to even more people. These diseases all tend to have no obvious symptoms in their early stages
column36: which means testing is vital to prevent their spread. The CDC reports that the economic burden this is causing the American healthcare system is almost $16 billion per year. Unhealthy habits destroying Americans' health This uptick in STD cases is very concerning in a nation that is already noting unprecedented obesity rates. All of these statistics show an increasing inclination toward risky behavior – whether it's eating an unhealthy diet or having unprotected sex – without any regard for the potential health repercussions. It's not just what Americans are doing that is so problematic; it's also what they are not doing
column37: like exercising and eating a diet rich in organic fruits and vegetables .America is quickly gaining a reputation for being one of the unhealthiest nations in the world
column38: and the government looking the other way on GMO dangers and cutting funding for STD clinics is only going to create even more of a health crisis. column1: 6434;48a7d692f42188239671e6be92615c78aafcab3b;0;Daniel Barker;2016-10-27T14:00:00.000+03:00;Vermont fights the opioid epidemic by limiting prescribed painkillers;"Vermont fights the opioid epidemic by limiting prescribed painkillers
Thursday
column2: October 27
column3: 2016 by: Daniel Barker Tags: prescriptions
column4: opioids
column5: Vermont (NaturalNews) Vermont Gov. Peter Shumlin is planning to combat his state's opioid problem by limiting the number of painkillers that can be prescribed.The governor's proposal is part of his strategy to address what has become a severe crisis in Vermont over the past few years.In a statement
column6: Shumlin said:""Vermont
column7: and the rest of America
column8: will not get a handle on the opiate and heroin addiction crisis until we confront head-on the source of the problem: FDA-approved opiates that are handed out like candy.""Vermont doctors and providers have been on the leading edge of curbing the irrational exuberance with which opiates are handed out. These proposed limits will solidify that progress and help Vermont continue to lead the nation when it comes to combating this crisis."" OxyContin 'lit the match that ignited America's opiate and heroin addiction crisis' Shumlin has been outspoken regarding the opioid epidemic
column9: and believes that the easy availability of drugs like OxyContin and other powerful opioid painkillers is the driving factor behind the problem.In this year's State of the State address
column10: Shumlin castigated the FDA and Big Pharma over OxyContin
column11: a drug which he said
column12: ""lit the match that ignited America's opiate and heroin addiction crisis.""""Just a few months ago
column13: the FDA approved OxyContin for kids
column14: he said. ""You can't make this stuff up. The $11 billion a year opiate industry in America knows no shame.""The new guidelines are intended to limit the number of pills that can be prescribed ; after a minor procedure
column15: only nine to 12 pills would be included in the first prescription.Without such restrictions
column16: the amount of pills prescribed can vary widely
column17: according to state health commissioner
column18: Harry Chen. This can lead to addiction or the potential for overdose. Chen said that in 2015
column19: enough opioids were prescribed in Vermont to give every man
column20: woman and child a bottle of 100 oxycodone tablets.The proposal would also require doctors to discuss the risks of opioid use with patients
column21: and gain informed consent before prescribing painkillers. Doctors will be expected to discuss alternatives with their patients
column22: ""requiring them to consider other treatments before opioids are prescribed
column23: rather than as a last resort
column24: said Chen. How Big Pharma created 2.1 million opioid addicts Waiting for the federal government to effectively tackle the opioid epidemic is a waste of time. For decades
column25: the FDA and DEA looked the other way while Big Pharma quietly began turning a significant portion of the American public into drug addicts.Aggressive marketing by pharmaceutical companies led to the widespread use of opioids to manage long-term chronic pain – as opposed to using opioids only for acute pain or palliative purposes.Purdue – the maker of OxyContin – lied to the public
column26: saying that the time-release properties of its drug made it less addictive than other opioids. In 2007
column27: Purdue pleaded guilty to having misled regulators
column29: and ended up paying $634 million in fines
column30: but the epidemic continues.Opioid prescriptions in the U.S. more than doubled between 2000 and 2014
column31: and there are an estimated 2.1 million American opioid abusers. More than 40 Americans die each day from prescription opioids
column32: and all the federal government does is drag its feet and make promises.In fact
column33: the FDA seems to be trying to make opioids even more available – to children
column35: the FDA approved the ""limited"" use of OxyContin for children between the ages of 11 and 16.None of this may seem too surprising when one takes into account the fact that Big Pharma spent nearly $900 million in lobbying and campaign contributions between 2006 and 2015.Until we can stop the flow of money from opioid sales into the pockets of drug-makers and politicians
column36: we should expect the epidemic to continue unabated. column11: online tool that families can use to create a personalized Family Media Use Plan."" AAP's new 'screen time' guidelines The new recommendations are aimed at the unique circumstances of various age groups. For example
column12: the AAP recommends that children under 18 months should avoid screens altogether
column13: except for limited occasions
column14: such as social media sessions with grandparents.Children between the ages of 18 and 24 months may be introduced to digital media
column15: but the content should be ""high-quality programming
column16: and watched together with parents.Kids between the ages of 2 and 5 should be limited to one hour of high-quality programming
column17: which also should be watched in the presence of parents.Parents should impose ""consistent limits"" on the time spent in front of a screen by children 6 and older
column18: especially for entertainment purposes. Children should not be allowed to sleep with their smartphones
column19: tablets
column20: etc.
column21: and should have one media-free hour before bedtime.Media-free times such as during meals should be established
column22: and media-free zones in the household should be defined.Making sure kids get an hour of daily exercise and enough sleep at night is also part of the equation
column23: according to the AAP. Parenting in the digital age ain't easy As logical as these recommendations may sound
column24: implementing them may not always be easy. Most parents know that limiting their kids' online time isn't always easy
column25: and many would be forced to admit that digital media can be a helpful tool in managing children :""Parents obviously want to raise healthy children who aren't constantly glued to computer screens

column1: It is well known today that cholesterol performs several important functions in the body. One of the best important is not the most important function of cholesterol is to assist the proper regulation of the immune system. Indeed
column2: people who have a low blood cholesterol have an anergic immune system
column3: i.e. a lack of reaction by the body’s defense mechanisms to foreign substances (Vredevoe et al. 1998). In other words
column4: your body cannot fight off pathogens
column5: such as bacteria
column6: viruses
column7: parasites
column8: and fungi. Without cholesterol
column9: the different cells involved in an immune response (such as macrophages
column10: lymphocytes
column11: etc.) cannot recognize the invaders and destroy them. Interestingly
column12: it was shown that the LDL particles are the ones needed for an adequate immune response (Masterjohn 2007). These particles neutralize microbes and toxins before they cause any damage to the tissues/organs. And we call these LDL particles bad cholesterol! Without them
column13: we would be dead! Another fact is that a low blood cholesterol increases our risks of developing tuberculosis.

column1: More importantly
column2: a sufficient supply of cholesterol to the immune system is critical to eliminate cancer cells. Indeed
column3: cholesterol is needed to slow down the progression of cancer. In addition to cholesterol
column4: saturated fats
column5: like palmitic and myristic acids
column6: are also necessary for an optimum immune system. These fats are found in tropical oil such as coconut oil. Would this fact explain why Asian people have a lower rate of cancer than North Americans?

column1: Is cholesterol protective not causative of heart disease?
There is a tremendous amount of evidence to suggest that microbial infections are one of the primary drive force of plaque accumulation in the arteries of the heart (5
column2: 6). In support of this
column3: a lack of buccal hygiene considerably increases your risk of heart disease (7). Some researchers have noticed that people who suffered from a heart attack also had the flu a few days prior (8
column4: 9). It seems that those microorganisms change the structure of the blood vessels leading to inflammation and an accumulation of plaques at the sites of injury. Based on this evidence
column5: we can propose that cholesterol actually minimizes the risk of developing heart disease via the elimination of dangerous pathogens. Indeed
column6: it seems to be the case (10).

column1: It is time to end this war on cholesterol. Science is very clear; cholesterol does not cause heart disease. On the contrary
