column1: 6487;4b9a5e1698895ef7a67f8e8393fabb9690da4485;0;Nick Huxsted;2016-10-31T21:47:49.087+02:00;Homeopathy in the NHS: The Big Debate;"Keywords: complimentary medicine
column2: holistic health
column3: homeopathy
column4: nhs

column1: The Department for Health is currently reviewing whether or not homeopathy in the NHS should continue to be available through doctor referrals. Against a backdrop of funding cuts and increasing pressure to reduce costs
column2: the Government and health managers are looking at whether to add homeopathy to the NHS’s “schedule 1” blacklist
column3: a selection of products that NHS doctors are banned from prescribing.

column1: However despite consistent claims that there is a lack of quality evidence into the positive health benefits of homeopathy
column2: the NHS has spent more than £1.75m on homeopathic treatments over the last 10 years
column3: and any proposed ban is likely to have its fair share of detractors.

column1: Almost six million Brits seek the help complementary and alternative medicine (of which homeopathy is a part) with one in four wanting access to be universally available through the NHS.
The lead argument for the exclusion of homeopathic treatment is lack of evidence that supports its effectiveness
column2: with research often being labeled as “inconclusive”. However proponents for the inclusion of homeopathy argue that this doesn’t necessarily mean that there is no evidence.

column1: Dr Helen Beaumont
column2: a GP and the president of the Faculty of Homeopathy
column3: has recently stated that homeopathic treatment has a “profound effect” on patients.

column1: “It’s disappointing that at a time when the NHS is facing a funding crisis the Department of Health is embarking on a costly consultation that could prevent highly skilled clinicians prescribing a course of treatment that benefits thousands of patients each year. If the department were serious about saving money surely it should be looking at SSRIs (Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors) prescribed for mild to moderate depression in vast quantities at considerable cost to the NHS
column2: but which studies have found to be ineffective for those conditions.”

column1: George Freeman
column2: the minister for life sciences
column3: has stated that in a time of rising demand
column4: the government has a duty to ensure NHS funds are spent only on the most effective treatments. However an article in the British Medical Journal (BMJ) that examined the scientific evidence behind NHS treatments
column5: found that 46% of 2
column6: 500 commonly used NHS treatments are of unknown effectiveness
column7: and only 13% are known to be beneficial. The argument is being made that the principals being applied to homeopathy
column8: are consistent for all forms of treatments throughout the NHS.

column1: Collating research itself has also proved to be difficult
column2: with the positive effects of homeopathy often a challenge to fully quantify. The NHS is driven by targets and trial evidence using hard data (like death and disease) to determine the effectiveness of a particular treatment. Researching and recording a patients quality of life
column3: happiness and emotional satisfaction has always been much more difficult to quantify
column4: but a wealth of anecdotal evidence and studies from other European countries continue to support the use of homeopathic treatment.

column1: For example
column3: over a hundred homeopathic GP practices in Germany and Switzerland took up the challenge (1) of demonstrating the health of “chronically ill patients after eight years of homeopathic treatment”. It concluded that homeopathy is clinically effective
column4: cost-effective and safe – with the results playing an important role in the inclusion of homeopathy as part of their national healthcare scheme.

column1: Similarly the largest study at Bristol Homeopathic Hospital (2) followed the effectiveness of homeopathy on 6
column2: 500 consecutive patients over a six-year period. 70% of follow-up patients reported improved health with 50% reporting major improvement.

column1: The debate whether homeopathy in the NHS will no doubt continue. The homeopathic profession has had to face increasing criticism and hostility over recent years
column2: but with an average annual spend of £152
column3: 000 on homeopathic treatment (the equivalent of 0.0013% of the total NHS drug budget) it should be remembered that if these patients were not treated with homeopathic medicines
column4: they would have to be treated by other NHS departments with potentially more expensive
column5: conventional drugs. (1) – BMC Public Health BMC Series

column1: (2) http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16296912

column1: Tuesday

column4: staff writer Tags: Jimmy Johns
column5: endangered species
column6: trophy hunting (NaturalNews) The owner of the American fast food chain Jimmy John's is under fire after photos emerged of him smiling and giving a ""thumbs up"" beside numerous endangered species that he's hunted and killed throughout Africa over the years
column7: for seemingly no other purpose than simply to invoke death for pleasure.Reports indicate that Jimmy John Liautaud has been spending hundreds of thousands of dollars per hunting trip to gain access to these precious species
column8: including one particular ""trophy"" hunt in which he spent a whopping $350
column9: 000 just to kill an extremely endangered female Black Rhino. Graphic photos of Liautaud with this rhino and other animals are available here
column10: but be warned: these images are horrifyingly upsetting.Liautaud's trophy hunts are apparently a routine pastime of his
column11: just as they are for the many other bored millionaires out there with too much time and money on their hands who seem to get a kick out of taking out the rarest animals on our planet – beautiful creatures like leopards
column12: rhinos
column13: lions
column14: and even elephants
column15: which have the largest brains of any land animals. It's the type of thing that
column16: if more people knew about it
column17: they'd likely stop eating at Jimmy John's altogether.Mr. Jimmy John's poaching fetish has been making the media rounds
column18: and many are now calling on a national boycott of the sandwich chain
column19: which has already been exposed for underpaying its employees and treating them like slave workers. The Wall Street Journal (WSJ) reported that social media users had attempted to launch a boycott of Jimmy John's using the ""#boycottjimmyjohns"" hashtag on Twitter
column20: though the company didn't seem all that phased.Still
column22: and many in the public remain outraged over what they say is reckless and reprehensible behavior. Not only is Liautaud killing these rare and exotic animals in cold blood
column23: but he's doing so in such an utterly cruel way that even the most avid hunters would be hard-pressed not to cringe or perhaps shed a few tears.""[U]sually the animals are lured from a national park on to private property
column25: investigative writer and co-founder of The Earth Child writes
column26: noting that this is not the method Liautaud uses to kill his prey. ""Trophy hunters will leave out bait
column27: play the sounds of other animals to lure them in
column28: or a few other tactics to find their animal victims.""""Canned hunting is even worse
column29: she adds. ""It is the 'shooting fish in a barrel' version of trophy hunting . The animals are often hand raised so they are tame and don't run away. They leave food out for them one day
column30: then some coward creeps up and shoots them with a high powered bow or rifle. Sometimes they don't even have to creep. Sometimes they just shoot them from the back of a truck
column31: then go back to drinking their gin & tonic like it was just a bit of harmless fun."" Trophy hunting costs do NOT help repopulate endangered animal species One of the excuses often used as justification for expensive trophy hunting escapades is that all that cash ends up getting donated to conservation programs that help repopulate the prairies
column33: and jungles with endangered species. But this isn't actually true
column34: as only about two percent of the proceeds from these hunts ends up being used for conservation purposes.Non-trophy hunting tourism
column36: is responsible for the bulk of conservation donations -- up to 15 times than what trophy hunting contributes -- according to Heather Callaghan
column38: the claim that animals killed on trophy hunts are used to provide food for locals is also bunk
column39: as most of the carcasses end up getting left behind for scavengers. column1: 6509;d41fafd03cf31e414d0d03a52eb344a2546f1c27;0;thefitgirl;2016-11-01T23:32:00.000+02:00;Lower Back Pain: How to Treat It Efficiently;"Arthritis(inflammation of one or more joint) Illness A spine problem you were born with. Fibromyalgia (a disorder that causes fatigue and muscle pain) Compression fractures
To get quick and effective relief from back pain
column2: you can follow some tips mentioned over here to get rid of this irritating pain.

column1: Sometimes back pain is serious. In such conditions
column2: it’s obvious that you will call your doctor. But for routine and mild back pain
column3: you can do some home remedies for quick relief .

column1: Ice & Heat to the Rescue In first 24-48 hours of an injury
column2: ice is best as it reduces inflammation. Use ice for about 20 minutes on your back then take it off to give your back skin rest. If pain persists
column3: talk to a doctor. After 48 hours you can switch to heat if you prefer. But in first 48 hours when you have acute pain
column4: an ice pack is only recommended.

column1: Move Your Spines
Our body is made to move
column2: so does our spine. Keep doing your daily life activities to feel better. Go to work
column3: make the beds
column4: walk the pet. If you are in a state to do aerobic exercises such as bicycling
column5: swimming and walking then carefully do them. Just don’t overdo it. You can keep your back pain in mobile by doing so.

column1: Exercise and Stretch
Regular physical activity keeps you away from this types of pain. A simple exercise like walking
column2: running can be proved very helpful in healing such pain. It is advisable to consult your physician for a list of exercises suitable for your age and health conditions.

column1: Stretch: Apart from exercise
column2: stretch helps you recover from back pain quickly. Always stretch before any physical activity or exercise to warm up yourself. Also
column3: stretch for 10-15 minutes before going to bed. Sitting for long hours in a desk chair all day and bending forward after every other minute to see monitor or file is the reason of back pain in office goers. If you are among those people
column4: then don’t forget to stretch your legs and do office yoga to get rid of this pain.

column1: Massage Your Back

Heat some sesame oil or coconut oil on a low flame with eight cloves of garlic in it. Apply the mixture on the affected area and massage it thoroughly for at least 10-15 minutes . Leave it for 3-4 hours then wash it off with warm water or if you wish you can take a bath of warm water.
If you do not want to do so much effort
column2: then mix some camphor in your massage oil and apply it to your back.

column1: To help keep your back healthy and avoid further pain:
Sleep Well
Bad posture while sleeping often causes back pain. Always sleep on your side and firm surface rather than on soft mattresses like an amerisleep mattress. If you feel back pain on a regular interval
column2: then t here are mattresses available in the market
column3: especially for back pain patients.

column1: Always sit in a chair that is designed to keep your back straight and practice good posture when you stand.
Healthy Weight
It has often seen that overweight is the cause of back pain. Our ribs and area above the legs already bear most of the body’s weight
column2: and when you are overweight
column3: it puts extra weight on that part of our body. So
column4: eat fruits and green vegetables and avoid eating processed food. Hit gym regularly to get your body lean and toned.

column1: Also
column2: avoid lifting heavy weights.

column1: Calcium
As you know
column2: calcium makes our bones strong. It also protects your spine from osteoporosis. Eating calcium-rich foods in your diet such as milk and dairy products
column3: finger millet
column4: green leafy veggies
column5: sesame
column6: small fish with bones
column7: etc. reduce the chances of getting serious lower back pain. So
column8: increase your calcium intake.

column1: Change Your Lifestyle
If you work in an office
column2: bend forward after every few minutes and sit for longer hours then keep stretching and doing office yoga at work to avoid getting lower back pain.

6510;4d8d2980b8af7fd7dae9212c0192c2211d471f0d;0;thefitgirl;2016-11-01T23:28:00.000+02:00;Interesting & Fun Facts About Stethoscope;"Keywords: medical equipment
column2: Stethoscope facts
column3: stethoscopes history

column1: When we hear the word “Doctor
column2: ” the first image comes in our mind is a person in a white coat with a stethoscope hanging around his neck. The stethoscope has become a very common name amongst people thanks to its display in various T.V shows
column3: movies and frequent use of it by doctors. But still
column4: there are many fun facts which other people might not know about stethoscope. So here they are –

column1: 200 years old history – Yes! Stethoscopes are one of the oldest inventions which are still being used across the world by millions of doctors. Rene Laennec in 1819 had invented the stethoscope. It was a wooden instrument and looked quite different from what we see it as now.
I see your chest – Stethoscope is a Greek word which roughly translates into “I see the chest
column2: ” stethos means chest and scope mean examination.

column1: An Interesting story behind its Invention – When Stethoscope was not invented
column2: doctors would put their ears around the chest of patients and gently tap the chest with fingers. This technique would make female patients little uncomfortable. Rene Laennec was a very shy person. Once he was examining an overweight woman. He found it difficult to hear her hear sounds. To hear heartbeats of that lady
column3: he rolled a quire paper into a tube and placed it on her chest. This inspired him to make the device which we all are familiar with and called stethoscope.

column1: Google Doodle For Rene Laennec – On February 17th
column3: Rene Laennec would have celebrated his 235th birthday. To commemorate this day
column4: Google doodle marked his 235th birthday.

column1: Used To Identify If A Person Is Dead Or Not
Nowadays stethoscope is used to hear heart sounds and to determine symbols of other diseases. But initially
column2: stethoscope was designed to find out if the person in the hospital is dead or alive.

column1: It Might Be Replaced Very Soon
As mentioned
column2: stethoscopes were invented almost 200 years ago and being in use for such a long time shows that how useful and efficient stethoscopes are. However
column3: as the technology is getting advanced every passing day
column4: stethoscopes might be replaced very soon by pocket-sized ultrasonic devices which can perform multiple measurements on patients.

column1: 7201;fa4227e2230991bc7516cef837f22391b49e36a6;0;Jason Easley;2016-10-27T21:26:32.669+03:00;Trump’s Campaign Backfires As Hillary Clinton Attracts Millions of New Voters;"By Jason Easley on Thu
column2: Oct 27th
column3: 2016 at 2:18 pm Donald Trump promised that he would bring millions of new Republicans voters into the election
column4: but polling in swing states shows that it is Hillary Clinton who is getting new voters out to support her.

column1: Donald Trump promised that he would bring millions of new Republicans voters into the election
column2: but polling in swing states shows that it is Hillary Clinton who is getting new voters out to support her.

column1: Within their discussion of a new Pennsylvania poll showing Clinton leading Trump by 7 points
column2: The New York Times reported:

column1: Mrs. Clinton has an 18-point lead among voters who did not participate in the 2012 election
column2: according to our estimates
column3: which are based on a combination of the poll results and voter file data. She fares even better among white voters who didn’t vote in 2012 than she does among white voters who did. It’s a pattern that has been true across all of the Upshot/Siena surveys in Florida
column4: North Carolina and Pennsylvania.

column1: There has not been an influx of new voters who might help Mr. Trump. According to our estimates
column2: Mrs. Clinton has a 16-point lead among newly registered voters.

column1: The idea that Trump was bringing millions of new voters to the Republican Party was always a myth.

Donald Trump got the most votes of any candidate in a Republican presidential primary. Trump also set the record for most votes cast against in a Republican primary. Trump is one of the few nominees in history to have a majority of his party’s primary ballots cast against him.
Hillary Clinton is the candidate who is attracting millions of new voters
column2: and without a doubt
column3: some of those voters have been motivated by Donald Trump’s campaign.

column1: Trump was right. He has brought millions of new voters to the polls. What he neglected to tell Republicans is that they are coming for Hillary Clinton.";english;2016-10-27T21:26:32.669+03:00;politicususa.com;US;4617.0;Trump’s Campaign Backfires As Hillary Clinton Attracts Millions of New Voters;0.0;http://15130-presscdn-0-89.pagely.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/CI1o0Z3UAAA06Hi.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias

Marco Rubio.
A Democratic super PAC is injecting millions of dollars into the Florida Senate race in a bid to retire Sen. Marco Rubio.
CNN reported that Harry Reid’s super PAC
column2: the Senate Majority PAC
column3: is injecting millions of dollars into the Florida Senate race to help Rep. Patrick Murphy in his bid to defeat Marco Rubio: “This race is closing
column4: ” spokesman Shripal Shah told CNN. “Voters know that Marco Rubio is only looking out for himself and they’re going to hold him accountable for pushing a self-serving agenda at their expense.”

column1: “This afternoon Senate Majority PAC made a seven-figure transfer to Floridians for a Strong Middle Class
column2: a Florida based Super PAC supporting Patrick Murphy’s campaign. The move comes hours after Senate Majority PAC announced a record fundraising haul — $19.3 million — covering the pre-general reporting period (October 1st thru 19th) that will be filed with the FEC today.”

column1: Democrats have been divided over the strategy for handling the Florida race. Sen. Chuck Schumer canceled future spending in Florida to direct resources into Senate races in North Carolina
column2: Indiana
column3: and Missouri. Reid sees an opportunity to knock out Rubio and eliminate him from presidential contention in 2020.

column1: The retiring Senate Democratic leader has been loudly urging Democrats to spend big in Florida to end Rubio’s national political career.
According to Harry Enten at FiveThirtyEight
column2: the polling suggests that pulling out of Florida is probably the right move for Democrats
column3: but with cash to burn and a shot to beat Rubio
column4: there is a case to be made for more spending.

column1: Democrats on the ground wanted in Florida wanted more spending on the Senate race
column2: and they’ve gotten their wish thanks to Sen. Harry Reid.";english;2016-10-28T00:42:59.906+03:00;politicususa.com;US;4617.0;Democrats Are Going Back Into Florida With Millions Of Dollars To Retire Marco Rubio;0.0;http://15130-presscdn-0-89.pagely.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/rubio-water.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: 7205;310863e1be55eab3b50b1ef168476be61902a6d7;0;Sean Colarossi;2016-10-28T02:50:17.547+03:00;Trump Proposes Canceling Election
column2: Calls Black Communities ‘Ghettos’ At Ohio Rally;"Thu
column3: Oct 27th
column4: 2016 at 7:42 pm Just another day in the life of Donald Trump's presidential campaign. Share on Twitter Print This Post

column1: It was a standard day in the life of Donald Trump’s presidential campaign
column2: as the Republican nominee spent much of his time on the campaign trail Thursday making outrageous and insulting comments.

column1: This was on clear display at a rally in Toledo
column2: Ohio
column3: when Trump proposed one of his most ridiculous ideas yet: Cancel the election and just anoint him president.

column1: Video: Trump jokes: “We should just cancel the election and just give it to Trump
column2: right? What are we even having it for? Her policies are so bad!” pic.twitter.com/Stz46iDbpf

column1: — Bradd Jaffy (@BraddJaffy) October 27
“I’m just thinking to myself right now
column2: we should just cancel the election and just give it to Trump
column3: right?” Trump asked the crowd. “What are we even having it for? … Her policies are so bad.”

column1: Despite Trump’s plea to cancel the election as he continues to struggle in the polls
column2: it will be the voters who decide which candidate has the better policies – thankfully.

column1: The remark also aligns closely with other recent comments in which Trump claimed the process is rigged against him
column2: and he will only accept the outcome of the election if it’s favorable for him.

column1: But Trump wasn’t done at his Buckeye State rally. He also made sure to take a dig at minority communities.
Video: Help me out there. Did Trump just say “we’re going to work on our ghettos” before mentioning inner cities
column2: violence and African Americans? pic.twitter.com/v9KqZSLbh6

column1: — Bradd Jaffy (@BraddJaffy) October 27
Trump’s comments:
We’re gonna work on our ghettos … take a look at what’s going on where you have pockets of
column2: areas of land
column3: where you have the inner cities
column4: and you have so many things
column5: so many problems
column6: so many horrible
column7: horrible problems – the violence
column8: the death
column9: the lack of education
column10: no jobs. We’re gonna work with the African-American community and we’re going to solve the problem of the inner city … You can’t walk out the street. You buy a loaf of bread and you end up getting shot.

column1: The Republican nominee’s “ghetto” comment is the newest addition to what is the standard Trump narrative that black communities are hellscapes. This particular set of remarks comes a day after he visited North Carolina for a rally and told supporters – mostly white – that he would enact “a new deal for black America.”
In the closing days of this election
column2: Donald Trump is once again showing that there is no better version of who he is. The man who built a campaign on racial resentment is doubling down on it as this election season comes to a conclusion.";english;2016-10-28T02:50:17.547+03:00;politicususa.com;US;4617.0;Trump Proposes Canceling Election

column1: 7208;9fcbad99f3257915489a95a4223de6477eca4ffd;0;Jason Easley;2016-10-28T03:20:33.086+03:00;Retired 4 Star General Blasts Trump For Not Supporting US Troops;"A retired four-star general called out Donald Trump as unfit to be president because he has failed to support US troops.
In a conference call with reporters
column2: Gen. John Allen (Ret.) said: Trump’s remarks are not only uninformed…but it also directly undercuts the courage and the commitment of our troops. And I took great exception to this. However he feels personally about this operation
column3: he should be encouraging our efforts publicly
column4: rather than disparaging them.

column1: While [Trump] appears not to understand basic military activities
column2: it’s not clear to me that he’s interested in learning them
column3: either. Because there are a number of experts
column4: who I think…would advise him otherwise. But he seems to be confident in his knowledge. And that knowledge
column5: I think
column6: reveals a lot about what he doesn’t know.

column1: This kind of rhetoric; this kind of disrespect for our military leadership; this absence of support for our troops who are actually in combat and support for our allies who are fighting and dying every day – it means to me that this individual is not qualified to be Commander-in-Chief.
Military experts
column2: like Gen. Allen
column3: feel compelled to criticize the Republican nominee days before a presidential election because they feel like he is not supporting the troops and would be a danger to national security as commander in chief.

column1: Thanks to Donald Trump
column2: the Republican Party has become the party that doesn’t support the troops.

column1: Republicans have gone from “real America” to un-American in record time.
If a presidential nominee doesn’t respect the men and women who risk their lives for the country
column2: then he definitely won’t respect the needs of hard working Americans.

column1: With each word that comes out of his mouth
column2: Trump continues to show America the real face of the Republican Party.";english;2016-10-28T03:20:33.086+03:00;politicususa.com;US;4617.0;Retired 4 Star General Blasts Trump For Not Supporting US Troops;0.0;http://15130-presscdn-0-89.pagely.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/trump-ryan.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: 7216;9faef130560f379c7d5a1bae0612f0f7e4f2015a;0;Jason Easley;2016-10-28T20:53:11.791+03:00;Moronic Trump Campaign Thinks Reopened Clinton Email Investigation Will Save Them;"The Trump campaign is so desperate that they are openly celebrating the reopening of the FBI’s investigation into Hillary Clinton’s emails.
Trump campaign manager Kellyanne Conway tweeted: A great day in our campaign just got even better. FBI reviewing new emails in Clinton probe @CNNPolitics https://t.co/WBltG2lAK6
— Kellyanne Conway (@KellyannePolls) October 28

The problem with the idea that the emails will save Donald Trump and the Republican Party is that Clinton was beating Trump while the FBI did their first investigation into her emails. Clinton has led Trump all through the Congressional hearings into her emails. She led Trump throughout the FBI investigation into her emails. Clinton won the Democratic nomination with her emails being a story.
The point is that Hillary Clinton’s emails aren’t a big issue to the majority of voters. The people who aren’t Republicans in this election don’t care about her emails.
When compared to Trump sexually assaulting women
column2: not paying federal income taxes
column3: and being sued in two states for fraud
column4: the emails seem like a quaint political scandal from a much simpler time.

column1: There has also never been a shred of proof that Hillary Clinton did anything wrong.
Republicans can’t get past the basic hurdle of needing actual evidence to back up their email conspiracy.
Hillary Clinton is facing Donald Trump in this election
column2: and only a moron or a truly desperate campaign manager clinging on the last bit of hope that she can find would believe that the reopening of an email investigation will make a bit of difference on election day.

column1: The voters are speaking
column2: and they don’t care about Hillary Clinton’s emails.";english;2016-10-28T20:53:11.791+03:00;politicususa.com;US;4617.0;Moronic Trump Campaign Thinks Reopened Clinton Email Investigation Will Save Them;0.0;http://15130-presscdn-0-89.pagely.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/trump-shrug.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: 7233;948e705160436f03c1f35db7e45bacd8780a83de;0;Sarah Jones;2016-10-29T21:05:46.127+03:00;The Media Got Suckered Into Buying The GOP’s Bogus Clinton FBI Email Tale;"By Sarah Jones on Sat
column2: Oct 29th
column3: 2016 at 1:56 pm On Saturday
column4: the press began to figure out that they had been conned by Republicans again
column5: but not before the Clinton email news lead in swing state newspapers. Share on Twitter Print This Post

column1: On Saturday
column2: the press began to figure out that they had been conned by Republicans again
column3: but not before the Clinton email news lead in swing state newspapers.

column1: The “Clinton email” news leads in “almost every single one of the big swing state papers this morning
column2: ” observes Politico reporter Gabriel Debenedetti. The Clinton email news leads almost every single one of the big swing state papers this morning … pic.twitter.com/t3rEOwHNmM

column1: — Gabriel Debenedetti (@gdebenedetti) October 29
The “FBI investigation!!!!” spread like wildfire last night. This is the result of the press
column2: once again
column3: taking Republican smoke and claiming there’s fire.

column1: This observation isn’t mine along. The Washington Post’s Greg Sargent pointed out that there is only an upside and no penalty for doing this — for both Republicans and the press: This is how GOP hype-ahead-of-the-facts gets rewarded by media's willful perpetuation of smoke/fire effect. Zero penalty. Only upside. https://t.co/vm0ZLTrACL
— Greg Sargent (@ThePlumLineGS) October 29
Even though early polling shows there hasn’t been an impact in swing states
column2: and even though the majority of Americans have already made up their minds
column3: each time her emails are brought up Hillary Clinton falls in the polls.

column1: A Gallup poll showed that “emails” are the most Americans have heard about Clinton. Not that she is the most qualified candidate in modern history or how her policy on paid family leave might impact them — but the emails that she was already cleared on.
Even though one result of the Comey letter has been to energize Clinton supporters
column2: at a time when she was facing a likely win that can create complacency
column3: this still isn’t an acceptable practice.

column1: Republican FBI Director James Comey finds himself in the hot seat today after sending a letter that has no precedent
column2: obviously would impact an election that was then just 11 days out and is now 10 days out
column3: and actually bore no information– well
column4: that’s inaccurate. The letter bore inaccurate smoke and innuendo that has already been cleared
column5: but the damage has already been done.

column1: While Ron Fournier and others suggested that Democratic objections to this unprecedented violation of the rules by Comey was just more partisan folly
column2: the truth is even more disturbing.

column1: By even suggesting that objecting to violating a longstanding rule is partisan
column2: we are allowing the press to enable Republicans to continue pretending there is no reality.

column1: In reality
column2: no matter which side of the aisle you are on
column3: it’s a rule not to comment on ongoing investigations that could impact an election. The reasons for this are obvious and the potential ramifications for abuse are terrifying for both parties — for instance
column4: it’s obvious that the FBI is investigating the Trump campaign for coordination with Russia
column5: but we don’t headline that because the FBI hasn’t commented on that
column6: because…

column1: To do so would violate the rule not to interfere with elections.
So it’s really quite frightening to hear people claim objecting to violating this rule is partisan
column2: even as the Trump campaign is benefiting from the adherence to said rule. If the rule applies to Donald Trump
column3: it should apply to Hillary Clinton.

column1: Asking that this value be applied to both sides is not partisan.
We must stick to reality. We must not allow our need to appear objective cause us to fall so far down the rabbit hole that we enable Republicans to keep drinking the no-fact Kool-Aid.
The press did the Republican smoke is a real fire thing all through President Obama’s terms
column2: at one point claiming he was implicated in Benghazi emails because a reporter allowed a Republican aide to read him said emails — and of course
column3: it turned out that the emails didn’t say what the aide told the reporter. But that was learned much later and as everyone knows
column4: a lie travels faster than the truth.

column1: And now American voters in swing states who read papers will think the FBI is investigating Clinton.
So Comey’s letter did damage Hillary Clinton. Even if she wins the election
column2: the letter damaged her and down ballot Democrats.

column1: The media never learns. They take Republican smoke and innuendo and treat it as fact
column2: every time. They look like fools to those who know there was no there in the Comey letter
column3: but the average voter doesn’t live for political updates.

column1: The irresponsible damage is done.
The Media Got Suckered Into Buying The GOP’s Bogus Clinton FBI Email Tale added by Sarah Jones on Sat

column1: 7242;e0a849b564ff348d1b0fa6cffa66b6926c89751c;0;Reuters;2016-10-30T02:03:36.703+02:00;Concert plus campaign: Clinton turns to celebrities in homestretch;"By Reuters   7:16 pm Heading into the homestretch of the presidential campaign
column2: Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton is looking to harness some celebrity star power to help get out the vote and energize volunteers in battleground states.

column1: By Roberta Rampton
DAYTONA BEACH
column2: Fla. (Reuters) – Heading into the homestretch of the presidential campaign
column3: Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton is looking to harness some celebrity star power to help get out the vote and energize volunteers in battleground states.

column1: Jennifer Lopez will headline a free concert for Clinton supporters in Miami on Saturday
column2: giving the former secretary of state a chance to connect with the key demographic of millennials she has sometimes struggled to reach – and some visual counter-programming to the latest email controversy to roil her race for the White House.

column1: The Federal Bureau of Investigation said on Friday it is investigating more emails as part of a probe into Clinton’s use of a private email system – a late-breaking surprise that will likely continue to get extensive media play leading up to the Nov. 8 vote
Celebrity-driven events like the concert “can serve as a bit of a distraction” from the controversy
column2: said Eric Kasper
column3: a political scientist at the University of Wisconsin-Eau Claire.

column1: “It is a way to kind of take the edge off things because it tends to be more positive
column2: ” Kasper said.

column1: The JLo concert is the first in a series. Next week
column2: Clinton will take the stage with Jay Z in Cleveland
column3: and then with Katy Perry in Philadelphia on Nov. 5.

column1: A Harvard University poll this week showed that among likely voters aged 18 to 29
column2: Clinton is leading Republican rival Donald Trump
column3: a celebrity in his own right who starred in the reality television show “The Apprentice.”

column1: But turnout is a concern. The exceptionally negative tone of this year’s race for the White House has soured young Americans on politics
column2: Reuters/Ipsos polling shows.

column1: Presidential candidates have long sought to create buzz with help from celebrity pals
column2: said Tevi Troy
column3: who chronicled the strategy in his book “What Jefferson Read
column4: Ike Watched
column5: and Obama Tweeted: 200 Years of Pop Culture in the White House.”

column1: “Campaigns do it to reach out to people who are not necessarily interested in politics but are interested in pop culture
column2: ” said Troy
column3: a presidential historian who worked in the George W. Bush White House.

column1: The events are like a larger version of a campaign yard sign
column2: a way to show a “groundswell” of support behind a candidate – and a way to appeal to fans of the musicians
column3: said Kasper
column4: who has studied the intersection between pop culture and politics.

column1: “It can create a kind of psychological connection that we otherwise might not have when a politician endorses a presidential candidate
column2: for instance
column3: ” Kasper said.

column1: (Reporting by Roberta Rampton; Editing by Leslie Adler)
Concert plus campaign: Clinton turns to celebrities in homestretch added by Reuters on Sat

column1: 7249;b6fe77ce403022c1f7c46f8af557d25984a51154;0;Robert Franek;2016-10-30T18:24:32.363+02:00;Email Pandemonium and the Perpetuation of Rape Culture;"By Robert Franek on Sun
column2: Oct 30th
column3: 2016 at 9:01 am Imagine if working to end rape culture were treated with the same attention as Hillary Clinton’s emails. This is one fire that is burning strong and is a true threat to personal and public safety
column4: security
column5: and well-being. Share on Twitter Print This Post

column1: The following post
column2: written by The Rev. Robert A. Franek
column3: is a part of Politicus Policy Discussion
column4: in which writers draw connections between real lives and public policy.

column1: Even after months and months of coverage blown out of proportion and at great expense to the public in dollars
column2: psychic stress
column3: and issue coverage
column4: it seems all one has to do is put Hillary Clinton and emails together in the same sentence with claims of lying and threatening national security and pandemonium continues to break loose throughout the mass media and social media worlds. And yet despite multiple investigations and repeated explanations the pandemonium persists
column5: so much so that every time Republicans stir up some smoke the media assumes there must be a blazing fire. And sadly this is not going away anytime soon
column6: as Republicans are promising more sham investigations in lieu of actually governing as Sarah Jones reported.

column1: Republicans are already planning how to avoid being grown ups who do their jobs if Hillary Clinton is elected president. Yes
column2: there will be more toy-throwing and tantrums and best of all for the party of fiscal humiliations
column3: more wasteful spending on political witch hunts. – Sarah Jones

column1: Meanwhile
column2: women continue to come forward with painful
column3: heartbreaking stories of Donald Trump’s sexual harassment and assault. Yet
column4: instead of being portrayed as survivors who have finally had enough of the Republican presidential nominee and his lies and as women who have the strength and courage to go public with their stories
column5: they are being made into opportunistic victims and challenged for not coming forward sooner much sooner. Woefully
column6: no mention is made of the many intersecting reasons that lead many women (and men) not to report these crimes
column7: including that this is the only time when the victim is placed on trial.

column1: After walking her readers through one incident of Donald Trump’s public sexual humiliation of a woman for revenge
column2: Sarah Jones makes the following observation:

column1: If there is any good to come out of the total crapfest of the Trump candidacy
column2: perhaps it is a raised awareness that women are people and that this kind of thing is horrific but it’s not all Trump’s fault. It’s the culture’s fault because it takes a willing audience to successfully publicly sexually shame a woman.

column1: She is right. Donald Trump is despicable. Still
column2: there is cultural culpability in the perpetuation of rape culture where women are treated as objects
column3: forced into silence
column4: and placed on trial for their assailant’s crimes.

column1: This must change.
It is unacceptable in a country that places such a high value on freedom that so many are not free from sexual harassment
column2: assault
column3: exploitation
column4: and humiliation. More it is appalling that such behavior is often cheered
column5: unchallenged
column6: and dismissed. It is also inexcusable that survivors face unparalleled levels of scrutiny when they do finally come forward.

column1: It is also beyond tragic that people of faith who read the first chapter of Genesis can’t bear out the implications of men and women being created simultaneously and bearing equally the divine image.
Supposed Christian values champion and Republican Vice Presidential nominee
column2: Mike Pence is more upset over an article he didn’t read regarding voter suppression efforts by the Trump campaign than any of the horrifying things Donald Trump has said including bragging about sexual assault.

column1: These are not Christian values nor are they values any civil society should hold. Failing to call out Donald Trump’s abhorrent behavior and speech is beyond deplorable. Additionally
column2: supporting candidates like Donald Trump and Mike Pence gives validity to their wretched views and is especially shocking when done by people of faith and “family values.”

column1: As a society
column2: we must challenge the pervasive and systemic sexism and misogyny that persists in our culture. As much as we need changes in our laws (and lawmakers!) at every level of government to reflect the equality and humanity of women
column3: we need a moral revival in our collective conscience as a nation that decries every facet of rape culture from how we raise our children to the victim blaming and shaming that happens each time a survivor goes public with their story.

column1: Imagine if working to end rape culture were treated with the same attention as Hillary Clinton’s emails. This is one fire that is burning strong and is a true threat to personal and public safety
column2: security
column3: and well-being.

column1: Email Pandemonium and the Perpetuation of Rape Culture added by Robert Franek on Sun

column1: 7252;2037ca03d06791b29dcb228b882e6e48fde8e238;0;Jason Easley;2016-10-30T23:43:36.380+02:00;Fox News Gets Destroyed While Trying To Blame Hillary Clinton For GOP Email Scandal;"By Jason Easley on Sun
column2: Oct 30th
column3: 2016 at 2:37 pm Fox News Sunday's Chris Wallace tried to blame Hillary Clinton for the email scandal that Republicans created and got destroyed by Clinton campaign manager Robbie Mook. Share on Twitter Print This Post

column1: Fox News Sunday’s Chris Wallace tried to blame Hillary Clinton for the email scandal that Republicans created and got destroyed by Clinton campaign manager Robbie Mook.
This exchange between Fox News Sunday host Chris Wallace and Clinton campaign manager Robbie Mook highlighted why the email scandal isn’t working for the GOP.
Video:

Transcript via Fox News Sunday: WALLACE: The last question I want to ask you is that you’re acting as if it was the director who brought this into the election when the fact is that it was Hillary Clinton who brought this into the election.
I want to go back to the e-mail exchange on March 2nd
column3: when The New York Times broke the story about Hillary Clinton using private e-mails. We’re going to put it up on the screen.

column1: Clinton adviser Neera Tanden
column2: “Why didn’t they get the stuff out like 18 months ago? So crazy.”

column1: Campaign chairman John Podesta
column2: “Unbelievable.” Tanden
column3: “I guess I know the answer
column4: they wanted to get away with it.”

column1: Robby
column2: it was Clinton who delayed and it was Clinton who brought this into the presidential campaign.

column1: MOOK: And it is Secretary Clinton who has said this was a mistake. It is Secretary Clinton who cooperated fully with the investigation. And it was Secretary Clinton who accepted the outcome of that investigation. And what secretary Clinton is doing now is saying
column2: if there’s new information
column3: get it out on the table. Let’s get it out. These could be duplicates.

column1: Again
column2: it’s been reported these e-mails may not have been sent or received by Secretary Clinton. We don’t know anything. And this close to an election
column3: this unprecedented announcement of new information
column4: when – when
column5: again
column6: it’s been reported by Yahoo! News that – that the FBI may have not even seen it. That – that – that Director Comey sent this unprecedented letter shortly before the election when he doesn’t even know what the information is. That’s disturbing. And we’re just asking him
column7: get everything out there that he knows.

column1: Fox News has no evidence of wrongdoing on the part of Clinton
column2: so they have been reduced to whining about why she didn’t release the emails sooner. What Wallace left out was that the release of Clinton’s emails represented an unprecedented level of disclosure.

column1: Hillary Clinton didn’t cause this email scandal. House Republicans misused their Benghazi Select Committee to go on a fishing expedition for Hillary Clinton’s emails.
Robbie Mook destroyed Fox News with facts
column2: because unlike Donald Trump
column3: Hillary Clinton hasn’t worked to keep information hidden from the public. Trump has not released his tax returns
column4: medical records
column5: or an accounting of his business dealings with Russia. Trump has been the least transparent nominee in more than 40 years.

column1: Republicans and conservative media are blaming Clinton for the scandal that they created as justification for continuing the investigations of her after the election.

Clinton’s campaign manager was able to wipe the floor with the Republican talking points because at the end of the day the email scandal remains a conspiracy about nothing.";english;2016-10-30T23:43:36.380+02:00;politicususa.com;US;4617.0;Fox News Gets Destroyed While Trying To Blame Hillary Clinton For GOP Email Scandal;0.0;http://15130-presscdn-0-89.pagely.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Hillary-Clinton-Fox-News-logo.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias
7253;2f92e1f00d40c07d28796c767772578ede042382;0;Adalia Woodbury;2016-10-30T23:43:47.552+02:00;Trump Thug Chants “Jews S A” at Arizona Rally;"By Adalia Woodbury on Sun
column2: Oct 30th
column3: 2016 at 1:43 pm A Trump supporter sporting a “Hillary for Prison” t-shirt chanted “Jews S-A” in support of his candidate during a rally in Arizona on Saturday. The target was the pen of reporters who have been fodder for Trump’s rhetoric at every rally. Share on Twitter Print This Post

column1: A Trump supporter sporting a “Hillary for Prison” t-shirt chanted “Jews S-A” in support of his candidate during a rally in Arizona on Saturday.
The target was the pen of reporters who have been fodder for Trump’s rhetoric at every rally.
The context: While the crowd was chanting “USA” one man chanted “Jews S-A”. Words like that can’t be spun or read into. The intent and meaning were obvious to everyone.
Watch here on video obtained by The Huffington Post .

This sort of thing comes as no surprise considering that Donald Trump spent the last year spewing hate filled venom in every possible direction. It may seem superfluous to restate every category of people for which Trump has shown contempt
column2: but it is not.

column1: Muslims
column2: Jews
column3: immigrants
column4: labor
column5: taxpayers
column6: Latinos
column7: Hispanics
column8: Mexicans
column9: African-Americans
column10: women
column11: POW’s
column12: veterans
column13: people with disabilities
column14: Gold Star Families
column15: and the military have felt the sting of Trump’s words and the disdain in his heart.

column1: Throughout this campaign season
column2: the vitriol against Hillary Clinton saw no limit. Signs and T-shirts too disgusting to quote in this article. Chants of “lock her up” at the Republican convention and since. Trump promised his base of thugs
column3: lowlifes
column4: and haters he would weaken the first amendment
column5: strengthen the second and establish the alt-right utopia.

column1: Hillary Clinton was already the most qualified candidate in this race. She also proved to have more stamina than any previous candidate needed. Not only was she competing against a vicious and pathological liar
column2: she was competing for who we are and who we could be. For all the Trump claims that the media is rigged in Clinton’s favor
column3: it was Trump who got free advertising
column4: who framed the narrative and whose words were the primary “news” stories of the campaign.

column1: There is no doubt that Hillary Clinton will keep her promise to fight for us. She has been doing it from the beginning of this campaign. Every time Hillary Clinton called out Donald Trump’s sexist comments
column2: she was fighting for all women who were attacked
column3: humiliated and sexually abused by men like Trump. Every time Clinton shamed Trump’s horrific and disgusting comments about the Khan family she was standing up for every Gold Star family. She was also standing up for every Muslim-American. The same is true every time Clinton condemned Trump for mocking a disabled reporter or resorted to alt-right stereotypes about African-Americans
column4: inner-cities
column5: and African-American communities.

column1: Every time Trump spewed hate in whatever direction
column2: Hillary Clinton defended the target.

column1: So no
column2: this isn’t about choosing the lesser of two evils. Like every election
column3: this is about choosing our next president. More importantly
column4: it’s about voting for who we are and who we aspire to be.

7257;4b680577ad2fab93c2646891015728b46962bdab;0;Rmuse;2016-10-31T04:57:17.511+02:00;Call On President Obama to Terminate F.B.I. Director Comey on November 9;"By Rmuse on Sun
column2: Oct 30th
column3: 2016 at 9:53 pm The F.B.I. has a solemn obligation to remain neutral in political matters; the faintest appearance of using the agency to influence our election is deeply troubling. Share on Twitter Print This Post *The following is an opinion column by R Muse*

column1: As a nation of laws
column2: the American people should
column3: and most likely do
column4: demand that law enforcement officials hew as closely to the law as humanly possible and that goes double for the country’s largest investigative agency. One thing every American who has ever watched a law enforcement press conference after a crime has occurred understands is that the public never really knows the details of an investigation regardless the severity of the crime or who the suspect is. As an occasional print journalist
column5: this author can attest that asking a police spokesman for details during a press conference about what the police are doing or who they are investigating never fails to get a stern scolding about expecting law enforcement to reveal any facts during an investigation for glaringly obvious reasons. The scold always includes referral to the agency responsible for charging and prosecuting a crime after the investigation is complete and the results are handed over to the local district attorney.

column1: Apparently
column2: the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) director James Comey never got the memo that discussing an investigation publicly is verboten; if for no other reason than to maintain the integrity of said investigation and not hamper a possible prosecution. However
column3: as it turns out Mr. Comey did get “a memo ” from the Department of Justice in the form of a warning . But because he is a law unto himself and his allegiance is to House Republicans and not the Department of Justice
column4: he ignored the DOJ counsel to do a solid for the GOP less than two weeks before a presidential election.

column1: Since Mr. Comey can’t keep it (investigations) in his pants
column2: or follow long-standing law enforcement and investigative rules
column3: or take heed to Justice Department warnings
column4: it is incumbent on President Barack Obama to summarily fire F.B.I. Director James Comey on the morning of Wednesday
column5: November 9th 2016. Why should President Obama wait until the day after a general election to fire the partisan director of the F.B.I.? So as not to give the appearance of any impropriety or partisanship during a campaign or just prior a presidential election; something FBI director James Comey is apparently incapable of comprehending.

column1: This incident
column2: just like the one in July when Comey broke precedent and convened a press conference in July
column3: and then publicly testified before Congress to discuss the Bureau’s ongoing investigation is more than just a breach of precedent; it smacks of partisanship for more than one reason. First
column4: as mentioned above
column5: not only did the Department of Justice warn Mr. Comey that it was inappropriate to discuss an ongoing investigation at all
column6: much less so close to an election
column7: that warning came after the F.B.I. contacted the DOJ about going public with information the Bureau admitted it had not yet even “ reviewed .” That was precisely what Comey told his Republican buddies in a letter to Congress.

column1: In the letter
column2: Comey told congressional Republicans that the F.B.I. really had no clue whether any of the emails were related to Hillary Clinton’s private email server
column3: but what he did “ know ” for sure was that they “ appeared ” to be pertinent; even though his agency
column4: the F.B.I. had not yet examined them. So the real pertinent question is: why did Mr. Comey publicly inform Congress about emails the agency had not yet examined if he wasn’t attempting to inject some ‘ partisan drama ’ into the election that might have deleterious impact on the outcome?

column1: It is just as pertinent a question as demanding to know from Mr. Comey precisely what his motivation was in holding a press conference back in July to discuss the agency’s finding on an investigation before the DOJ weighed in
column2: or discuss that investigation in public and before a viciously partisan Republican committee in Congress. And no
column3: it was not to defend the Bureau’s decision not to bring criminal charges against Clinton; only a brain-dead moronic imbecile or partisan Republican hack would begin to think that the F.B.I.
column4: C.I.A.
column5: local sheriff
column6: or any police investigative agency has the ability to bring charges to prosecute a violation. For dog’s sake even the 1960’s fictional sheriff Andy Griffith’s hapless deputy Barney Fife was competent enough to comprehend that a district attorney’s office or Department of Justice is tasked with prosecution any violation of the law.

column1: According to Mr. Comey
column2: who was “ stung by criticism from both Democrats and Republicans ” as well as former prosecutors and “ appeared to be on the defensive ;” “ he felt obligated to inform [Republicans in] Congress ” even though the Bureau really didn’t “ know the significance of this newly discovered collection of emails. ’’ Likely because he knew they did not come from Hillary Clinton. As an aside
column3: Sarah Jones has a nifty summary of the “email” caper the F.B.I. Uncovered while investigating “ serial sexter ” Anthony Weiner’s laptop computer
column4: iPad
column5: and cellphone. And no
column6: Anthony Weiner was not sexting nasty pictures to presidential candidate Hillary Clinton.

column1: It doesn’t matter what kind of pathetic excuse Comey gave for publicly commenting on an ongoing investigation
column2: it is virtually impossible to believe he didn’t have partisan intents and purposes in publicly alerting House Republicans. As interim chairwoman of the Democratic National Committee
column3: Donna Brazile said
column4: “ The F.B.I. has a solemn obligation to remain neutral in political matters – even the faintest appearance of using the agency’s power to influence our election is deeply troubling .” Ms. Brazile demanded more information from Comey and didn’t conceal her concern over Comey interfering with the election.

column1: Mr. Comey claimed
column2: very conveniently one might add
column3: that as a died-in-the-wool Republican he contributed to John McCain and Willard Romney’s presidential campaigns in 2008 and 2012 respectively
column4: that he is not a Republican now. That was his remark back in July when he first began breaking precedent and revealing information about an investigation that was the proper purview of the Department of Justice
column5: not the Federal Bureau of Investigation. It was a suspicious “ confession ” in July and it is nearly impossible to believe in late October after he ignored Department of Justice warnings and revealed information about an ongoing investigation into a disgraced former congressman and serial sexter just 11 days before an election and before the Bureau had even reviewed anything.

column1: Comey cannot possibly remain as head of the Federal Bureau of Investigation after twice revealing information about an ongoing investigation. If Comey hadn’t taken heat for his ‘reveal’ in July
column2: and a warning from the Justice Department this week
column3: then one might just regard him as an inept law enforcement official pulling a publicity stunt for attention. But since he was warned
column4: and is not an inept law enforcement official
column5: it is more than reasonable to believe that Comey’s most recent act was a partisan political ploy that should earn him a summary termination on November 9
column6: 2016. Because firing his partisan personage just prior to the general election would break a longstanding precedent and look like a highly partisan move; something a sap like James Comey might try
column7: but not President Obama.";english;2016-10-31T04:57:17.511+02:00;politicususa.com;US;4617.0;Call On President Obama to Terminate F.B.I. Director Comey on November 9;0.0;http://15130-presscdn-0-89.pagely.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/FBI-director-James-Comey.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: 7279;d47c45fa7b53d60d664f277082ad3e89516f8cb0;0;Jason Easley;2016-11-01T22:20:57.503+02:00;Hillary Clinton Is Setting A Masterful Trap For Trump To Self Destruct;"While campaigning for Hillary Clinton in Florida
column2: Alicia Machado described in detail the abuse inflicted on her by Donald Trump at the Miss Universe pageant.

column1: Clip:
— CBS News (@CBSNews) November 1
Machado said
column2: “I was scared of him. He made fun of me
column3: and I didn’t know how to respond. He told me I was ugly. I was massive. He called me names. He called me Miss Piggy
column4: Miss Housekeeping
column5: Miss Eating Machine….For years
column6: afterward
column7: I was sick fighting back eating disorders.”

column1: Machado added
column2: “It’s clear. It’s really clear that he does not respect women. He just judges us on our looks.”

column1: It is smart to take every opportunity to remind voters that as a human being
column2: Donald Trump has consistently behaved in public like trash. He is a man who hates women and treats more than half of the population like objects.

column1: Having Machado introduce Clinton in Florida was also savvy politics. Trump has never demonstrated the personal restraint needed not to take the bait. Machado’s comments should cause Trump to blow up again
column2: and throw his dire campaign even further off message.

column1: Hillary Clinton is setting Trump with a masterful trap. No one has been better at feeding negative Trump news cycles than the candidate himself. Trump can’t resist defending himself
column2: and Hillary Clinton is setting the Republican nominee up to open his mouth and wallow in his own sexist mud.";english;2016-11-01T22:20:57.503+02:00;politicususa.com;US;4617.0;Hillary Clinton Is Setting A Masterful Trap For Trump To Self Destruct;0.0;http://15130-presscdn-0-89.pagely.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/machado-trump.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: 7283;87723b7a1d6fce3c201594c611adcc9dcc2cf64d;0;Jason Easley;2016-11-02T06:07:14.644+02:00;Sean Hannity Spreads Fake News Story To Millions As Republicans Remain Brainwashed;"By Jason Easley on Tue
column2: Nov 1st
column3: 2016 at 10:23 pm Republicans are so far removed from reality that Sean Hannity spread a fake news story on his radio show
column4: and nobody noticed the difference. Share on Twitter Print This Post

column1: Republicans are so far removed from reality that Sean Hannity spread a fake news story on his radio show
column2: and nobody noticed the difference.

column1: CNN reported
column2: “The progression of events illustrates how fake news stories expand and spread from fringe web sites to nationally syndicated radio shows with millions of listeners. In this case
column3: the fake news originated on a dubious site called “Your News Wire
column4: ” which publishes a mix of true
column5: slanted and made-up news. Then
column6: like a game of telephone
column7: by the time the story got to Hannity
column8: even the fake facts were wrong.”

column1: Some right-wing websites spread the story
column2: which turned into a tall tale that added new details at each stop. The fake news eventually reached The Gateway Pundit
column3: and to Sean Hannity’s radio show.

column1: After spreading the fake news to millions of listeners
column2: Hannity downplayed his responsibility to get the facts right
column3: “Bottom line it was brought up in an insignificant way
column4: I was dealing with more important issues like HRC crimes and lies and how CNN has been colluding with the Clinton campaign and CHEATING Bernie Sanders.”

column1: Hannity was busy dealing with real fake issues like Hillary Clinton’s “crimes” and how the election is being stolen from Donald Trump.

How Hannity put a fake story on the air is a perfect example of how the right-wing media echo chamber works. Nobody at any level bothered to check the facts because in the Republican Party belief has replaced fact. Conservative media knows that their audience wants confirmation of their beliefs
column2: so that is what they provide.

column1: It doesn’t matter if the confirmation is true. What matters is that the audience wants it to be true.
Sean Hannity is pushing fake news
column2: and he doesn’t care.

column1: This is why there is such a disconnect between Republicans and the rest of the country. Republican voters are living in a fantasy land that Donald Trump was able to exploit and ride the whole way to the Republican nomination.
The conservative media bubble is alive and well
column2: and because of this
column3: things will get a lot worse for Republicans before they begin to get better.";english;2016-11-02T06:07:14.644+02:00;politicususa.com;US;4617.0;Sean Hannity Spreads Fake News Story To Millions As Republicans Remain Brainwashed;0.0;http://15130-presscdn-0-89.pagely.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/sean-hannity.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: 7498;a6658fdbb26623c3e24eeb2a4d7c986cd1680b3e;0;;2016-11-09T16:09:00.000+02:00;PressTV-UK royals in Bahrain amid crackdown;"UK royals in Bahrain amid crackdown Wed Nov 9
column2: 2016 9:9AM Persian Gulf Britain's Prince Charles speaks to Bahrain's Crown Prince Salman bin Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa upon arriving in the Bahraini capital Manama on November 8
column3: 2016. (Photo by AP)

column1: Britain’s Prince Charles and his wife Camilla have arrived in Bahrain on a three-nation tour of the Persian Gulf states amid strong criticism of London’s continued arms sales to the repressive regime in Manama.
The plane carrying the British royals touched down at Sakhir Air Base in central Bahrain on Tuesday on the last leg of the tour
column2: which had already taken them to Oman and the United Arab Emirates.

column1: They were received by Bahrain’s Crown Prince Salman bin Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifah and then taken to a nearby palace to meet with the country’s King Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifah.
Since 2011
column2: the United Kingdom has sold 55 million dollars worth of arms to Bahrain. The year saw the eruption of peaceful anti-regime protests on the island.

column1: London has been under fire by international rights organizations for selling military equipment to Manama
column2: which is involved in a harsh and deadly crackdown on opposition activists.

column1: It was reported late last month that the UK will open a massive permanent military base in Bahrain and deploy warships to the Persian Gulf. A Bahraini protester shouts slogans during clashes with regime forces in the village of Sitra
column2: south of Manama
column3: on February 12
column4: 2015. (Photo by AFP)

column1: The military base
column2: which is the first such facility being opened by Britain in 40 years in the Persian Gulf region
column3: will be launched next month
column4: Britain’s Express newspaper reported.

column1: Britain will station around 600 military forces at the Royal Navy Facility and will deploy its warships to patrol the surrounding waters and guard oil and gas shipments in the waters.
When Britain kicked off the project in 2014
column2: Defense Secretary Michael Fallon described it as “a permanent expansion of the Royal Navy’s footprint” in the Persian Gulf. The project has bypassed the parliament.

column1: According to data released by the UK Trade and Investment in September
column2: the UK government has become the world’s second biggest arms dealer
column3: with bulk of its weapons fueling deadly conflicts in the Middle East. Loading ... column1: 7499;ffe15a162e283a021a4ad830fa6c72f0b742bc28;0;Abramo;2016-11-11T15:53:00.000+02:00;PressTV-'I can't punch Trump now he's president';"Politics US actor Robert De Niro (Photo by AFP)
Hollywood actor Robert De Niro
column2: who had criticized Americans for putting an “idiot” like Donald Trump in a position where he might become the US president
column3: now says he respects him because he is the president-elect of the United States.

column1: Before the November 8 presidential election
column2: De Niro had been enlisted along with several other actors to speak in a non-partisan video encouraging Americans to vote in. But the 73-year-old actor defied script and delivered a scathing rebuke of Trump.

column1: “He's so blatantly stupid. He's a punk
column2: he's a dog
column3: he's a pig [...] a mutt who [...] doesn't do his homework
column4: doesn't care. He's an idiot. Colin Powell said it best: He's a national disaster. He's an embarrassment to this country
column5: ” the Raging Bull actor said.

column1: “It makes me so angry that this country has gotten to this point that this fool
column2: this bozo
column3: has wound up where he has
column4: ” he stated.

column1: “He talks how he wants to punch people in the face? Well
column2: I'd like to punch him in the face
column3: ” De Niro said.

column1: But after the Republican presidential nominee was declared the 45th president-elect on Wednesday
column2: De Niro clarified that he would no longer like to punch Trump because the man was elected to the highest seat in political office.

column1: The veteran actor
column2: however
column3: told Jimmy Kimmel on his late-night show on ABC News that he is “not feeling good” after Trump’s victory
column4: which caused protests and student walkouts across the country.

column1: Protesters on Wednesday slammed Trump’s divisive campaign rhetoric against immigrants
column2: refugees
column3: Muslims and ethnic minorities.

column1: De Niro said he has to respect Trump because of his new position - which means no punching.
“Are you still going to punch Donald Trump in the face?” Kimmel asked the actor
column2: “because you could now get arrested for that
column3: I think.""

column1: “I can’t do that now
column2: he’s the President
column3: ” replied De Niro. “And I have to respect that position
column4: although we all know what he… We have to see what he’s gonna do and how he’s really gonna follow through on certain things. As we can see now in a lot of cities
column5: a lot of people are getting very upset and protesting.”

column1: Many renowned figures
column2: including some heads of states and other high-ranking officials
column3: had publicly denounced Trump -- some even used abusive language against him -- in the run-up to the November 8 presidential election. But several of them have now softened their stance and some even sent messages of congratulations to the president-elect. column2: Bahrain
column3: on November 11

column1: Bahrainis have taken to the streets in several villages and towns in support of senior Shia cleric Sheikh Isa Qassim.
On Friday
column2: a mass protest was held near Imam Sadiq mosque in the village of Diraz
column3: the hometown of the cleric.

column1: The demonstrators condemned Manama’s continued ban on holding Friday prayers in the village.
On June 20
column2: Bahraini authorities stripped the 79-year-old cleric of his citizenship
column3: less than a week after suspending the al-Wefaq National Islamic Society
column4: the country’s main opposition bloc
column5: and dissolving the Islamic Enlightenment Institution
column6: founded by Qassim
column7: and the opposition al-Risala Islamic Association.

column1: People in the villages of Shakhoura and Abu Saiba also demonstrated in solidarity with Sheikh Qassem and the political detainees despite tightened security measures.
Similar anti-regime demonstrations were held in the villages of Ma'ameer
column2: Karbabad
column3: Shahrakan
column4: Sehla al-Janoubia and Musalla as well as the town of A'ali and the island of Nabih Saleh.

column1: The protesters also condemned the Al Khalifah regime for its persecution of the Shia community.
Thousands of anti-regime protesters have held numerous demonstrations in Bahrain on an almost daily basis ever since a popular uprising began in the country on February 14
column2: 2011. The protesters demand that the Al Khalifah dynasty relinquish power.

column1: Scores of people have lost their lives and hundreds of others sustained injuries or got arrested as a result of the regime’s crackdown. 7501;b224c2cc06dfa605691509f17f60243397d93b4b;0;;2016-11-12T01:03:00.000+02:00;PressTV-Sanders to Trump: Don’t target minorities;"Politics US Senator Bernie Sanders
Former US Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders has threatened President-elect Donald Trump
column2: warning that his camp will be Trump’s “worst nightmare” if he goes after minorities in America.

column1: If Donald Trump takes people's anger and turns it against Muslims
column2: Hispanics
column3: African Americans and women
column4: we will be his worst nightmare
column5: the Vermont senator wrote on his Twitter page on Thursday.

column1: The 74-year-old senator had earlier issued a statement after the New York businessman’s victory in the US election on November 8
column2: promising to work with him on certain issues but also to oppose him should he pursue divisive and discriminatory policies.

column1: “To the degree that Mr. Trump is serious about pursuing policies that improve the lives of working families in this country
column2: I and other progressives are prepared to work with him
column3: ” Sanders said.

column1: “To the degree that he pursues racist
column2: sexist
column3: xenophobic and anti-environment policies
column4: we will vigorously oppose him
column5: ” he added.

column1: During the primaries
column2: Sanders ran a close race with Clinton and promised to continue the fight all the way until the Democratic National Convention in June
column3: where the party’s nominee was going to be named.

column1: Towards the end of the race
column2: however
column3: Sanders changed his tone and bowed out in favor of Clinton. He also appeared next to her during the DNC and supported his party opponent in the Democratic campaigns.

column1: On July 12
column3: Sanders formally endorsed Clinton after facing mounting pressure from major Democratic figures
column4: including outgoing US President Barack Obama himself. US Republican president-elect Donald Trump delivers his acceptance speech during his election night event at the New York Hilton Midtown in the early morning hours of November 9
column5: 2016 in New York City. (Photo by AFP)

column1: On Tuesday
column2: Trump stunned the world by defeating heavily favored Clinton in the presidential election
column3: sending the United States on a new
column4: uncertain path.

column1: Trump rode a wave of anger toward the elite US establishment to win the White House race against Clinton
column2: a longtime Washington insider.

column1: The New York businessman garnered 290 electoral votes in the 2016 US election
column2: while his rival and the former secretary of state received 232 votes despite winning the popular vote.

column1: Thousands of people since then have rallied in cities across the US to protest against Trump's presidential election victory
column2: condemning his controversial campaign rhetoric against Muslims
column3: immigrants
column4: women and other groups.

column1: This is while Trump said in his victory speech he would be president for all Americans. ""It is time for us to come together as one united people
column2: ” he said.

column1: The real estate mogul's election campaign had been marred by his disparaging remarks against minorities in the US. His comments include a call to ban all Muslims from coming to America as well as stopping Mexican migrants by building a long wall along the US-Mexico border.
He has also sought for a database to track Muslims across the United States and said that the US would have ""absolutely no choice"" but to close down mosques.
Trump’s proposal was widely condemned by Muslim and human rights groups as well as his Democratic rivals and many of his Republican proponents who describe the proposal as divisive
column2: counterproductive and contrary to American values. Loading ... ";english;2016-11-12T18:11:02.406+02:00;presstv.com;CA;38347.0;PressTV-Sanders to Trump: Don’t target minorities;0.179;http://media.presstv.com/photo/20161111/1c9d72fb-779f-4023-b9d2-31b6b887f179.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;state

column1: 7506;02da64409317f429af7f070c64214552a59e39cb;0;;2016-11-13T05:17:00.000+02:00;PressTV-Putin: Why would we attack anybody?;"Russia Russian President Vladimir Putin delivers a speech during an international conference dedicated to the 175th anniversary of Sberbank in Moscow on November 10
column2: 2016. (Photos by AFP)

column1: Russian President Vladimir Putin has stressed that his country’s military is not a threat and would not be attacking anybody.
“Our Armed Forces are not threatening anybody…I would like to stress once again
column2: to make sure everyone hears – not only people in this hall
column3: ” said Putin while giving a speech in Russia’s Yaroslavl on Saturday.

column1: Referring to claims that Russia might attack other countries
column2: especially its neighbors in the Baltics
column3: Putin asked
column4: “Why would we do this?”

column1: “We have the biggest territory in the world
column2: like I said
column3: everyone knows it

column1: International leaders have joined hands to create the world’s largest marine park in the Antarctic Ocean. The European Union and 24 countries have reached a momentous agreement to open the Ross Sea Park.
The deal was sealed in Hobart
column2: Australia after prolonged negotiations run by the United Nation’s Commission for the Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources.

column1: The Ross Sea marine park will cover an area of 1.55 million square kilometers and is to be protected from commercial fishing for 35 years.
The preserved area covers more than 12 percent of the Southern Ocean and is home to more than 10
column2: 000 species. Scientists and activists consider the deal a historic milestone after decades of global efforts in marine preservation.

column1: The Ross Sea is seen as one of the world's most ecologically important oceans for its unique qualities. Scientists believe that the marine park can be a platform for a deeper understanding of climate change impacts.
